loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 44 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 12 años viene dedicándose al comercio de diversos artículos según la temporada, por ejemplo; por  época escolar, vende útiles de escritorio; en el día de la madre, rosas y regalos; en fiestas patrias, banderas y escarapelas y ahora por tiempo navideño vende panteones, los cuales ofrece de casa en casa a sus clientes de confianza, vende al crédito, de esta manera obtiene los recursos necesarios para seguir adelante. Luisa trabaja diariamente caminando, de preferencia en las mañanas para lograr vender sus productos y por las tardes generalmente se queda a  cuidar a sus hijos en casa, adicionalmente tiene una granja de cerdos en su casa, por los que vela por su alimentación y después de cada cierto tiempo los vende y tiene un ingreso económico extra. Es la quinta vez que Luisa solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, además, participa activamente en su banco comunal, siendo parte de la junta directiva. En dinero requerido se usará en la compra de panetones (postre tradicional en fin de año), valorizados en 80 soles la caja  de 8 panetones, comprara 10 cajas, y lo que resta será su capital para sus próximos productos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 44 years old and lives with her two children in her own home. For the past 12 years she has sold seasonal articles such as: during the school year, school supplies; for Mother's day, roses and gifts; for national holidays, flags and rosettes; and now during the Christmas season she sell nativity scenes from door to door. She sells on credit to trustworthy customers, and thus makes enough money to continue. Louisa works every day walking around. She prefers selling her goods in the morning and usually cares for her children at home in the afternoon. She also raises pigs at home, feeding them then selling them and thus making additional income. This is Luisa's fifth loan with MFP and she has shown herself to be punctual in her payments. She is also an active participant of her community bank, as she is on the board of the community bank. She will use the loan monies to buy panettones (traditional year-end desserts), each case of 8 panettones costs 80 soles. She will buy 10 cases. The remainder of the loan amount will be saved for capital for future merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panettones for the season

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. 

Ahmad has been working in painting cars for several years. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tool kits for his garage. This is the first time that Ahmad has applied for a loan.

When he first started his business, he had difficulties in building a client network. Now, however, his clients are friends and neighbors. He decided on doing this business because he has a lot of experience.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase tool kits for his garage.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado al comercio, y en todo este tiempo ha notado que le resultó un negocio muy gratificante, por ello siempre ha persistido en ello. Entras las actividades que ha realizado, que fueron diversas, está la venta de pan que ella misma elaboraba, pero por el alza del precio de la harina tuvo que cerrar, en otra ocasión vendió abarrotes, en lo que sigue adelante, y ahora planifica dedicarse a la venta de comida de manera ambulante. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y a participar activamente en el banco comunal al que pertenece. Lucinda está usará este dinero para la compra de platos y demás implementos para comenzar con su negocio de venta de comida, los platos están valorizados en 23 soles la docena, ella comprará docena y media y con el dinero que resta adquirirá los ingredientes necesarios para las comidas que va a preparar (arroz, azúcar, menestras).
texts.en:
Lucinda is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and her six children. She has been in business since her youth and in all this time she has found that business is very gratifying and for this reason has continued in the world of commerce. She has had a number of diverse businesses such as selling bread she herself had made, but the cost of flour has risen too high and she had to close the business. She has also sold groceries, a business which she still has and is now planning to become a street vendor, selling food. This is her first loan with MFP; she is committed to being punctual in her payments and to participating actively in the community bank of which she is a member. Lucinda will use the loan monies to buy plates and other implements to open her food sales business. The plates cost 23 soles a dozen, and she will buy a dozen and a half. With the remaining monies, she will buy the ingredients she needs, such as rice, sugar, vegetable stew, for the dishes she will prepare.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and ingredients to start a food-sales business.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. Nina is 33 years old and is married, with two daughters who are ten and three years old. Nina is an elementary school teacher, and also sells clothing and cosmetics to her friends, acquaintances and colleagues, especially during the summer months (January – March) when school is not in session. She has had both sources of income for about ten years now. She also works occasionally with her aunt, sewing clothing and costumes. 

Nina is requesting a loan to travel to Lima and buy clothing and costumes for Carnaval, which is coming up in February. Her goal for the future is to have her own company to sew clothing.

loans.use: Buy clothing and costumes for Carnaval

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel H. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high school. Daniel sells electrical gadgets and electrical parts and also repairs electrical appliances at Elmina, which he has done since 1996. Daniel uses his income to take care of his aged mother and his brothers, who are still in school. Daniel will use the loan to purchase a variety of electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. Daniel plans to reinvest the new profits back into his business. The additional profits earned will enable him meet his financial responsibilities.

This picture was taken at his workshop where he does the repairs.

loans.use: Daniel will use the loan to purchase a variety of electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Grace D. from Tukuyu. She is single. Grace has been running a "genge" business since 2005. The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Grace works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Grace currently earns about 300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase sugar, rice beans, cooking oil,chili, and and other items for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the variety and quantity of her inventory. Grace thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, chili and and other items

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 44 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. 

Abdhallah has been working in construction for 30 years; his clients are primarily engineers. He has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and settle his debts. This is the first time that Abdallah has requested a loan.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work and settle his debts.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira is a single mom. She raises her son on her own and works really hard to meet all the needs of their family and pay her bills. Ira lives in Novomoskovsk and sells jean clothing in the central marketplace.  Ira has been running this business for 15 years. 

Some of her strongest entrepreneurial characteristics are integrity and consistency. Ira is very determinedand she tries to stay optimistic in every situation. She is seeking a loan of $1025 to purchase assorted inventory to help her build her sales.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 27 year old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. He has been working as a barber for five years. 

Mhamad has requested a loan of 1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase shaving equipment, a seat and gel. Mhamad has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always repaid his loans on time. His previous loans helped him expand his business. 

Mhamad is successful in his work because he is the only barber in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he wants to change his salon’s decoration.

loans.use: Purchase barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 31-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working a farmer for eight years. He sells cucumbers, tomatoes, lettuce and different types of beans. He sells his goods at vegetable markets. In the future, he hopes to expand his land and business.

Abdallah has requested a loan of 1200 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase pesticides and an agriculture plastic house. This is the first time that Abdallah has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and an agriculture plastic house.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with a four-year-old daughter, Diana. She is a small entrepreneur from Velikaya Znamenka. Galina runs a small venture selling household items and clothing in the local market. She owns a small vending kiosk which is located in the busy entrance rows of this marketplace.

Galina started her small business with the help and financial support of her family. She has been at it for three years and additional lending assistance has only added to consistent growth of her sales. Galina has repaid 5 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any problems. This time she is asking for a loan of $1025 to re-stock her merchandise with seasonal inventory.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Julieth E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Julieth M. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, 3 and 16 years old. Julieth has been running a tailoring business since 2000. Her business is making clothes such as shirts, trousers, and dresses.

Julieth works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Julieth currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to buy thread and wool for the tailoring business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Julieth thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy thread and wool for her tailoring business

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra Mané est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de banc villageois à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter de l’huile de palme, du miel, de la myrrhe en Guinée Bissau et revendre à Ziguinchor. Diarra veut renforcer son commerce Ses revenus vont permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Diarra Mané is married and the mother of four and has been a member of the village loan group in Ziguinchor for seven years. She wants to buy palm oil, honey, and myrrh in Guinea-Bissau and to resell them in Ziguinchor in order to boost her commerce. The income is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, honey, and myrrh

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon, with his wife and their eight children. He has owned a grocery shop for 22 years. 

Ali requested a loan of 1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and a new table for his house.  This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.

Ali is successful in his work because he provides variety in his shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a new table for his house.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en:
Ioana S. lives in Ucrainca village in the Causeni district. Since 1983 and till now, she has been working in the middle school of Ucrainca village, currently a primary grades teacher, but she previously worked as a teacher of mathematics and the Romanian language at a school in the same locality. She has never had any other loans through Microinvest.

Ioana, together with her husband, has a sheepfold with 40 sheep, and they want to increase the number of sheep to produce more milk because they have a little business with the milk: they sell to customers in the city who buy their milk at a lower price.

The loan was requested to increase the number of sheep.

loans.use: increase the number of sheep they tend

loans.name: Astelle

texts.fr: Astelle S. ,40 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sindian  depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à  acheter et revendre des bijoux, des habits et des chaussures. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astelle S., age 40, is married and has four children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Boucotte Sindian for six and a half years. Her work consists in buying and reselling jewelry, clothing, and shoes. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in jewelry, clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Joyce D.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Joyce S. from Tukuyu. She is a widow with four children, between the ages of 5 and 16. Joyce has been running a rice business since 2007. She purchases rice on a wholesale basis and sells it retail.

She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her brother. Joyce currently earns about 380 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Joyce thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Kéwé

texts.fr: Kéwé S., 40 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sindian  depuis 6 ans. Son activité est la vente de poisson frais qu’elle achète  par caisse pour revendre au détail. Elle veut renforcer son commerce.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Kéwé S., age 40, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village loan group of Boucotte Sindian for six years. Her work involves selling fresh fish, which she buys by the case to sell at the retail level. She wants to boost her commerce. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell fresh fish

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown children and a two-year-old granddaughter. Her family of five lives in Kamenka. She runs a business selling clothing, leather cloth goods, dishware and cosmetics in a spacious kiosk located in a busy market. Galina has been in business for twelve years.   

Galina is constantly looking for new ideas and products that would make her business more profitable, and she is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. She values every customer and tries to do her best to meet their needs. Galina has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. She has promptly repaid 20 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Galina would like to receive a loan .of $1150 to purchase additional retail items for the winter season. She is planning to purchase the seasonal clothing in bulk so she will have plenty to attract new customers. Galina works even harder now to earn more profit so she can spoil her precious little granddaughter. It should be mentioned that besides all her business virtues, Galina is also an experienced gardener growing delicious fruits and vegetables in the yard of her small house.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D., 42 ans est mariée avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Sindian  depuis 2 ans. Elle veut acheter des tissus pour confectionner des boubous traditionnels et les vendre à l’étranger. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa D., age 42, is married and has one child to support. She has been a member of the village loan group of Boucotte Sindian for two years. She wants to buy cloth to make traditional "boubous" (long, flowing garments) and to sell them abroad. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell traditional boubous

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D., 52 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Kadior depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du mil, du citron et du bois pour préparer et vendre de la bouillie de mil. Ses revenus vont permettre d’assurer une partie des charges familiales.   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Awa D., age 52, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kadior for seven and a half years. She want to buy millet, lemons, and wood to make and sell millet porridge. Her income enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, lemons, and wood to make and sell millet porridge

loans.name: Kankounding

texts.fr: Kankounding D., 49 ans, mariée est membre de banc villageois de Kadior à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du mil, du citron et du bois pour préparer et vendre de la bouillie de mil. Ses revenus vont permettre d’assurer une partie des charges familiales.   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Kankounding D., age 49, is married and has been a member of the village loan group of Kadior in Ziguinchor for seven and a half years. She want to buy millet, lemons, and wood to make millet porridge to sell. Her income enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, lemons, and wood to make and sell millet porridge

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B., 57 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Kadior depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité est la vente de jus de fruits et de «ngalax ». Elle dispose déjà d’un réfrigérateur, elle veut acheter du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du mil, de la pâte d’arachide, du bissap, du sucre et d’autres petits éléments qui entrent dans la préparation. Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer une partie des charges familiales   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Nialing B., age 57, is married and has six children to look after. She has been a member of the village loan group of Kadior for seven and half years. Her work involves selling fruit juices and "ngalax" (a dessert porridge). She already has a refrigerator. She wants to buy some monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), millet, peanut butter, bissap (dried hibiscus flowers), sugar, and other ingredients that go into making it. Her income allows her to make sure that some of the family expenses are covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell fruit juice and "ngalax"

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank.  Marina is a 61-year-old widow with eight children. Marina travels to regional markets two to three times per week, where she sells clothing, dry goods and vegetables. She buys grains, potatoes, and other products to sell in stores. Marina is requesting a loan to buy slips, aprons, and dry goods. Marina dreams that her youngest daughter will find a stable job and of expanding her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Marina es viuda, tiene 61 años y 8 hijos, Marina viaja a las ferias D. la región 2 a 3 veces por semana, en donD. venD. ropa, abarrotes, verduras y D. las ferias compra cereales, papa, productos que luego venD. en las tiendas.
Marina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. fustanes, mandiles, abarrotes.
Los sueños D. Marina son que su hija ultima tenga un trabajo estable y aumentar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy slips, aprons and dry goods

loans.name: Enes Y.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Enes H. from Mbeya. She is married with six children, between the ages of 10 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents: one is an orphan because his parents died of HIV and the other has parents who cannot take care of her. Enes has been running a shop since 2008, selling staples such as rice, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, etc.

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Enes currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and sodas. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her inventory. Enes thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and sodas

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. Apolonia is 59 years old and is married, with six children. Apolonia has a stand in the Nery Garcia Market where she sells vegetables, both wholesale and per kilo. She works seven days a week, and her daughter helps her run the stand.  Apolonia is requesting a loan to buy squash and carrots. Apolonia dreams that her children will finish their schooling and of improving her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Apolonia es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Apolonia es casada, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Apolonia tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hija. 
Apolonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo y zanahoria. 
Los sueños de Apolonia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy squash and carrots

loans.name: Frine

texts.en:
Frine is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank.  Frine is 24 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Frine sells vegetables on the street outside of her house seven days a week. Frine used to travel to different markets to buy cheeses, but she stopped after giving birth to her son, since she had to dedicate more of her time to caring for him.  Frine is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar in order to offer her customers a wider variety of products. Frine’s dreams are to own a large store and to save more money. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Frinee es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Frinee es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Frinee vende verduras en la puerta de su casa de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza todos los días, Frinee anteriormente viajaba a las diferentes ferias de donde compraba quesos, actividad que dejo de realizar porque tuvo su bebe y tiene que dedicarse mas tiempo a su hijo.
Frinee necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar para surtir su negocio. 
Los sueños de Frinee son tener una tienda grande y ahorrar mas.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
Olinda is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. Olinda is 28 years old and is married with two children. She and her husband have a management consulting firm, and work with their local municipal government. Olinda also works at night as a waitress. Olinda needs a loan of 1400 soles to cover the administrative costs of her consulting firm. Olinda’s dreams are to have more investment capital and to own her own restaurant.

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Olinda es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Olinda es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Olinda junto a su esposo tienen un consultorio de asesoria en gestión municipal, Además Olinda trabaja por las noches en una polleria como mesera. 
Olinda necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en los gastos administrativos de su consultorio. 
Los sueños de Olinda son capitalizarse, tener un negocio propio en el rubro de comidas.

loans.use: Pay administrative costs of consulting firm

loans.name: Valentina J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Valentina M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with six children between the ages of 20 and 30. Valentina has been running a crop-selling business since 1985. This client’s business is purchasing crops from villagers on a wholesale basis and selling them retail.

She works at the business for 9 hours per day, 7 days per week. Valentina currently earns about 150 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more rice and maize for re-selling. In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing such varieties of cereals as beans and wheat. Valentina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  more  rice and maize for re-sale

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. Brigida is a 54-year-old widow and has three children. Brigida travels to different regional fairs, where she sells clothing, dry goods and other special order items.  Brigida needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy sweaters, aprons and skirts.  Brigida’s dreams are to open a general store with a wide variety of merchandise in a fixed location. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Brigida es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos. 
Brigida es viuda, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Brigida viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa típica, abarrotes y todo cuanto le piden. 
Brigida necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, mandil, faldas. 
Los sueños de Brigida son abrir una tienda surtida y con local estable.

loans.use: Buying sweaters, aprons and skirts

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata F. est une femme mariée. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt acheter des tissus afin d’en faire des robes qu’elle va vendre. Elle projette aussi de préparer de l’encens traditionnel afin de le commercialiser. Cette activité va lui permettra de  mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata F. is married. She will use this loan to buy cloth which she will make into dresses and then sell. She also plans to make traditional incense to sell. In this way she will improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth to make dresses and then sell as well as make incense for resale.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. Ana is 34 years old and is the single mother of one son. Ana travels to different regional fairs once a week to buy potatoes, peas and grains, which she then brings to the city of Pisco; she stays there for a few days. Ana sometimes sells in one of Ayacucho’s markets as well. Additionally, Ana grows peas. She needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy fertilizers.  Ana dreams that her children will get ahead in life, finish their studies, and increase the productivity of their land. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc. 
Ana es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Ana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región una vez por semana en donde compra papa, arveja, cereales que luego los transporta a la ciudad de Pisco en donde se queda algunos días, en algunas oportunidades también vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Ana se dedica a la agricultura de arverja. 
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fertilizantes. 
Ana sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante, culminen sus estudios y mejorar la producción de sus tierras.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio A. está muy agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito, el cual pudo poner la losa en un cuarto de la vivienda.
Pero le esta haciendo falta a otro cuarto que construyo la losa de concreto y así  tener la casa ya terminada , es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo préstamo y así poder realizar su mejora.
Don Gregorio A. trabaja en una empresa como operador de una maquina de constricción, este es su ingreso de su familia. Cuando visitamos la vivienda del señor Gregorio no se encontraba es por eso que en la foto esta su esposa la señora Teresa Vazquez quien nos atendió.
texts.en:
Mr. Gregario A. is very grateful for the great help that he was given in his last loan, which let him install flooring in one room of his house.

However, the other room that he built needs concrete flooring, and when that room has flooring the house will be finished. This is why he is asking for your cooperation for a new loan, this way he can make the improvements a reality.

Mr. Gregario A. works for a business and operates construction equipment; this job provides an income for his family. When we visited Mr. Gregario's house, he was not at home, as a result, his wife Mrs. Teresa Vazquez met us and is in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a concrete floor

loans.name: Bané

texts.fr: Bané S. est une femme mariée, mère d’un enfant. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux et ainsi améliorer leurs conditions de vie. Elle projette d’acheter en gros des produits d’entretien qu’elle va revendre en détail
texts.en:
Bané S. is married and has one child. She is asking for this loan to pay for her family's needs and to improve their living conditions. She plans to buy household cleaning products in bulk which she will then sell retail.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household cleaning products in bulk to retail.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: La dame Fatou N. est mariée, mère de 07 enfants. Elle veut avec ce prêt faire un petit commerce de différents produits d’entretien ménagers. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de s progéniture.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou N. is married and has seven children. She is asking for this loan to start a small business selling a variety of household cleaning products. This will allow her to improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of household cleaning products in bulk to sell retail.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa KOUATE est une femme mariée, mère de 03 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt mener un commerce de jus de fruits et aussi en même temps de pâte d’arachide, de poisson séché et d’huile de palme. Elle va acheter en gros tous les ingrédients nécessaires et préparer elle-même ses jus qu’elle rafraîchit. Ceci lui de permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux
texts.en:
Issa KOUATE is married and the mother of three children. She will use this loan to open a fruit juice business as well as trade in peanut paste, dried fish and palm oil. She will buy the necessary ingredients in bulk and prepare the refrigerated juices herself. This will allow her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell fruit juices.

loans.name: Tania Elena

texts.es:
La señora Tania V. es originaria de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a laborar en el mercado central vendiendo variedad de productos y granos básicos los cuales los ha venido comercializando desde hace treinta largos años y habiendo sido este el sustento de su hogar de habitación por todo este período.

Hoy en día es importante destacar que ella ha sido una fiel cliente de Ceprodel por lo que ha realizado 54 créditos habiéndolos cancelado en tiempo y forma. Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el préstamo número 55 el cual lo ocupará para la compra de los granos básico y de esta forma continuar en el mejoramiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tania V. is originally from the city of León, Nicaragua, where she works in the central market selling a variety of products and basic grains. Tania has been selling goods for thirty years, which has sustained her home throughout this period. Today, it is important to note that Tania has been a loyal Ceprodel customer, which has made 54 loans to Tania that were repaid in a timely manner. Tania is currently seeking support for her 55th loan from Ceprodel, which she will use to purchase basic grains and thus continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
El señor Bonifacio P. tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de venta de comida preparada este negocio y el ingreso de su trabajo como maestro son para darle lo mejor a su familia.
Al local le está haciendo falta el techo pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en esta mejora, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder colocar el techo de lámina a su negocio y así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes.
Don Bonifacio P. y su esposa la señora Claudia Arizpe son los que atienden el negocio, el día que realizamos la visita del negocio solo estaba su esposa quien nos atendió.
texts.en:
Mr. Bonifacio P. has had his ready-made food business for more than 10 years. This business and the income of his managerial position give a better life to his family.

His business's building needs a roof, but at this time he does not have the necessary capital to invest in this improvement. This is why he is asking for a loan, so he can install a roof on his business, and, therefore, he will be able to better serve his customers.

Mr. Bonifacio P. and his wife Mrs. Claudia Arizpe both run the business, the day that we visited the business, only his wife was present.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install laminate flooring

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Carolina C. esta muy agradecida por su gran apoyo en el préstamo anterior para surtir su negocio, “gracias a dios e podido invertir mas en mecánica y mis ventas han aumentado.”
En este otro crédito espero contar con su cooperación ya que necesito terminar la construcción de los cuartos en la segunda planta que, son para mis hijos ya que el negocio ocupa gran parte de la casa y ellos necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina C. is very grateful for your great help with her last loan to support her business. "Thank God to be able to invest more in machinery and my sales have increased."

In this other loan I hope for your cooperation because I need to finish the construction of the rooms in the second building. They are for my children; because the business takes up a large part of the house, they need their own space.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install concrete flooring

loans.name: Ariel Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime se dedica a la elaboración de cuadernos, trabaja con su esposa y sus hijos ya que con este negocio solventan todos los gastos de su familia
Su domicilio y taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz..
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente i es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
El crédito será destinado será destinado para la compra de materia prima, (papel por resmas y carton).
texts.en:
Jaime makes notebooks. He works with his wife and children and with this business they meet their family expenses. His home and workshop are located in the Alto Obrajes neighborhood of La Paz city. This is the fifth loan with Impro, and his history qualifies him as a “1 client” which means he has a good payment history on his loan. The loan will be used to buy materials (reams of paper and cardboard).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa C. es originaria de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a su negocio de venta de comestibles como lo es pan, galletas, atoles, golosinas entre otros. A este negocio se dedica desde hace 19 años y se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante que a pesar de los tiempos o circunstancias siempre ella se encuentra trabajando.

La razón por la cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de pan, golosinas, galletas y atoles. Por esta razón espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa C. is originally from the city of León where she sold food such as bread, cookies, atole (a traditional hot cornmeal beverage), and candy, amongst others. She was in this business for 19 years and distinguished herself as an excellent businesswoman, who no matter the times or circumstances always found work. Rosa has turned to CEPRODEL for a loan that would permit her to buy bread, candy, cookies and atole. She hopes that this loan will be granted and will improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. Florentina is 50 years old and is married with three children. She has a stand in the Nery Garcia Market, where she sells vegetables both in bulk and per kilo. She works seven days a week. Florentina also fattens up cows on her land in the district of Sachabamba.  Florentina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy food for the her cows. Florentina’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees, to have more livestock, and to produce milk and cheese. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Florentina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua.
Florentina es casada, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Florentina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en  donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Florentina se dedica al engorde de vacuno en sus tierras de Sachabamba. 
Florentina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el engorde de vacuno. 
Los sueños de Florentina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener mas ganado y producir leche y queso.

loans.use: Buying cow feed

loans.name: Clariza

texts.es:
La señora Clariza R. se desempeña como vendedora de refrescos naturales preparados por ella misma y además vende gaseosas, jugos y agua estando ubicada en el mercado central de la ciudad de León desde hace varios años. 

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, la venta de refrescos de la señora Clariza requiere con urgencia la compra de las gaseosas y la compra de las frutas para preparar los refrescos y es por esta circunstancia que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita dichas compras para su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Clariza R. is a seller of natural refreshments, which she prepares herself. In addition, she sells sodas, juices and water in the central market in the city of León, where she's been for several years. As it is for all growing businesses, the sale of Clariza's refreshments urgently requires the purchase of sodas and fruits needed to prepare the snacks. It is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow her to make these purchases for her business that so greatly requires the investment.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and fruit to make refreshments

loans.name: Miriam Isabel

texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. Miriam is 33 years old and lives with her partner and their child. She travels to regional markets twice a week to sell clothing and shoes, which she buys in Lima. Miriam also has a small store in her house. Miriam needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy school uniforms, since back-to-school season is rapidly approaching. Miriam’s dreams are to buy a car to transport her merchandise and to provide her children with a good education. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Miriam es socia del banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hijos, Miriam viaja a las ferias de la región 2 veces por semana en donde vende ropa, zapatos, productos que adquiere de la ciudad de Lima. Además Miriam tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. 
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes para la campaña escolar que esta cercana. 
Los sueños de Miriam son comprar un carro para transportar su mercadería, y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying school uniforms

loans.name: Ignacia Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora Ignacia R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos varios ofrecidos en su pulpería donde con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Una de las situaciones que ella está atravesando es que necesita el dinero para la compra de los productos de pulpería y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de estos productos para la pulpería.
texts.en:
In León city Mrs. Ignacia R. sells various products in her general store where, with great effort, she has been able to provide for her family that so needs her support. One of the situations that she is confronting is that she needs money to buy products for her store and therefore she has sought the support from CEPRODEL to receive a loan that will enable her to buy these products for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 53 years old and married with one child. Delia sells clothing on credit to friends, family members and neighbors. She also sells catalogue cosmetics.  Delia needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy t-shirts, shirts and sheets. Delia’s dreams are to get ahead in life and sell more products in each of her businesses. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Delia es socia del banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua. 
Delia es casada, tiene 53 años y 1 hijo, Delia venD. ropa que ofrece a amigos, familiares, vecinos, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Delia venD. cosméticos por catálogos. 
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. polos, camisas, sabanas. 
Los sueños D. Delia son salir adelante, aumentar con mas productos sus negocios.

loans.use: Buying t-shirts, shirts and shoes

loans.name: María Dora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora María Dora B. se dedica a su negocio de salón de belleza habiendo aprendido este arte desde muy jovencita y al darse cuenta que tenía esta habilidad logró poner su negocio propio.

Es visitada por muchos clientes que hacen uso de sus servicios como lo son corte de cabello, limpieza fasial, tratos especiales con el cabello, entre otros. Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de la solicitud de un crédito para la compra de los productos de belleza y de esta forma continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In León city María Dora B. has a beauty salon, having learned this profession at a young age and upon realizing that she had this ability she strived to open her own business. She is visited by many clients that use her services such as haircuts, facials, special hair treatments and more. Today she seeks the support from CEPRODEL through a loan that will enable her to buy beauty products and in this way continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is 43 years old and married with eight children. Marcelina has a store where she sells grains and dry goods. She runs the store from her home in the city of Palmapampa, which is located eight hours from the city of Ayacucho in the Ayacuchan jungle. Marcelina also has a small store in her home in the city of Ayacucho. Marcelina needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy general dry goods, like rice and sugar.  Marcelina dreams of saving money for her children’s education, of finishing construction on her house, and of improving her business. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc. 
Marcelina es casada, tiene 43 años y 8 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en su casa que se ubica en la ciudad D. Palmapampa que se ubica a 8 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en la selva ayacuchana, en donD. venD. cereales y abarrotes. Además Marcelina tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa D. Ayacucho. 
Marcelina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes en general. 
Marcelina sueña con ahorrar para educar a sus hijos, construcción D. su casa y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, and other dry goods

loans.name: Heimy Lucía

texts.es:
Heimy es una joven de 26 años de edad que con una muy buena iniciativa, decidió iniciar su negocio de pulpería estableciéndolo en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de León.

Ella inició el negocio con pocos productos pero a medida que vino invirtiendo en él logro salir adelante ofertando mayores cantidades y esto se lo debe gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido la compra de dichos productos para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Heimy is a 26 year old young woman with very good initiative. She decided to open a general store in her home in León city. She began her business with few products but as she invested in it she was able to expand, offering greater quantities and this is due to the support provided by Ceprodel which has enabled her to buy the products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
El señor Francisco M. se dedica a laborar en la ciudad de León brindado servicios de reparación de televisores, radios, abanicos, planchas entre otros habiéndose destacado como radiotécnico o servicios electrónicos.

La situación que hoy en día atraviesa el señor M. es que necesita invertir en la compra de repuestos para su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel confiando en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio de servicios electrónicos.
texts.en:
Francisco M. works in the city of León offering repair services for TVs, radios, fans, and irons, among other things, having distinguished himself as an electronics repairman, or provider of repair services. Mr. M. now faces the need to invest in the purchase of supplies for his business and for this he has turned to Ceprodel, trusting that his loan will be granted so he can advance his electronics' repairs business.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jasinta

texts.en:
Jasinta is a member of the Imasumacc (“How Beautiful” in Quechua) Village Bank. Jasinta is 67 years old and is married with ten children. Jasinta sells firewood from her home, and also makes yarn from wool, which she then sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, she sells candy on the street. Jasinta needs a loan of 900 soles to buy firewood. Jasinta dreams of improving and expanding her businesses and of saving enough for the future. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Jasinta es socia del banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua. 
Jasinta es casada, tiene 67 años y 10 hijos, Jasinta vende leña en su casa, también hace hilados a mano de lana de animales que luego lo comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Jasinta vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad. 
Jasinta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña. 
Los sueños de Jasinta son mejorar sus negocios, hacer crecer su negocio y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.

loans.use: Buying firewood

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda U. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería ubicado en el mercado central de la ciudad de León donde se ha destacado como buena comerciante de diferentes productos y también de granos básicos como lo son arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros.

El motivo por el cual la señora Esmeralda ha llegado a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual comprar los productos para su pulpería. Es por esto que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a estos créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual le han beneficiado grandemente en su negocio.
texts.en:
Esmeralda U. owns a general store located in the central market in the city of León, where she has stood out as a trader of different products and also of basic grains like rice, beans, and sugar, among others. The reason for which Esmeralda has arrived at Ceprodel, a Kiva partner, is to benefit from a loan which she will use to buy products for her store. It is because of these loans from Ceprodel that she has been able to advance with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Fredy Gustavo

texts.es:
Fredy O. se destaca en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de León en su negocio de venta de refrescos como lo son  gaseosas, jugos y agua los cuales él mismo comercializa con mucho esfuerzo y con dedicación ambulantemente por las calles de dicho mercado y en su bicilceta.

La razón por la cual el señor Fredy O. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de las bebidas y por esto espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito sea otorgado y así bridar las condiciones de vida necesaria a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredy O. is well known in the central market in León in his business selling drinks like sodas, juices, and water, which he markets with much effort and dedication as a street vendor and on his bike. The reason Fredy O. has looked for the support of Ceprodel, a Kiva partner, is to receive a loan which will allow him to buy these drinks. For this he hopes his loan will be granted so he can offer the quality of life necessary for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, juices, and water

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: El grupo "15 D. Diciembre " esta integrada por personas D. negocio D. diferente rubro y representados por la señora SonI.. Las socias integrantes desempeñan diferentes actividades como a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta D. comida y tienda D. abarrotes;  los socios participantes también tienen comercios pequeños, como venta D. cinturones, billeteras y comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencI. D. la oferta y la demanda espacialmente en el sector comercio pero los socios siempre tratan D. estar con la mercadería nueva para poder cumplir con la demanda D. productos y ofrecer productos D. buena calidad y a abajo precio. El crédito esta destinado para incrementar su mercadería, comprar material D. trabajo y a la compra D. herramientas para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos. Los socios (as) participaron con anterioridad en grupos diferentes demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos, por lo conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The "15 D. Diciembre " group is maD. up of people owning a variety of different types of businesses. They are represented by SonI.. The women of the group work selling cosmetics from catalogues, selling food and running their grocery stores; the men of the group also have small businesses such as selling belts, wallets and food. As in any commercial setting, there is always competition in sales and in supply but all the members try to offer new products in order to satify the demand for their products and to ensure they offer good-quality products at a good price. The loan will be used to bolster their stock, buy materials for their businesses and the purchase of tools to improve the quality of their products. The members have been part of other groups previously and have demonstrated their responsibility, having repaid previous loans in full: they are familiar with working as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es: Las socias de la banca comunal “Nuevo Renacer” pertenecen a la zona del barrio las pampitas y están representados por la señora Zulma,  la mayoría de las socias tienen sus pequeños negocios en su zona.  Como nexo consanguíneo esta la familia céspedes E. y de afinidad ninguno. Las socias realizan diferentes actividades económicas,  como venta de ropa, cosméticos  zapatos, joyas, y el socio participante atiende su pensión de comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda especialmente en el sector comercio pero ellos saben desenvolverse en el ámbito comercial. El crédito esta destinado para  el incremento de mercadería y al mejoramiento de los ambientes de trabajo. Los socios (as) no tienen mucha experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios pero es un grupo bastante dinámico y dispuesto a asumir la responsabilidad que implica un financiamiento grupal.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “New Rebirth” belong to an area of the neighbourhood Las Pampitas, and they are represented by Señora Zulma. Most of the members have small children in the neighbourhood. As a blood link, there is the family, raising the field, and absolutely no affiliations. The members do different economic activities, like selling clothing, cosmetics, shoes, jewelry, and the members participate in order to have their allowance of food. As in all commercial areas, there always exists supply and demand, especially in the commercial sector, but they know how to cope with the commercial ambiance. This loan would be destined to increase merchandise and improve working conditions. The members don’t have much experience in working with solidarity groups, but it is a reasonably dynamic group and disposed to assume the responsibility that is implied in group finances.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Guapuru Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Guapurú",  presentan  un  nexo consanguíneo entre la familia Aguilar céspedes y D. afinidad  ninguno.  El banco comunal esta constituido con socias participantes que viven en la zona y se conocen entre si, la mayoría D. ellas desempeñan su actividades económicas, como vendedoras ambulantes. Las socias realizan diferentes actividades económicas,  como venta D. ropa,  zapatos, joyas, y los  socios participantes prestan servicios D. albañilería y el otro como mecánico. Pese a la competencia existente las socias siempre saben como salir adelante en sus puestos D. venta. El crédito financiado esta destinado para el incremento D. mercadería, comprar material  y compra D. herramientas para desempeñar mejor su trabajo. Una mayoría D. las socias ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad en anteriores ciclos y algunos miembros conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank “Guapurú” have a blood link between the family Aguilar Céspedes, and no affiliations. The community bank is maD. up of participants who live in the area and who are known to each other. Most of them work in economic activies, like in open market sales. The members do different jobs, like selling clothing, shoes, jewelry, and the members give services to the blacksmith and others as a mechanic. Due to their existing competencies the members know they will improve their lives with their kiosks. This loan is destined to increase merchandise, to buy materials and to buy tools in order to better do their work. Most of the have had loans in previous groups and some members know the work of solidarity groups.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Las socias del "El Carmen" están representados por la señora Blanca y son un grupo muy diverso en la cual existe un parentesco consanguíneos entre la familia R. M. y Egüez J. pero ambas familias poseen ingresos totalmente independientes. Las socias si bien viven en diferentes zonas pero sus actividades económicas lo realizan alrededor de la casa de reuniones y todas se garantizan entre si. Las socias integrantes desempeñan diferentes actividades como promotoras de cosméticos, venta de comida y tienda de abarrotes;  los socios se dedican al transporte público rural. Los miembros del grupo están concientes de la competencia desleal que existe en el M. así como la diversificación de precios, pero ellos (as) tienen experiencia en el manejo de mercadería y en la venta de productos por lo que no les preocupa la competencia. El crédito esta destinado para incrementar su mercadería y material de trabajo. Los socios (as) cursan su segundo ciclo junto por lo que tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios como lo demostraron con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The member of "El Carmen" are represented by Blanca. This is a very diverse group in which a number of the members are related: there is kinship between the R. M. and Egüez J. families, but both families have independent sources of income. The members live in different areas but they conduct their business close to their group meeting home and they are guarantors for one another. The women of the group have a variety of businesses such as selling cosmetics, selling food, owning a grocery store; the men are rural public transportation drivers. The group members are aware of the unfair competition that exists in the market as well as the wide range of prices, but they are experienced at handling merchandise and in sales and are not concerned about the competition. The loan is intended to increase their goods and work materials. This is the members' second group loan: they have experience working cohesively together as they have shown with their responsibility and their honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.en:
The Diamantes (“Diamonds”) Village Bank is beginning its fourth loan cycle with 21 group members.  The group members are involved in a variety of businesses. They sell plastics, cell phones, dry goods, clothing, gifts, cosmetics, sweets, grains and animals. Some sell from home or on the street, while others sell from catalogues or on special order.

Viviana is 35 years old and lives with her partner and their child. Viviana has a store in her home, where she sells vegetables and dry goods with the help of her mother. Viviana needs a loan of 300 soles to buy rice and sugar.  Patricia is 35 years old and single. She sells catalogue cosmetics on credit to friends and family members. Patricia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy lipliner and perfumes. Felicitas is 63 years old and married with five children. Felicitas sells clothing in different regional markets, to which she travels every week. Felicitas buys cheese at these markets and resells it from door to door. Felicitas needs a loan of 600 soles to buy baby clothes. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, of 300, 600, 900 or 1000 soles. The group is requesting a total of 11,800 Peruvian Soles.  They will use the loans to buy rice, sugar, milk, cheese, grains, meat, t-shirts, sweaters, lotions, vegetables and sweets.  The group members dream of expanding their businesses, of opening their own stores, and of sending their children to school to study professional careers. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

El Banco Comunal Diamantes inicia su cuarto ciclo con 21 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. plásticos, celulares, verduras, abarrotes en general, ropa, regalos, carne, cosméticos, golosinas, cereales, venta D. animales. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente y también a través D. catálogos y pedidos. 
Como es el caso D. Viviana que es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Viviana tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. verduras, abarrotes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su mama. Viviana necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar. 
Por otro lado Patricia es soltera, tiene 35 años y vive con su padre, Patricia venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares y venD. al crédito. Patricia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lápiz labial, perfumes. 
Mientras que Felicitas es casada, tiene 63 años y 5 hijos, Felicitas venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. la región a donD. viaja todas las semanas y D. las ferias compra quesos que venD. D. casa en casa. Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa D. bebe. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 11,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, quesos, cereales, carne, polos, chompas, perfumes, cremas, verduras, golosinas. 
Los sueños D. las socias son hacer crecer sus negocios, tener una tienda, educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, milk, cheese, grains, meat, t-shirts, sweaters, lotions, vegetables and sweets.

loans.name: Virgen De Chaguaya Group

texts.es: En el grupo "Virgen de Caguay" esta representado por la señora Jacinta, dentro del grupo existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre la señora Giovanna uy el señor Iván ellos son hermanos pero ambos tienen ingresos totalmente independientes uno del otro. Los socios (as) tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, carne roja,  jugos caseros, frutas, transporte público, venta de alfombras y cosméticos. El crédito esta destinado al incremento de mercadería e insumos para la venta así como al mejoramiento de las herramientas de trabajo. La mayoría de los socios cuentan con buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras entidades financieras por lo que conocen de grupos solidarios, en general alguno de los miembros del grupo ya trabajaron con la fundación Agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad y cumpliendo a la hora de los pagos del financiamiento
texts.en:
The group "Virgen de Caguay" is represented by Jacinta. Two members of the group are related: Giovanna and Iván are siblings but their incomes are entirely independent. The members have a variety of businesses: food sales, red meat, homemade juices, public transportation, carpet sales and cosmetics' sales. The loan will be used to buy more goods and foodstuffs for resale as well as to improve the tools for work. Most of the members have a good credit history with other financial institutions known as solidarity groups. Some of the group members have already worked with Agrocapital and shown that they are responsible, having repaid previous loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Domingo De Ramos Group

texts.es: El grupo "Domingo D. Ramos" esta conformado por doce socios en el cual existe solamente un parentesco consanguíneo siendo madre la señora Juana D. la señora Paola Lorena, el grupo esta representado por la señora Roxana Vanesa. Los socios (as) D. este grupo son comerciantes D. la feria la víbora negra y vecinos del barrio san José por lo que se dedican al comercio D. productos como la ropa y la comida, alguno D. los socios se dedica al transporte publico en los días donD. no existe una demanda alta en el mercado obteniendo así ingresos extras para el sustento D. la familia. El crédito D. los socios esta destinado exclusivamente al crecimiento sus comercios en materiales e insumos así como para la reparación D. sus puestos D. venta. Este grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos, como siempre pasa algunos socios no cumplieron con los pagos a su debido tiempo y fueron sacados del grupo para no perjudicar en este nuevo ciclo.
texts.en:
The "Domingo D. Ramos" group is maD. up of 12 members of which two are related: Juana is Paola Lorena's mother. The group is represented by Roxana Vanesa. The member are merchants in the "Vibora Negra" market and neighbours in San José. They sell products such as clothing and food; some of them are in public transportation when the market is quiet so that they can earn extra money to support their families. The loan will be used exclusively to expand their businesses by buying goods and foodstuffs as well as in repairing their display stalls. This is the group's third cycle. They have demonstrated their responsibility in previous repayments. As always happens, some ex-members did not repay their portion on time and they were ejected from the group so as not to prejudice this new cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: 8 De Setiembre Group

texts.en:
The 8 D. Septiembre Village Bank is beginning its sixth loan cycle with 19 group members. The group members live in the Acosvinchos District, a farming community located 90 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho.  The group members have a variety of businesses. Some sell firewood, dry goods, grains, shoes, meat, clothing, and animals; others work as carpenters or bake bread.  They sell their wares from home, on the street and in the city of Ayacucho.  Isabel is 31 years old and is married with two children. Isabel has a dry goods store in her home, and she and her husband also make terra cotta roof tiles, which they also sell from home. Isabel needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar.  Juana is 36 years old and is married with four children. Juana buys grains from different local producers. After buying a truckload full of grains, she brings it to the city of Ayacucho to sell. Juana also has a farm. She needs a loan of 600 soles to buy wheat and corn.  Aurora is 39 years old and is married with four children. Aurora sells meat. She buys the animals in nearby villages, slaughters them herself, and sells the meat in the local market. Aurora and her husband also sell sandals maD. from car tires, which are commonly worn by people who live in the countrysiD.. Aurora needs a loan of 300 soles to buy more of these sandals.  The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 450, 600, 900 or 1000 Peruvian Soles. These loans will be used to buy sandals, wheat, flour, sugar, sneakers, clothing, and to pay farmhands.  The group members dream that their children will grow up to be working professionals, of improving their businesses, and of having more investment capital. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

El Banco Comunal 8 D. Setiembre inicia su sexto ciclo con 19 socias, las socias viven en el distrito D. Acosvinchos que se ubica a 90 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, donD. la población se dedica a la agricultura.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. leña, abarrotes en general, cereales, elaboración D. panes, calzados, carne, ropa, venta D. animales y brindan servicios D. carpintería. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente y también lo llevan a la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 
Como es el caso D. Isabel que es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Isabel tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, también junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. tejas que venden en el mismo lugar. Isabel necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar. 
Por otro lado Juana es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Juana compra cereales D. los diferentes pueblos luego D. acopiar los transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. lo comercializa, Juana también se dedica a la agricultura. Juana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. trigo, maíz. 
Mientras que Aurora es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Aurora venD. carne, los animales los compra D. los pueblos los benéfica y venD. en la feria D. su distrito. Además Aurora junto a su esposo venden ojotas. Aurora necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ojotas. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 10,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. ojotas, trigo, maíz, harina, azúcar, arroz, zapatillas, ropa y para el pago D. los peones. 
Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, tener mas capital.

loans.use: Buying sandals, wheat, flour, sugar, sneakers, clothing, and to pay farmhands.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is divorced and has one son. She sells women's clothing at the central market. She has been in this business for 15 years. Elena knows her business well. She has good prices and treats her clients well. She also helps her business neighbors to develop their businesses by giving good advice and personal support.

Elena is requesting a loan of $800 to increase winter inventories. She hopes to sell more goods and receive more profit to pay for her son's school tuition.

loans.use: to increase winter inventories

loans.name: Nazareno Group

texts.en:
The Nazareno Village Bank is currently beginning its fourth loan cycle with 21 members. The group members are involved in a variety of different business. They sell natural remedies, cosmetics, school and office supplies, clothing, food, general dry goods (rice, sugar, etc.), fruits, small animals, and textiles. Diana is 20-year-old single woman who lives with her parents. Diana studies computer science and occasionally works at a local institution. Diana has a stand in the F. Vivanco Market, where she sells fruit with the help of her sister. Diana needs a loan of 300 soles to buy more fruit for her stand. Ana is 28 years old and lives with her partner and their son. Ana travels to different regional markets, where she sells dry goods (like rice and sugar) and buys cheese and alpaca wool. Ana needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar. Celia is 26 years old, single, and lives alone. She studies accounting and also works at a local institution. Celia sells clothing and shoes on credit by special order. Celia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy suits and shoes. Members of the Nazareno Group are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600, 900 or 1,000 Peruvian soles. The group is requesting a total of 12,150 soles, which they will use to buy rice, sugar, shoes, t-shirts, suits, fruit, cheese, animals, lotions, perfumes, and wool. The group members' dreams are to improve their businesses, own their own homes, proviD. their children with the best, and have their own investment capital.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
El Banco Nazareno inicia su cuarto ciclo con  21 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. medicina natural, cosméticos, artículos D. librería, comida, ropa, abarrotes en general, frutas, animales menores y elaboración D. textiles. 
Como es el caso D. Diana que es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Diana estudia computación y trabaja eventualmente en una institución. Diana tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. frutas con la ayuda D. su hermana. Diana necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. frutas. 
Por otro lado Ana es conviviente, tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo, Ana viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias compra quesos y fibra D. alpaca. Ana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar y arroz. 
Mientras que Celia es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive sola, estudia contabilidad y también trabaja en una institución, Celia venD. ropa, zapatos a pedidos sus ventas son al crédito. Celia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ternos y zapatos. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 12,150 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, zapatos, polos, ternos, frutas, quesos, animales, cremas, colonias y lana. 
Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propia, brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, tener capital propio.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, shoes, t-shirts, suits, fruits, cheeses, animals, lotions, perfumes, and wool.

loans.name: Carmen Lucrecia

texts.es:
