Carmen S. es una dama cuyo oficio es la venta de cosméticos y productos comestibles los cuales son comercializados en su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de León.

La señora Carmen ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus grandes sacrificios por lo que ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar y ha permitido que sus dos hijos estudien, el pequeño en secundaria y su hija joven en la universidad.
EL motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día es para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los cosméticos para comercializarlos a lo inmediato. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y de igual forma beneficia a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Carmen Salina is a woman whose profession is selling cosmetics and food products from her home in León city. Carmen has been successful thanks to her great sacrifices which have thus maintained her immediate family and enabled her two children to study. The younger son is in high school, her older daughter in the university. The reason she has approached Ceprodel today is to ask for a loan which would allow her to buy cosmetics to then sell. Both she and her family will greatly benefit from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila is a widow with one son. She sells men's and women's shoes at a market in Zaporozhye. Ludmila has been in this business for 10 years. She is a hard working person and a good entrepreneur. She takes her inventory to a small city and sells there during the week, then she goes back to the Zaporozhye market and sells there during the weekend. Ludmila would like a loan of $1150 to purchase more winter inventory. She can purchase it with a good discount and make more profit. This will help her to raise her son, since her business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase winter inventories

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.en:
The Santa Elena Village Bank is a newly formed bank that is starting out with 17 members, all of whom were invited by the loan officer. Most of the group members live in or near the Santa Elena neighborhood. The group members are involved in a variety of different activities. Some sell ornamental plants, fruits, small animals, dry goods (like rice and sugar), replacement parts, and vegetables; others work in transportation or bake bread. Some sell from home or on the street, while others sell in the marketplace or from door to door.  The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300 or 450 soles. The group is requesting a total of 7,500 Peruvian soles. They will use the loans to buy meat, fruit, flour, sugar, rice, vegetables, plants and replacement parts. The group members dream that their children will grow up to be working professionals, of improving and expanding their businesses, and of having their own investment capital. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
El Banco Comunal Santa Elena es un Banco Nuevo que recién inicia con 17 socias, todas ellas fueron invitadas por la promotora, la mayoría de ellas son del barrio de Santa Elena y sitios cercanos. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta plantas hornamentales, frutas, animales menores, abarrotes en general, repuestos, verduras, brindan servicios de transporte, elaboran panes. Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, ambulantemente, de casa en casa y en mercados. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamos, algunos montos son de 300 soles y 450 soles, haciendo un total de 7,500 soles de préstamos en el Banco Comunal. 
Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra carne, frutas, harina, azúcar, arroz, verduras, plantas y repuestos. 
Los sueños de las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, ampliar sus negocios y tener capital propio.

loans.use: Buy meat, fruit, flour, sugar, rice, vegetables, plants and replacement parts.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria  tiene 47 años de edad, soltera con 3 hijos, habitante del Barrio Concepción de Maria en la ciudad de Managua. Desde hace siete años se dedica a su pulpería que inicio con dinero propio producto de sus labores como costurera y con la ayuda de su ex-esposo. Como proyecto de vida para su familia su propósito es poder aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera poder ampliar su negocio y poder poner  una pulpería a sus hijos para que estos la administren. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de uno de sus anhelos esta solicitando  en calidad de préstamo con un periodo de devolución de seis  meses, que le permitirá surtir un poco más su pulpería a través del apoyo que le brinda AFODENIC, lograra sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old, single, and has three children. She lives in the neighbourhood of Concepción de Maria in the city of Managua. For the past seven years, she has owned a grocery store which she opened with her own money, money she saved from her work as a seamstress and with her ex-husband's help. Her goal is to increase her income and to be able to expand her store. She wants to open a grocery store for her children, that they will manage. In order to make her dreams come true, she is asking for a six-month loan with which she can stock her grocery store. With AFODENIC's help, she will achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as staple foods and canned goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María Eugenia es originaria del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León y desde hace 15 largos años se ha dedicado a elaborar tortillas las que son comercializadas en su casa de habitación donde las ofrece a sus clientes que desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana llegan a comprarlas.

La señora María Eugenia es madre casada y con sus tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar y es por este motivo que ella al ver la necesidad de invertir en su negocio en la compra de la leña y el maíz para hacer las tortillas,, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y espera que le sea otorgado sin ningún problema para continuar con su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Nagarote.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Eugenia is originally from the Nagarote municipality of León city. She has been making tortillas since she was 15 years old, and she sells them from her home where she offers tortillas to her customers beginning in the early morning hours when they arrive to buy them. María Eugenia is a married mother with three small school-aged children and it is for this reason that she sees the necessity to invest in her business by buying firewood and corn to make the tortillas. She has approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan and she hopes that it will be granted without any problem so that she can continue with her business in her home in the Nagarote municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Dolores is 54 years old and is married with seven children. Dolores has a stand at the Nery Garcia Market where she works seven days a week selling fruit, both in bulk and by the kilo. She buys the fruit directly from farmers. Dolores needs a loan of 3500 soles to buy bananas.  Dolores dreams of having her own working capital and of continuing to work. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Dolores es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Dolores es casada, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Dolores tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García y venD. frutas al por mayor y menor, los cuales compra D. los productores, actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Dolores necesita un préstamo D. 3500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. plátano. 
Los sueños D. Dolores son tener capital propio y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Buy bananas

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Modesta is 45 years old and lives with her common-law husband and five children. Modesta has a stand in the Basilio Auqui Market, where she sells fruit, both in bulk and by the kilo. She works every day, and her daughter helps her run the stand. Modesta needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy bananas.  Modesta dreams that her children will finish their studies and of launching additional businesses. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Modesta es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Modesta tiene un puesto en el mercado Basilio Auqui en donde vende frutas al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los dias con la ayuda de su hija. 
Modesta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátanos. 
Los sueños de Modesta son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, implementar otros negocios.

loans.use: Buy bananas

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Clementina is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Clementina bakes traditional Peruvian breads in her father-in-law’s oven, with the help of three employees. She distributes the bread wholesale to local stores. Clementina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy flour.  Clementina dreams that her children will finish school and of opening another business.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Clementina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Clementina se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en el horno de sus suegro con la ayuda de 3 personas, los panes los reparte por mayor a las tiendas. 
Clementina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina. 
Los sueños de Clementina son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener otro negocio.

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La Sra.: Martha, es una diligente madre preocupada por mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Comerciante de 32 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, habitante del Barrio La Fuente en la ciudad de Managua se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdo desde hace dos años se unió al negocio de la familia ya que su mamá inicio con el destace y venta de cerdo. Sus planes son apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y que estos tengan un futuro mejor. Como también llegar a tener un criadero de cerdos más grande y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de sus metas esta solicitando un  préstamo con un periodo de devolución de ocho meses, que  le permitirá la comprar de tres cerdos para destace y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda AFODENIC, podrá lograr cumplir sus metas
texts.en:
Señora Martha is a diligent mother who is concerned about improving her family's quality of life. She is a merchant, is 32, is married with 3 kids, and lives in the La Fuente neighborhood in Managua. She has bought and sold pigs for 2 years. She joined her family's business since her mom started butchering and selling pigs. Her plans are to support her children in their education so they can have a better future. She would like to have a larger pig farm some day and in this way increase her profits. To accomplish her goals, she is requesting a loan with a repayment period of 8 months, which will allow her to buy 3 pigs to raise and cover the demand of her customers. Thanks to the help that AFODENIC is offering her, she will be able to accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Sofia is 24 years old and is the single mother of one child. Sofia has a store in a rented space near Ayacucho’s central market, where she sells TVs and sound systems. Sofia also has a stand in the 12 de Abril Market, where she sells clothing. Her sister runs the stand.  Sofia needs a loan of 3500 soles to buy televisions. Sofia’s dreams are to buy a car to use for public transit, to build her own home, and to open a hotel. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Sofia  es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Sofia es madre soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Sofía tiene una tienda en un local alquilado que se ubica cerca al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende artefactos como televisores, equipos. Además Sofia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa, su hermana se encarga de la atención. 
Sofia necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de televisores. 
Los sueños de Sofia son comprar un carro para que realice transporte publico, construir su casa y un hotel.

loans.use: Buy televisions

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Rosa is 70 years old. She is married and has nine children. Rosa grows vegetables on her land in the Pongora community, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. She works with her husband and their farmhands. Rosa also travels to regional fairs, where she buys grain to resell in local markets. Rosa needs a loan of 600 soles to buy different grains. Her dream is to improve her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Rosa es casada, tiene 70 años y 9 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras en sus terrenos D. la comunidad D. Pongora que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Actividad que realiza junto con su esposo con la ayuda D. peones. Además Rosa viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales que luego venD. en los mercados. 
Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales variados. 
El sueño D. Rosa son mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es: El Sr.Luís tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en la Colonia 14 de septiembre en la ciudad de Managua. Desde hace once años se dedica a la costura con su esposa que es modista, así fue como juntos decidieron juntar sus ahorros y abrir su propio taller de costura, el cual empezó con poca maquinaria pero que con el paso del tiempo se ha venido acrecentando, es por ello que Luís tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que contribuye a la educación de sus hijos. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de sus metas esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá la compra de una maquina  de coser industrial para mejorar la calidad de producción, gracias a la ayuda que le esta brindando AFODENIC, lograra el incremento en sus ganancia y así asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y el de su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the area of 14th of September, in the city of Managua. For the last 8 years he has worked in tailoring with his wife, who is a designer. They decided to get together and join their savings to start their own tailoring shop. The shop began with little equipment, but over time it has grown. Luis plans to keep growing his business since it contributes to the education of his children. To reach his goals he is asking for a loan with a 9 month term. This will allow him to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of his products. Thanks to the help AFODENIC is providing Luis, he will obtain an increase in his profit and assure the future of his wife and kids.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine to improve quality of his tailoring work

loans.name: Yovana

texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Village Bank.Yovana is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son.Yovana and her husband rent a car, which they use for passenger transport around the city. Sometimes, Yovana works as the payment collector. Yovana needs a loan of 750 soles to buy iron rods so that she can start building her house. Yovana’s dreams are to provide her son with a good education and to finish building her home. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso. 
Yovana es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Yovana junto a su esposo se dedican a realizar transporte urbano con un carro alquilado, en algunas oportunidades Yovana hace de cobradora. 
Yovana necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de fierros para comenzar con la construcción de su casa. 
Los sueños de Yovana son brindar una buena educación a su hijo y terminar construir su casa.

loans.use: Buy iron rods to build a house

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Village Bank. Emilia is 53 years old. She is married and has six children. Emilia runs a store from her home, located in the Calvario neighborhood, where she sells vegetables, dry goods (like rice and sugar), fruits, and meats. On Saturdays and Sundays, she also sells traditional Peruvian food from her home or in the San Juan Bautista Market. Emilia needs a loan of 750 soles to buy rice, sugar, and pasta.  Emilia’s dreams are for her children to graduate with professional degrees and to improve her business. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso. 
Emilia es casada, tiene 53 años y 6 hijos, Emilia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio del Calvario en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, frutas, carnes. Además los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica en su casa y también algunas veces lo lleva a la feria de San Juan Bautista. 
Emilia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo.  Los sueños de Emilia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, a sus 33 años viene conviviendo desde hace 13 con su pareja, tienen 3 hijos y uno en camino. Todo este tiempo ha trabajado en la compra y venta de fruta de acuerdo a la temporada, y hay días en que tiene que ir a las chacras a las 4.00am para comprar a los agricultores que ya tienen preparando sus productos para el mejor postor, por ello que Silvia tiene que madrugar para seleccionar las frutas y luego comprarlas. Para Silvia, años atrás esta labor le parecía muy pesada, pero ya se adecuó porque le es mucho más rentable, sobre todo en los meses de enero a marzo cuando vende frutas cítricas, luego viene la temporada de los plátanos hasta los meses de mayo, en este tiempo no va mucho a las chacras, solo espera comprar de los que llevan al mercado, llegando a vender solo de 20 a 25 javas de frutas, cada java consta de 12 kilos de naranjas o mandarinas. Mientras que está bien la demanda en el mercado la venta de frutas le sale el doble de ganancia, o de lo contrario busca vender paltas que son mucho más delicadas. Lo dificultoso en este negocio es que las frutas de malogran, y a veces se compra a un precio, y luego baja, entonces pierden parte de su capital; a pesar de estos altibajos, Silvia está feliz con su actividad porque le permite llevar una vida decorosa. Silvia hace uso de un crédito de MFP por la quinta vez consecutiva, todo este tiempo ha pagado con mucha responsabilidad todas las cuotas fijadas y jamás cayo en morosidad. El dinero solicitado lo derivará a la compra de fruta por camionadas, para que de este modo las envíe directamente a la capital, ya que ganará mucho más que en su puesto y en un menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old and has lived with her common-law husband for 13 years. They have three children and one on the way. All this time Silvia has dealt in seasonal fruit, and there are days when she has to be at the farms at 4:00 a.m. to buy from farmers who sell to the highest bidder. For this reason she has to be up early to choose the fruit and then purchase it. In the past this work seemed very burdensome, but she has become accustomed to it because it is more profitable. In general she sells citrus fruit from January to March, then banana season runs until May. During that time she does not go to the farms frequently, but waits to buy from those who bring 20-25 javas of fruit to the market. Each java is equivalent to 12 kilograms of oranges or tangerines. When demand in the marketplace is high, she makes double the profit from the sale of fruit. When it is not, she tries to sell avocados, which are more delicate. What is difficult about this business is that fruit spoils, and at times one buys at one price, but then it drops, resulting in a loss of capital. Despite the ups and downs, Silvia is content with her business because it permits her to lead a decent life. This is the fifth time in a row that Silvia has taken out a loan with Kiva, and each time she has made her loan payments and never fallen into arrears. The money that she has requested will go towards the purchase of fruit by the truckload, because this way she can send it directly to the capital where it will earn much more in a shorter period of time than if she sold it from her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit to send to Lima for sale

loans.name: Marisol Genoveva

texts.es:
La Joven Empresaria Marisol Genoveva C. Z. tiene la edad de 37 años, su estado civil es soltera, Marisol tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hija de 18 años cursa el 1 año de estudios generales en una universidad publica y su hijo de 12 años cursa recientemente el 1 año de secundaria, los propósitos son de aumentar su mercadería  por que tiene que solventar las deudas y gastos adquiridos  por lo que tiene que sacar adelante a su familia y darles el pan de cada día ya que también tiene a cargo a sus padres y como son de una edad muy avanzada no tienen trabajo sus sueños son de establecer una tienda con amplia mercadería y lograr que sus hijos coronen una carrera ya que considera que es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar sus deseos son que Fundación León 2000 siga apoyándola para poder concretizar todos su sueños a cumplir pues ella es una joven que ha luchado por obtener un trabajo digno.


Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general en la que ofrece: zapatos, camisas, pantalones, faldas, cosméticos entre otros, la ubicación de  su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 7 años, su negocio da comienzo por la necesidad de darle a sus hijos el alimento diario debido a la situación que ocurrió con su esposo quien la abandono y así ella decide buscar un trabajo extra de impulsadora en la empresa DISEGSA ya que cuenta con los ingresos fijos de este empleo por lo que decide establecer el negocio de venta en general  y es así que obtiene a sus clientes y el negocio en el que esta actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar los diferentes productos para sus clientes y viaja hasta Managua por que es donde le resulta mas favorable.
texts.en:
The young entrepreneur Marisol Genoveva C. Z. is 37 years old, single, with two children ages 18 and 12. Her 18-year-old daughter is in her 1st year of general studies at a public college, and her 12-year-old son is in his first year of secondary school. She also takes care of her elderly parents who do not work due to their advanced age. Her main goal is to help her family get ahead, and to put food on the table. She currently has an itinerant business selling clothing and other items of personal use. She has been doing this for seven years, ever since her husband abandoned her, when she also went to work for the company DISEGSA. This has provided her with a steady income as well as the means to find customers for her side business. She would like to increase her stock of merchandise and be able to travel to Managua where conditions are more favorable. She hopes Fundacion Leon continues to support her efforts so that she can fulfill her dream of setting up a well-stocked store where she can make a good living and enable her children to find good careers, because she feels that is the best inheritance that she can leave for them.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marithza

texts.en:
Marithza is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Village Bank. Marithza is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Marithza sells catalog cosmetics on credit to her family and friends. Marithza also travels to different markets to sell sweets. Marithza needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cosmetics. Marithza dreams of building her own house, of having a store, and of going to school to study accounting.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Marithza es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Marithza es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Marithza vende cosméticos por catálogos a amigos familiares al crédito. Además Maritza viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende golosinas.
Marithza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Marithza son construir su casa, tener una tienda y estudiar contabilidad.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
Maria Feliz D. Ramírez tiene la edad de 68 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Maria tiene 5 hijos de los cuales su hijo varón de 43 años y trabaja como técnico automotriz su otro hijo varón de 42 años trabaja por cuenta propia este otro hijo de 41 años de edad trabaja como técnico agrónomo y trabaja en el Ingenio San Antonio su hija mujer de 39 años de edad es enfermera y trabaja en el Ingenio San Antonio y su hija menor de 27 años y trabaja como ingeniera de el laboratorio de Monte Rosa, su esposo no labora, sus propósitos son de mantener activo su negocio por lo que tiene que mantenerse ya que la situación esta cada día mas difícil, sus deseos ya los cumplió que son de ver a sus hijos casados y formados profesionalmente y trabajando para sus familias por lo que ahora sus sueños son de ahorrar dinero ya que su esposo no labora y tiene que seguir luchando para su beneficio.


Su actividad económica es la de servicio de de transporte de acarreo personal, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Doña Maria inicia este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo ya que tenían que sacar a sus hijos adelante y fue por idea de su esposo quien le ayudo al empezar el negocio su esposo conducía el camión ya que el trabaja en el Ingenio San Antonio por lo que lograron tener ingresos alquilando el camión destinado al traslado de la caña por lo que así fue fácilmente darse a conocer por lo que así consiguió mas clientes y fue así que obtuvo su negocio  pero debido a que su esposo ya no puede trabajar es Doña Maria quien se hace cargo del negocio y es por eso que quiere salir adelante con su esposo y es por eso el motivo del financiamiento es para repara el camión ya que necesita darle mantenimiento y comprar piezas que son necesarias para el buen funcionamiento del mismo.
texts.en:
Maria Feliz D. R. is 68 years old, married, and has 5 children. A son of 43 years is an automobile mechanic; another son of 42 is self-employed, a son of 41 is an agriculture technician working at the San Antonio Estate, a daughter of 39 is a nurse, also working for the San Antonio Estate, and her youngest daughter of 27 is a lab engineer at the Monte Rosa laboratory. Her husband is unemployed. Her business is transportation. It was initially a family business started 15 years ago, where both her husband and herself worked together, he driving and renting their truck for the transportation of sugar cane. Mrs. Maria is in charge of the business now, and she would like to obtain funds to make repairs to their truck in order to keep it in good working order, because this is now their only source of income, since her husband is no longer able to work, and times are hard. Now that her children are well established, her main aspiration is to support her husband and to maintain the business alive.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Helen

texts.es: Helen, de 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cuatro hijos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros. Años atrás trabajaba en una y otra actividad que se le presentaba según la ocasión, pero desde que se comprometió se dedicaba a su casa, y hace 2 meses ha empezado en vender picarones (postre a base de harina de camote, en forma de donuts y se sirve con miel); prestándose la cocina de su suegra, por el momento prepara solo los fines de semana y el resto de días cocina chicharrones (pedazos de carne de cerdo frito) en porciones de 1 y 1.50 soles. El esposo de Helen se dedica a la agricultura y recién están empezando a realizar sus plantaciones de cítricos, por lo que tienen que esperar de 4 a 5 años, para que estas plantas puedan dar sus frutos. Mientras tanto ha visto por conveniente dedicarse de lleno al negocio de la comida, no le es tan rentable vender solo los fines de semana, entonces ha pensado hacerlo diariamente, vender desde las 6.00pm hasta 11.00pm en la puerta de su casa.  Helen espera tener mucha suerte para captar clientela rápidamente. Helen se incorpora a este banco comunal que ya está en su quinto préstamo, para ella será el primero, pero se compromete a realizar todos su pagos correspondiente, con las esperanzas de que le sigan apoyando con futuros prestamos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de una cocina y cacerola especial para freír los riquísimos picarones, y el resto de dinero será para adquirir los insumos e ingredientes necesarios, tanto para los picarones, como para los chicharrones.
texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old, lives with her partner, has 4 children, and currently lives with her in-laws. A few years ago she worked here and there wherever the opportunity arose, but since she became engaged, she has been a housewife. Two months ago she started selling donuts using her mother-in-law's stove to cook them; currently she only cooks during week-ends, the rest of the week only making pork rinds, which she sells for 1.00 to 1.50 soles. Helen's husband (partner) is a farmer, and they have just started planting citric fruits, but they have to wait about 4 or 5 more years to harvest the fruit. Meanwhile, she has seen it fit to dedicate herself completely to the food business, but realizes that it is not lucrative to sell only during week-ends, so she has decided to do it daily at her doorstep between the hours of 6 and 11 PM . Helen hopes to have good fortune in capturing clientele quickly. She has joined this community bank which is in its fifth loan cycle, the first for her, and she vows to make payments on time in hopes to continue to qualify for future loans. She is requesting funds for the purchase of a stove and a special pot to fry her great tasting donuts, as well as to purchase the necessary ingredients for making donuts and the pork rinds.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una cocina, utensilios e ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 40 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos, de los cuales vive con dos de ellos en la casa de su madre, mientras su otro hijo vive con su padre. Hace 10 años atrás vendía comida en el mercado, dejo esta actividad por ser muy trabajosa y no terminaba de vender toda la comida debido a la competencia que había en el mercado; desde entonces le dio un giro a su vida, vendiendo condimentos, compra por kilos el ají colorado, la pimienta comino, etc., y luego los envasa en bolsitas pequeñas, va caminando de dos a tres kilómetros de bodega en bodega ofreciendo sus productos. Todo este tiempo a ganado muchos clientes, los que comenzaron a pedirle otros productos, entonces ha visto por conveniente satisfacer a todos sus clientes, mientras le generen más ingresos económicos a su hogar. Poco a poco ha ido incrementado su negocio; vende todo lo que le piden sus cliente, desde sus condimentos, hasta útiles de escritorio, negocio que le es más rentable, debido ello, sale 2 o 3 veces a la semana y gana entre 150 a 200 soles cada vez, los otros días se dedica a embolsar los condimentos. Betty está feliz con su trabajo y no le encuentra dificultad alguna, al contrario, quiere seguir incrementado su capital, y sobre todo quiere  llevar sus productos a las zonas donde no llega su competencia. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y está comprometida a seguir pagando de la misma forma como lo ha venido haciendo, con puntualidad, sobre todo, no quiere quedar mal con la institución, ni con su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado lo piensa utilizar en la compra de mercadería como hilos, botones, grecas y los condimentos, con la finalidad de captar clientela y con el tiempo quiere ir de compras a la capital donde pueda encontrar a menor precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old, a single mother of three; she lives with two of her children in her mother's house, and her other son lives with his father. Ten years ago she used to sell food at the local farmers' market, but she stopped doing this because it became too labor-intensive and competitive. Since then she made a change in her life and started to sell spices, which she buys wholesale and repackages them in smaller bags. She walks about three kilometers daily offering her products. Throughout this time she has gained many customers who have started to request more products. She wants to fulfill her customers' wishes in order to keep generating this income for her family. Thus she has slowly been growing her business, selling everything that her customers request, from spices to office supplies; this has made her business more lucrative. She now only goes out about 2-3 times per week, earning between 150-200 soles each time, spending the rest of time repackaging the spices. Betty is very happy with her work, has had no difficulties, and wants to increase her capital and take her business to areas where there is no competition. This is her second loan through MFP, and she is committed to continue paying on time and being a good customer. The money requested will be used to buy more merchandise such as thread, buttons, snaps and other spices in order to grow her customer base. She also would like in time to be able to travel to the capital city to buy her products at a cheaper cost.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de la mercadería que vende

loans.name: Pedro Sergio

texts.es:
u nombre es Pedro Sergio G. su edad es de 64 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Pedro tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su compañera de vida labora de costurera ejerciendo la actividad económica en su casa de habitación  ya que ambos les gusta realizar trabajos humildes pero dignos, los propósitos de Don Pedro es mantener estable su negocio debido al precio del combustible que no se encuentra estable y esto ocasiona inestabilidad para su familia, sus sueños son de que sus hijos cuenten con otra fuente de ingresos para que el día de mañana este no sea un inconveniente para ellos mismos su deseo es de tener suficiente dinero para suplir las necesidades de su familia por lo que en estos momentos la compra para los productos básicos es mas costosa por lo que cada día la vida esta mas difícil y es por eso que necesita luchar para mantener a su familia.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es conduciendo un taxi, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 27 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, Don Pedro inicia este negocio por la necesidad de adquirir una fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que tenia que proporcionar el sustento diario por lo que por medio de un amigo adquirió el derecho de la ruta con un dinero que le prestaron por un familiar sin intereses y con las ganancias que generara  el negocio pagaría el dinero por lo que desde esos momentos se convirtió en una persona emprendedora por lo que tenia a sus 4 hijos a su cargo y tenia que prepararlos profesionalmente durante estos 27 años Don Pedro a cambiado su unidad de transporte en 4 ocasiones y esto sucedió a la exigencias de la cooperativa donde esta afiliado y debido a la necesidad de ofrecer un mejor servicio a los usuarios por lo que todavía necesita realizar un financiamiento destinado para             las reparaciones del vehiculo por lo que tiene que buscar los repuestos en Managua ya que ahí le resulta mas favorable la compra de estos repuestos.
texts.en:
His name is Pedro Sergio G.. He is 64 years old and married. Don Pedro has four children, all of whom are married and live on their own. His life partner works as a seamstress in their one-room house, since both of them wish to do humble but dignified work. Don Pedro's goal is to keep his business stable even though the price of fuel fluctuates and causes instability for his family. His dream is for his children to have another source of income so that in the future this fluctuation doesn't cause them any problems. For himself and his partner he dreams of having enough money to provide for his family's needs, since purchasing basic staples has become more expensive. This makes life more and more difficult and obliges him to struggle to support his family. He earns a living as a taxi driver. He's had his business for 27 years. Don Pedro began the business in order to create a source of income for his family, since he needed to provide for their day-to-day needs. Through a friend he managed to acquire the route rights with money loaned to him interest-free by a relative, and with the profits the business generates he'd repay the loan. So from that moment he became an enterprising person, having four children to take care of and prepare for the world of work. Over the past 27 years Don Pedro has changed vehicles four times, as required by the cooperative with which he is associated, in order to offer better service to his clients. He seeks financing to pay for vehicle repairs, for which he'll have to look for parts in Managua, since they can be found at more affordable prices there.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 31 años de edad, y cerca de 12 años viene conviviendo con su pareja, con quien tuvo dos hermosos hijos y ahora están construyendo su casa de madera. Sus padres se han dedicado a las labores agrícolas, la cual era su única fuente de ingresos económicos, pasaron los años y Eva se enamoro de un agricultor muy trabajador y sobre todo responsable. En el tiempo que están juntos se han propuesto metas de progresar y desarrollarse en el mercado competitivo, vienen dedicándose a la actividad de la compra y venta de frutas y su esposo siembra cítricos y otra veces les compra la fruta a sus vecinos. Comprar de las chacras les es muy conveniente, ya que la inversión es menor, invierten 1000 soles en cítricos y su ganancia es de 600, descontando todos los gastos. Lo que también hace es comprar plátanos verdes y mediante el líquido llamado Etrel maduran los plátanos antes de su tiempo, esta inversión le cuesta 3 soles, y le es muy rentable también. Eva es otra de las clientas muy puntual en sus pagos y sobre todo en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa que participa en todas las actividades que realizan los analistas de crédito y siempre está en las condiciones de brindar apoyo. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de una camionada de frutas, para luego enviarlo al mercado de Lima, mientras que la carga de plátanos los va enviar al mercado de su ciudad hasta que se mejore la plaza de Lima en esta fruta.
texts.en:
Eva is 31 years old, and she has lived with her husband for about 12 years. They have two handsome sons and now they are building a wooden house. Her parents did agricultural work for a living, which was their only source of income. The years passed and Eva fell in love with a very hardworking and responsible farmer. In the time they have been together, they have proposed goals to advance and develop in the competitive market. They work in the business of buying and selling fruit. Her husband plants citrus fruits and sometimes he buys fruit from their neighbors. Buying from small farms is convenient for them, since it is less of an investment. They invest 1000 soles in citrus fruits and their earnings are 600 (soles), discounting all expenses. What they also do is buy green plantains and by using a liquid called Etrel, the plantains mature before their time. This investment costs 3 soles, and it is very profitable as well. Eva is another client who is very timely with her payments, and she is also a very active member of her communal bank. She participates in all activities that the loan analysts do, and she is always is ready to lend a hand. She plans to invest the money she's requesting by purchasing a fruit truck that she will later send to the market in Lima. Meanwhile, she is going to send the load of plantains to her city market until conditions for selling this fruit at the main square in Lima improve.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a fruit truck

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Uno de los grandes valores del Sr. R. es la unidad familiar, sin importar la distancia, en este momento un integrante de su grandiosa familia, le solicitó apoyo para poder cubrir los pagos que se le han presentado a causa de una enfermedad, y don Alfonso inmediatamente correspondió, por lo que solicita su colaboración para llevar acabo su labor humanitaria.
Su empleo consiste ensamblar calentadores para agua en una maquiladora de la localidad, él se compromete a rembolsar todo lo que ustedes le proporcionen.
Cuando se tomó la fotografía desafortunadamente don Alfonso no se encontraba en su domicilio pues el horario que tiene en la fabrica es muy amplio y sólo pudimos contactar a su esposa e hija.
texts.en:
For Mr. R., one of the most important things is the family unit. Distance does not matter. At this time, a member of his large family asked him for help to cover the costs associated with an illness. Alfonso immediately obliged, and that is why he asks for your collaboration in order to carry out his humanitarian task. His job consists of assembling water heaters in a local assembly plant. He is committed to reimbursing all the money that you lend him. Unfortunately, Alfonso was not at home when this photograph was taken because his shift at the factory is very long, and we could only contact his wife and daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help a relative with medical expenses.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: La casa del señor Alfonso
texts.en: Mr. Alfonso

loans.use: To put a concrete floor on the front patio

loans.name: Mr. Sarom Rous Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people living in Preak Treing village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. For example, Mr. Sarom R., the 43-year-old village bank president, is a motorbike taxi driver. He now faces a problem because his motorbike is an old one and he usually pays a lot of money to repair it. Thus, he is requesting a loan to fix his motorbike. His wife, Mrs. Ngon Chanthon, is a housewife. Mr. Sarom R. is the father of a child who is attending the local school.

Three members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to fix the motorbike he uses to earn a living

loans.name: Mrs. Phary Uy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in AnL. Romeit Lech village in Kandal province form this village bank, and Mrs. Phary U. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She is a 66-year-old widow with a child who gets sick frequently; unfortunately, Mrs. Phary U. does not have enough money to cure her child. Thus, Mrs. Phary U. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she hopes her child can be well soon.

Two members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to cure her sick child

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men T. is 28 years old and resides with her parents and her sister in Battanbang province, Cambodia. She is single and helps support her family by working as farmer and professional tailor. She grows rice and decorates clothes; on average, she makes US$ 5 a day. Of course, this family also gets support from Men Saream, 25, a sister of Men T., who works selling handbags at the market. She earns approximately US$ 6 a day.

Ms. Men T. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to make two investments. First, she will spend US$ 300 to purchase fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm. Second, she plans to invest with her sister to add to their handbag inventory to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and invest in the handbag business

loans.name: Chrouk

texts.en:
Chrouk N. is 49 years old and lives with his wife in Battambang province. He grows rice and some vegetables to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 a day, while his wife, Roth Preun, pictured here, is a professional tailor and makes US$ 4 a day as well. This couple has two children and both help their father with the farming.

Chrouk N. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a water pump in case he has difficulty with water for his field.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey S., 48, is a widow who lives in Battambang province. She is a true entrepreneur who has a business selling various kinds of desserts and also grows rice to earn a living. She is able to make a combined US$ 5 a day. She is aided by two of her children who are employed as local bakers. Every year, farming produces just enough for the family members. She never has extra rice to sell to support the family.

Mrs. Srey S. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to make two investments. First, she will put US$ 100 as re-investment into her dessert business; the rest of the money will be used to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds and to hire workers to harvest the rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, etc. and invest in her dessert business

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong P., 51, is a widowed farmer who lives with two of her children in Battambang province, Cambodia. She typically makes US$ 5 a day and is aided by two of her children who work as construction workers building houses.

Mrs. Suong P. would like to request a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family transportation. This will reduce the cost that she and her children usually spend on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transportation

loans.name: Knech

texts.en:
Knech K., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province. She is a farmer and makes US$ 3 a day. Most of the farmers that live in Battambang province typically grow rice and fruit such as durian, oranges, and other favorite fruit. Battambang province is the number one producer of rice and fruit. Knech K.'s husband, Sam Saly, 35, is a motor-taxi and makes US$ 4 a day.

Mrs. Knech K. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use for a motor-taxi

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim T., 33, is a professional tailor who lives with her husband in Battambang province. She typically makes US$ 4 a day, while her husband is a soldier and makes US$ 1 a day. This couple has one child. Mrs. Kim T. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Yoy Mang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people living in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Yoy M., the 31-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop.

In order to solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Vann Tha, is a fisherman. Mrs. Yoy M. is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Dien Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Diện năm nay 50 tuổi, gia đình có chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, từ khi tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã phát triển kinh tế và có điều kiện mua sắm thêm nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình. Nguồn thu nhập  của gia đình chị chủ yếu là từ diệt chiếu và chăn nuôi thủy sản . Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 7000.000 để  cải tạo ruộng đất nhằm gia tăng sản xuất  cho vụ tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dien Thi L. is a 50 years old woman. She has two grown-up children. In 2003, she joined the TYM fund. Since then she has been borrowing money to invest in businesses, so that she can buy more home facilities. The family’s income mainly comes from production of sedge mat and seafood. Mrs. L. plans to make the next loan of 7,000,000 VND to improve the field in order to improve the productivity.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve fields

loans.name: Kienthi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Kiên, năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị Kiên đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Năm 2003 chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào nghề dệt chiếu truyền thống của địa phương. Hiện tịa đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 8.000.000, để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu gia tăng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kien Thi P. is a 35 years old woman. She is living with her husband and one small child in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. In 2003, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in the local traditional job, producing sedge mats. At the moment, sales of sedge mats bring in income of about 3,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. P. plans to make the next loan of 8,000,000 VND to buy more raw material for the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to produce sedge mat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cultivate rice in the dry season

loans.name: Lai Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lai, 23 tuổi, ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Vợ chồng chị có 1 con nhỏ. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, tuy còn trẻ nhưng với sự cần cù, chăm chỉ và sử dụng vốn vay có hiệu quả trong những năm qua đã giúp gia đình chị xây được nhà mới. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là từ dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi. Mỗi ngày gia đình chị dệt được 4 đôi chiếu thu được 100.000/ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị Lai xin vay 9000.000 để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu dệt chiếu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lai Thi N. is a 23 years old woman in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. The couple has a small child. Mrs. N. has been the TYM fund’s partner since 2003. Though young, she is a hardworking person and has been using the loans effectively; therefore they could afford to build a new house. The family’s income mainly comes from production of sedge mat and breeding animals. On average, they can produce 4 pairs of sedge mat per day, selling for 100,000 VND. Mrs. N. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 VND to buy more raw material for the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to produce sedge mat

loans.name: Doi Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Dõi, 45 tuổi, có 3 con đang đi học. Hiện chị và gia đình đang sống ở huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ công việc làm thuê của chồng với tổng thu nhập 2500 000/ tháng.. Vòng vốn tới chị Dõi muốn vay 9000.000 để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu dệt chiếu, gia tăng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doi Thi D. is a 45 years old woman. She is living in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa with her three children, who are still going to school. In 2003, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to produce sedge mat and breed animals. Now, income from those businesses reaches 2,500,000 VND per month. Mrs. D. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 VND to buy raw material and food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to produce sedge mat and food for the animals

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Channy C. is the group president. She is a 53 years old widow. Canny is a farmer who owns a piece of land with which she cultivates rice. On her plot of land she faces a problem. The field has infertile soil and produces a poor crop. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to strengthen the field to make her crop more productive. 

One member in this group loans is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to strengthen the field and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Viên, 45 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con và đã lớn. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và bán hàng ăn sáng. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán, chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm công an của chồng và con trai đã đi làm nên kinh tế rất ổn định.  Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9000.000 để phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi V., 45 years old, has three grown-up children. In 2005, she joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) and borrowed funds to invest in animal breeding and her breakfast store. Currently, besides her store and farm, her family source of income also comes from wages of her husband, who is a police officer, and her oldest son. Thus, Mrs. V.'s family finance has become more stable. This time she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 525 USD) to improve her family income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lường Thị L., 33 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Trước đây kinh tế gia đình chị rất khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn và các con còn nhỏ. Năm 2005 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để buôn bán chiếu . Công việc phát triển khá thuận lọi và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập ổn định 4.000.000đ/ . Vòng vốn tới chị L. muốn vay 8000.000 để tăng thêm vốn kinh doanh, tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luong Thi L., 33 years old, lives in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. Before, her family had a very difficult time because there wasn't enough fund to invest in any business, while her children are all small. In 2005 Mrs. L. joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) to loan some money to sell mats. The business has been going pretty well and brought a steady source of income to her family, about 400,000VND (about 238 USD) per month. She wants to borrow 8,000,000 VND (or 475 USD) to have more funds to invest in her business and bring more income to her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun K., 33, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chea, 36, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1995 and have two children: one son who attends school and one daughter who is a silk weaver. Besides her children, Mrs Savoeun K. also has one sister living with her.

Savoeun has been a silk weaver for eight years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for about seven years. Savoeun is requesting her first loan of US$ 1100 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị V., năm nay 41 tuổi, có 2 con đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003, số vốn chị vay chủ yếu được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và dệt chiếu cho thu nhập bình quân  100.000đ/ngày. Với việc sử dụng nguồn vốn có hiệu quả đã giúp gia đình chị có thêm điều kiện cho con ăn học và mua sắm thêm tiện nghi cho gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9000.000 để mua nguyên vật liệu diệt chiếu và phân bón để gia tăng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi V. is 41 years old. She has two children, both of them are still in school. She joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2003. Her family has primarily invested her loans in raising animals and making sedge mat, which brings them an average income of 100,000VND (about 5.8 USD) per day. While the loan is used efficiently, Mrs. V. is able to provide her children with proper schooling and to buy more furniture for the house. This time she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND (or 525 USD) to buy more materials to make mats and fertilizers for her cattle.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising, make  mats

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sarorn P., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Chinda Run, 29, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for 13 years and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children attend school and another one is still too young.

Sarorn has been a diamond cutter in Phnom Penh for three years. His wife has been raising pigs for thirteen years. Chinda lacks the money to expand her pig-raising business and she wants to create another rice-milling business. Therefore, Sarorn is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to use for raising pigs and to purchase rice-milling machine for his wife.

loans.use: For raising pigs and to purchase a rice milling machine

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha P., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Thet Chay, 23, who live in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still too young to go to school.

Vutha has been a motor taxi driver for six years. He does his work in Phnom Penh. His wife stays at home to lake care of their children. In the past, she used to be a garment factory worker. Vutha is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S., 59, has five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home; one daughter is a silk weaver. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Heng has been a textile designer for twenty-four years, a skill she learned from a relative. She designs patterns for silk fabric. Heng is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to build a toilet for the family to use.

loans.use: To build a toilet for the family to use

loans.name: Kimtray

texts.en:
Mr. Kimtray L., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Savy Yan, 29, who live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, have been married for eight years and have three daughters. One of their children attends school. Besides their children, they also have a niece and their parents living with them.

Kimtray has been a mason for eight years, a skill he learned from his brother. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Kimtray is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin M., 48, is a widow with five children, one son who is a construction worker and four daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives outside the family home; the youngest child attends school and the other children assist their mother in farming. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sim is a farmer. She grows green vegetables and flowers. She sells them to the middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a water pump, fertilizer, and pesticide for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Ageut-Akurut Ketty Group

texts.en:
Ketty A. (on the left) is 28 years old, married, and a mother of four. Ketty represents her fellow group members who are also involved in clothing sales businesses in Pallisa town. They travel to Mbale (a main regional town) to purchase their stock on Mondays every 2 weeks. From their sales, their profit margin ranges between 25-30%.

These ladies are using their loan funds to purchase dresses, shirts, trousers, skirts, and blouses. Ketty particularly dreams of opening up a 1st class boutique with a variety of new designer outfits sourced from overseas. She also hopes to build a house for her family. The income she earns from the business enables her to meet the family's day-to-day needs.

loans.use: Purchase dresses, shirts, trousers, skirts, and blouses for re-sale

loans.name: Ageut-Namaja Margret Group

texts.en:
Margret N. (2nd from the left) is a hard-working and determined businesswoman. She is 28 years old, married and the loving mother of 4 children who are all in school. Margret sells cereals in Pallisa market. She buys her stock from the village farmers in her locality. The profit she earns from sales is approximately 20%.

She is using the loan to boost her business by purchasing beans, peas, rice, maize, and groundnuts. The rest of her group members sell cereals, too. Margret's dream is to open up a wholesale store for cereals within Pallisa town. She also hopes that her business will enable her to see her children through school.

loans.use: Purchasing beans, peas, rice, maize, and groundnuts for re-sale

loans.name: Face

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Face M. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 2 months and 10 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them.

Face M. has been running a shop since 2008. This client’s business is selling cloth such as vitambaa (fabric), vitenga (traditional African cloth with wax print) and kanga (wraps bearing a Swahili proverb). She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Face M. currently earns about US$ 185 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to add more fabrics. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Face thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for making clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Ageut-Esapan Alice Group

texts.en:
Alice E. (on the right) is 49 years old. She is married and has 12 children. Alice has 3 years' experience in selling fruits and vegetables in Pallisa market. She purchases her stock from the farmers in her village. This business actually enables Alice to feed the family as her husband provides for other needs.

Alice is using the loan funds to purchase fruit and vegetables so as to meet customer demand. Her dream is to open up a retail shop for fast-moving consumer goods and also to build a good house for her family. Her group members, Sabina A. and Betty A. sell fish and cereals respectively.

loans.use: Purchasing cabbages, spinach, carrots, mangoes, avocados, bananas, etc. for re-sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!  This is 49 year old Rebecca N. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 25 and 28 years old. She is also responsible for supporting a dependant, a child whose parents could not look after. Rebecca N. has been running a Duka business. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city. She has been selling common household and grocery items since 2004. Rebecca's business is doing well. She works at her business for 13 hours a day, 7 days a week and currently earns about 144USD. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more supplies of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and cakes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rebecca thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and cakes

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45 year old Colleta K. from Mwanza. She is a widow with one child, who is 30 years old. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans. Colleta K. has been running a clothes business since 2007 and her business is dong well. She works at her business 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. Colleta K. currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase more clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to add more supplies of clothes. Colleta thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ageut- Namugere Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty N. (on the right) is 45 years old, married and the mother of 11 children. Betty and her group members are local brewers in Pallisa. They purchase millet from the farmers, mill the grain, and later ferment it, thereby preparing ajong (a local brew).

The loan is enabling these ladies to boost their businesses by purchasing more millet, the main ingredient for their local brew. Betty in particular dreams of opening up a pub for refined wines, spirits, and beer. Her business enables her to help her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: Purchase millet for brewing alcohol

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị N., 25 tuổi. Gia đình chị  có 2 con nhỏ. Chị tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 2005, Tuy còn trẻ nhưng với sự chăm chỉ và sử dụng nguồn vốn vay  vào chăn nuôi và buôn chim  có hiệu quả đã giúp cho gia đình có được nguồn thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng.. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9000.000 để buôn bán chim.
texts.en:
Ms. Le Thi N., 25 years old, has two small children. She has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2005. Although still at a young age, Ms. N. knows how to use her loans effectively in raising animals and selling birds. This business gives her family a very stable source of income of 3,000,000 VND per month (equivalent to 175 USD per month). This loan cycle she wants to borrow 9,000,000 VND (about 525 USD) for her bird trading business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Pendo Y. from Mwanza. She is single. Pendo Y. has been running a tailoring business since 2007. This client’s business is to purchase vitambaa (fabric), vitenge (traditional African wax prints), and kanga (wraps bearing a Swahili proverb) and make them into clothing, mainly for women. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week.

Pendo Y. currently earns about US$ 200 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 325 in order to purchase fabrics such as "kanga" and "vitenge". In the future, she plans to open another business. Pendo Y. thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics such as kanga and vitenge to make clothing

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Thành, năm nay 44 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có 3 con và còn đang đi học. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và  vay vốn để mở cửa hàng tạp hoá  Hiện tại công việc kinh doanh cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra chồng và con trai chị còn có thêm công việc buôn bán chim cảnh với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng nên kinh tế gia đình chị Thành đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn  vay 9.000.000 để mua bia và một số mặt hàng khác để bán hàng trong dịp tết nguyên đán
texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Thi H., 44 years old, lives in the town of Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. Her family includes 3 children who are going to school. In 2004, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to open a general store. Currently the business is bringing her an income of 2,000,000 VND/month. Her husband and son also has a business selling ornamental birds with an income of 3,000,000 VND/month so the family's finances are improving and becoming more stable day by day. In this round of funding, she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to buy beer and a number of other goods to sell during the lunar New Year's holidays.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer and other goods to sell

loans.name: Kayunga-Margret Mugumya Group

texts.en:
Margret M. (in the back on the right) is 40 years old and a widow. She has 4 children who are all in school. Margret sells cereals in Pallisa town. She mainly targets schools because they make bulk purchases. Margret purchases her stock directly from farmers at a fair price, enabling her to earn a profit of approximately 25% of sales.

The loan is enabling Margret replenish her stock of maize, beans, and rice. Her dream is to open up a chain of outlets in the neighbouring towns. As a widow, this business has enabled her sustain her family single-handedly. She hopes that with a positive turn of events in her business dream, her children will never lack.

loans.use: Purchase maize, beans and rice for re-sale

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is thirty-four-year-old Bertha F. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of one and eleven.

Bertha has been running a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 2007. This client’s business is selling wheat flour, sugar, margarine, bread, rice, cooking oil, tea leaves, and sodas. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Bertha currently earns about US$ 300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy more rice, soap, sugar, beans, and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to increase the inventory of her business. Bertha thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soap, sugar, beans, and cooking oil for her inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hươngnăm nay 35 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2006. Trong suốt quá trình tham gia Quỹ tình thương phần lớn số vốn vay được chị Hương đều sử dụng vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại đây cũng là  một  trong những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu  đáng kể từ  việc sửa xe đạp của chồng (bình quân 80 000/ngày) . Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000 để mua thêm phụ tùng sửa xe đạp và đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hương, 35 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 2006. In the past, she has used most of her loans from the Fund to raise animals, and today this is one of the main sources of income for her family. Besides raising animals, the family earns money from her husband’s bicycle repair shop (an average of about 80,000 VND (5 USD) per day). In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy spare bicycle parts and to invest in expanding the repair shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Mokhtabar

texts.en: Mokhtabar A. lives in Sabirabad, Azerbaijan. He is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Mokhtabar is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling livestock. He purchases young calves from local villagers, raises them for 5-7 months, and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Mokhtabar is thinking about expanding his business, because his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He wants to purchase more calves and fodder. He is requesting a loan of US $1,200 for the term of 15 months. Mokhtabar appreciates your helping him so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: To purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Quba

texts.en: Quba A. is a devoted mother that struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in their land for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband for more than 12 years. Slowly, the number of cows increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Quba's business.

loans.use: purchase two  calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tiện, hiện nay 46 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Sau 5 năm tham gia vào Quỹ, nhờ chăm chỉ và sử dụng nguồn vốn có hiệu quả gia đình chị có thêm điều kiện đầu tư phát triển kinh tế và mua sắm thêm tiện nghi trong gia đình. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị từ nghề nông và dệt chiếu, bên cạnh đó có thêm một phần thu nhập từ việc đi buôn bò của chồng chị. Vòng vốn tới chị Tiện muốn vay 8.000.000 để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán bò của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Tiện is 46 years old and has two grown children. After five years of participation in the TYM Fund, working hard and using her loans effectively, her family has been able to improve their financial situation and buy a few modern conveniences.
