The main sources of income for her family are farming and weaving straw mats. In addition, her husband earns some money from selling livestock. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Tiện hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to invest in her family’s business selling cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Nurush

texts.en: Nurush G. is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. He is 54 years old and married with five children. Nurush raises cattle, and he uses the income to support his family. He has a great appreciation for animals and wishes to increase his cattle business and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan. Nurush is a trusted client who has already successfully repaid a loan from AqroInvest. You could become an important part of his family's life. Nurush deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Kayunga-Agiro Immaculate Group

texts.en:
Immaculate A. (in the back, center) is 25 years old. She is a hard-working widow with 4 children. Immaculate brews and sells ajong (a local brew) in Pallisa. She purchases millet from farmers and uses it to prepare ajong which she sells to her customers. She has been running this business for 3 years and it has enabled her to care for her children.

She is using the loan to purchase more millet for making the brew and also jerrycans that will help in stocking it due to anticipated increase in production. Her major dream is to open up a bar and restaurant. She also wishes to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: Purchase millet for brewing and jerrycans for storage

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Kiên năm nay 29 tuổi.  Chị đang sống cùng chồng là cán bộ xã và hai con nhỏ. Năm 2003 chị  tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào  nghề dệt chiếu của gia đình. Hiện tại  bên cạnh nguồn thu từ việc dệt chiếu gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng với tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000 để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu dệt  chiếu tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Kiên, 29 years old, has two young children. Her husband works for their commune as a civil servant. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in her family’s business weaving straw mats. Between this business and her husband’s salary, the total income of her family is about 3,000,000 VND (175 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more raw materials for producing straw mats, and so to raise the income of her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Weaving straw mats

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
This is 38 year old Evelyne D. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of 5 and 13. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants who are are orphans. Evelyne D. has been running a grocery business since 2006 and her business is selling different drinks such as soda and beer. She works at her business 12 hours a day, 6 days a week and is assisted by two employees. Evelyne D. currently earns about 343USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500USD in order to purchase more drinks. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Evelyne thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en: Rafiqa G. is 53 years old and the mother of five children. For most of her married life, she has raised livestock. The self-sacrifice and attention that she brings to raising each one of her young cows has resulted in her being able increase the number of calves. As a result, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, giving her much pride and satisfaction. Her next goal is to expand the business into selling milk. This would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and enable her to pay the university costs for her children. In order to meet her goals, Rafiqa is asking for a loan to buy more cattle. Rafiqa hopes that her expanded business will help her realize the dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kanguma B South Group

texts.en:
A. Grace (back:right) is 47 years old. She is married with 8  children. She has 2 years experience selling unshelled groundnuts in Kumi and other regional  markets. She  purchases her stock from village farmers at fair rates, and resells, yielding a profit margin of 40%.

A. is using the loan proceeds to purchase a large quantity of unshelled groundnuts as she anticipates a scarcity and an increase in demand. She dreams of exporting all types of cereals to neighboring countries like Kenya and Sudan. She would like her children to finish school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of groudnuts.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Lựu, 28 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có 2 con còn nhỏ. Chị  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm  2003 và vay vốn để đầu tư vào dệt chiếu và nuôi hải sản. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập  3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới anh chị muốn vay 9.000.000 để mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lựu, 28 years old, has two young children and lives in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hoá province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003, and has used her loans to invest in weaving straw mats and aquaculture. Currently, these activities are the main sources of income for her family, bringing in about 3,000,000 VND (175 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more raw materials for the family business producing straw mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Weaving straw mats

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43 year old Sophia M. from Mwanza. She is a widow with four children, between the ages of 11 and 23 years old. Sophia M. has been running a Duka business- She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 2004. Sophia's business is doing well. She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 7 days per week. Sophia currently earns about 350usd from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400usd in order to buy more stock of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and tomato sauces. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sophia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and tomato sauces

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: N. Aisha is the payments controller of Bazira banking group in Mpigi. She is a single mother of 9 children, 7 are grown up while 2 are still in school. She also cares for 3 grandchildren, although their parents pay their school fees and partial upkeep. Aisha has a retail shop business that she has been running for 5 years from her home in Kibibi. She is also a farmer and grows mostly her own food to feed her family. In her shop, Aisha sells sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, paraffin maize flour and other items. The quantity of  products that she has sold has increased with the help of loans. She needs another loan to help with restocking her shop with more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, paraffin maize flour and so much more. With the profits she will be able to pay for her children upbringing.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, paraffin maize flour etc.for resale.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min S., 38, pictured here with her husband, is married and lives with her husband in the Batheay district, Kampong Cham province. She is a local doctor and sells medicine from her home to earn a living and is able to make $5 a day, while her husband is a rice farmer and typically makes $4 a day to help support the family.  This couple together have two school-aged children. Mrs. Min S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilisers for her husband's farm and the rest of the money will be used for additional medicines.

loans.use: To purchase fertilisers.

loans.name: Adalet

texts.en: Adalet Z. owns a little shop where he sells food products such as sugar, candies, and tea. He started his business in 1995, using his savings to purchase his first batch of sugar, salt, and tea products. The business was successful and he soon diversified his offerings with candies and macaroni. Today, his shop is well known in the food market. He is a very cheerful person, and he is always glad to meet anyone who comes into his shop. All his clients are satisfied with his service. Adalet wants to make his assortment of food products more competitive. In the near future, he dreams of expanding his business and buying other food goods such as milk, soft drinks, rice, and so on. He is requesting US $1,200. This loan will be an important part of the growth of Adalet’s business.

loans.use: To purchase food products as soft drinks and rice to increase profit

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Quế, 46 tuổi, ở Thanh Hoá. Hiện gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã lớn, trong đó có 2 con đã lập gia đình. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007, với số vốn vay đượcgia đình hcị đã đầu tư để chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới, chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000 để mua thêm lợn gà và mở rộng quy mô chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Quế, 46 years old, lives in Thanh Hoá province. She has three grown children, two of whom are married. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007, using her loans to invest in raising pigs. Currently, the income her family earns from raising pigs is supplemented with wages her husband earns as a construction worker, making a total of about 2,500,000 VND (146 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 6,000,000 VND (350 USD) to buy pigs and chickens and expand the size of her operation raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: S. Annet is the member of Kisimba in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted lady with a drugstore business selling medicines like panadols, anti-malarial syrups and tablets, in the service of the people in her locality. She has been in her lending group for 5 years and her reason for joining was to boost her drugstore's business. With her profits, Annet has been able to buy 2 cows that produce milk, a number of goats including young ones, plus a bicycle that she uses to collect grass for her animals. She has a plan of buying a plot of land, once she is able to accumulate enough savings. Her children are able to go to school and she is happy with where she is now. She needs a loan to help with buying more medicines, syringes, needles, cotton wool and others items to restock her store.

loans.use: To buy more medicines, syringes, needles, cotton wool and other items for restocking her drugstore.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic A. B. is married and has four dependents. The highest education he has received is junior high school.  His wife is a seamstress.   

Dominic sells electrical gadgets and parts on Lime Street in Elmina.  He has been engaged in this business since 1993. Dominic uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.  Dominic will use the loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The new profits earned from his expanded business will be spent developing and building a house on a piece of land that Dominic has acquired.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Bariaa

texts.en:
Bariaa is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Bariaa has owned a chocolate decorations and a sewing shop for seven years. In her shop, she sells chocolate and cakes and she also sews. Bariaa has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop like decoration items for the chocolate, ingredients for cakes, coffee, and thread for sewing. This is the first time that Bariaa has requested a loan.

Bariaa is special in her work because she is the only one in her area and she has competitive prices for her sewing business. Her clients are her friends, family members, neighbors and surrounding villages. Bariaa decided on doing this business because she learned how to do chocolate decoration and sewing. In the future, she plans to expand her business by working for wedding ceremonies and she also plans on purchasing a Nescafe machine and an ice cream machine.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her businesses

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin K., 55, pictured here, is married and lives with her husband in Batheay district, Kampong Cham province. She runs a grocery store from her home and is able to make US$ 4 a day, while her husband, Peam Pan, is a local teacher at a state school. On average, he makes US$ 1 a day. He has been teaching since 1990. This couple has four children; three of them are students and one is a professional tailor.

Since a tailoring business is lucrative and makes more money to help share the cost of living, Mrs. Bin K. is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit to open a tailor shop for her daughter.

loans.use: To invest in starting up a tailoring business

loans.name: Ato

texts.en:
Ato A. C. is married. His wife is sells chemicals. The highest level of education he has received is senior high.

Ato A. sells electrical gadgets and parts in Elmina, which he has done since 2004. He uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand of his costumers. Ato A. plans to reinvest the profit back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hoàn, 28 tuổi,chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Hiện tại chị đang kinh doanh săm lốp ô tô còn chồng chị làm nghề lái xe. Với thu nhập 4.000.000 đ/ tháng việc hàon trả vốn của gia đình chị Hoàn cũng rất thuận lợi. 
Chị Hoàn đang mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Lê Thị Hoàn is 28 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá with her husband and their young child. She sells car tires & tube and her husband is a truck driver. Thei combined income is 4.000.000 VND a month. She has no problem repaying the loan money. She is requesting 5.000.000 VND to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her tire & tube business

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Зарипов Хикматулло житель города Вахдат. Проживает в центре города и там же имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Товар привозит из города Душанбе . Бизнесом занимается уже 4 года. Он женат , детей не имеет . Но готовится стать отцом. Кредит планирует получить для того , чтобы сделать небольшой ремонт в магазине. Создав лучшие условия он сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo Z. lives in the center of Vakhdat. He owns a food store in the same neighborhood. Hikmatullo Z. has been in business for 4 years. He delivers his goods from Dushanbe. Hikmatullo Z. is married and is planning to become a father. Hikmatullo Z. will use this loan to renovate his store to attract new clients. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store renovation

loans.name: Snovbar

texts.ru: Холова Сановбар проживает в городе Вахдат. Занимается шитьем платьев на заказ. Кроме того уже три года занимается пчеловодством. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы закупить сахар для подкормки пчел в зимний период , а так же дополнительную пчелинную семью. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Сановбар 43 года , она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Они живут очень дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Snovbar H. lives in Vakhdat. She is 43, married, and has 5 children. Snovbar makes custom dresses. In addition, she raises bees. Snovbar H. will use this loan to purchase a family of bees and sugar to feed the bees during the winter. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and a family of bees

loans.name: Zamin

texts.en: Zamin F. is a young, energetic man. At the early age of 17, he started his own business in order to support his parents. His business is selling food products such as eggs, soft drinks, and so on in the southern city of Azerbaijan. His store is located next to his house so he is always near his parents. This business allows him not only to support his family, but also to continue his University education. Zamin needs to increase the variety of goods he sells and is asking for a loan of US $1,200 with a term of 15 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business and earn more income. This loan will be important to the growth of Zamin’s business.

loans.use: To purchase food products to sell, such as tea, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Holnazar

texts.ru: Пирназаров Холназар житель города Вахдат. Возраст 38 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Работает водителем такси. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Для того, чтобы развивать  сферу животноводства , он планирует получить  кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить поголовье скота и увеличить прибыльность дела.
texts.en:
Holnazar P. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. He has secondary education. He works as a taxi driver. Besides that he does animal husbandry. To expand his animal husbandry business he plans to get a loan for a term of 12 months. This will help Holnazar increase the head count of cattle and increase the profits of his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Mận, 26 tuổi, ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có một con nhỏ 5 tuổi. Hiện tại thu nhập của  gia đình phụ thuộc vào công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán hàng tạp hoá và tiền công làm nghề cắt tóc của chồng với thu nhập  2.000.000/ tháng. Chị mới tham gia vào Quỹ từ tháng 12 năm 2008, chị mong muốn được vay vốn với mức là 5.000.000 để đầu tư vào buôn bán  nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Trần Thị Mận is 26 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá with her family. She has a 5 years old child. Her family income of 2.000.000 VND a month comes from various sources: raising poultry, selling grocery, her husband is a hair stylist. She is recently became a TYM fund member in December 2008. She wishes to get a loan of 5.000.000 VND to invest in her grocery store in order to increase her income

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandis for grocery store

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Hồng, năm nay 42 tuổi, chị có 2 con đều đang đi học. Hiện nay, nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ buôn bán kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị 3.500.000đ/tháng. Vòng vay tới chị Hồng muốn vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư buôn bán kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Hồng, 42 years old, has two children who attend school. Currently, the main source of income for her family is their grocery store, from which they earn about 3,500,000 VND (204 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Hồng hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in buying inventory for her grocery shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide E. is married and has no children. The highest level of education she has received is senior high. 

Adelaide sells pharmaceutical drugs in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. She uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses. Adelaide will use the loan to buy more and better quality drugs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adelaide will save towards a building a house with her husband for the family.

loans.use: to buy more and better quality drugs for resale

loans.name: Holberdi

texts.ru: Нодиров Холберды житель города Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает бухгалтером , а так же имеет частную миниферму. занимается животноводством уже пять лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Holberdi N. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 45 years old, married and has six children. He has high education. He works as an accountant and also owns a small farm. He has been in the animal husbandry for five years now. He plans to get a loan to increase the headcount of cattle. Holberdi plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert E. is single parent and has six dependents. The highest level of schooling he has received is junior high. 

Robert sells electrical gadgets and parts in Elmina, which he has done since 2002. He uses his income to pay for his children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. The loan will be used to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. Robert plans to reinvest the profits back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị N., 22 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hóa. Chị N. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Hiện tại nguồn thu nhập  của gia đình chủ yếu là tư chăn nuôi và làm máy súc với  thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000  để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm máy súc
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị N., 22 years old, lives in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and making excavating machines, with a total income of about 3,000,000 VND (175 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in both raising animals and making excavators.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Nazirsho

texts.ru: Зайниддинов Назиршо проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 35 лет, холост , детей не имеет. Живет с родителями.Один обеспечивает пожилых родителей, а так же семью брата. Имеет средне -специальное образование. По профессии портной. Шьет брюки на заказ , а так же для продажи. Кредит необходим для того , чтобы купит оверлог. Это упростит ему работу , а также улучшить качество производимой продукции. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazirsho Z. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 35 years old, not married and has no children. He lives with his parents. He supports his elderly parents and also his brother's family. He has specialized secondary education and is a tailor by profession. He makes custom pants for clients and also for resale. He needs a loan to buy overlock sewing machine. It will make Nazirsho's job much easier and also increase the quality of his production. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is married and has three children. The highest level of schooling he has received is junior high school. 

John sells electrical gadgets and parts in Elmina, which he has done since 2002. His wife operates a chop bar. John uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The profits from the expanded business will allow John to continue building a house for his family, which he has not been able to complete due to inadequate funding.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is married and has two children. She supports her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  She has received a primary education. Her husband is a trader. 

Felicia sells a local meal popularly known as 'banku,' which is made out of corn.  She serves it with fried fish and hot sauce. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country.  She has been engaged in this business since 2003.  Additionally, she sells fabric at the Atabadzi bus stop in Elmina. Her loan will be used to purchase maize (which is used to prepare banku), fresh fish and other ingredients.  This will enable her to prepare more food to sell.  The profits from her business will combined with her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land on which to build their family house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make banku

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru: Сафарова нина живет в городе Вахдат. Ей 54 года и 15 лет она работает в швейном ателье. Шьет одежде на заказ. Нина замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Ее деятельность приносит доход неплохой. Ей хватает , чтобы прокормить семью. Но для тоо, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов , а так же улучшить качество производимой продукции , хочет купить новую швейную машинку. Для этого он решила получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nina S. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 54 years old and she has been working in a sewing shop for fifteen years. She makes custom clothing. Nina is married and has eight children. Her business gives her good income. It's enough to feed the family. But to attract new clientelle and to improve the quality of her production she wants to buy a new sewing machine. For this Nina needs a loan which she will pay of within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Demba Guissé est chauffeur de profession. Marié et pére de deux enfants, il tient une boutique de vente et de réparation de téléphones portables à  kolda, sur la route du camp militaire. Sa profession l'oblige à embaucher son frére dans sa boutique qu'il vient controler réguliérement. Ainsi cette activité lui permet non seulement de donner du travail à son frére, mais aussi de subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille. Ainsi il voudrait extendre son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande sociale assez importante et surtout conserver l'emploi de son frére.
texts.en:
Demba Guissé is a driver. He is married and has two children. He has a store where he sells and fixes cell phones in Kolda, on the road to the military camp. Because of his job, he has to hire his brother in his store which he checks regularly. Not only does this business allow him to give his brother a job, but also to adequately cover his household expenses. He would like to expand his business in order to satisfy his customers' demands and especially to continue to employ his brother.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and repair cell phones.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị  L., 39 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn, vịt đẻ và làm ruộng.Hiện tại gia đình chị đang có hơn 100 con lợn, 200 con vịt đẻ, thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ ể đ ầu t ư mua th ức ăn ph ục v ụ cho ch ăn nu ôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 39 years of age, lives in Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2007. The major sources of income of her family are from raising pigs, raising ducks, and farming. Currently her family has more than 100 pigs and 200 ducks that produce an average income of VND6,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to buy foods for livestock and poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy foods for livestock and poultry

loans.name: Assifuah

texts.en:
Assifuah M. is married and has three children. The highest level of schooling he has received is junior high school. His wife is a trader.

Assifuah repairs electical appliances and also sells electrical gadgets and parts in Elmina.  He has been engaged in this business since 2006. Assifuah uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The profits will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махмадиева ахина . 26 лет, не замужем. Занимается пошивом национальных платьев. Шьет уже 3 года. Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы закупить материал. Это поможет ей увеличить объем производимой продукции и даст возможность увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahina M. is 26 years old, not married. She sews national Tajik dresses and has been doing it for the past three years. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics. This will help her increase her production volume and increase her profits. She will be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Thể, 46 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2007 Gia đình anh chị có 3 con đều đã lớn và có khả năng lao động phụ giúp cho gia đình, chồng chị làm nghề lái xe con trai làm  ở cảng Lễ Môn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị hi ện nay  từ chăn nuôi, lương của chồng và sự hỗ trợ thêm của các con là 3.000.000/tháng.. Vòng vốn tới Chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi T., 46 years of age, lives in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. She has participated to T. Fund since 2007. Her family has 3 children who are grown up and can support T. works in T. family. Her husband is a driver and her son works in Le Mon Port. T. average income of her family from livestock raising, salary of T. husband, and financial support from her children is VND3,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest in livestock/poultry raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock/poultry

loans.name: Alakara Group

texts.en:
Jane A. (in the front on the left) is 38 years old, married with 7 children. She has 6 years' experience in selling foodstuffs such as fish, sweet potatoes, green vegetables, and pounded groundnuts. She purchases cereals from the wholesalers whereas she gets the sweet potatoes and vegetables from village farmers.

Her profit margin lies at approximately 25% of sales. Jane is using the loan to purchase fish, sweet potatoes, and groundnuts. Her ambition is to become a cereals wholesaler.She is a hard-working lady and thereby helps her husband in caring for the family.

loans.use: Purchase fish, sweet potatoes, and groundnuts for re-sale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 27 years old. She is not married. Elena lives with her parents. They have a good and friendly family. She owns a retail business and sells women's clothing at the central market in Melitopol. Elena has been in this business for 6 years. Her relatives who also own small retail businesses helped Elena to start one of her own and choose the right type of inventory to sell. Elena is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to sell more winter clothing and use the income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen P. is married and has three children. His wife sells eggs. He has attended junior high school. 

Stephen sells electrical gadgets and parts at Eshaman Junction in Elmina, which he has done since 2002. Stephen uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The profits from the business will be saved towards acquiring a piece of land for the building a family house.  Having a family house allows Stephen to stop paying rent and provide a comfortable shelter for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Одинаев Сафар проживает в районе Рудаки. Женат , имеет пятерых детей. Жена нигде не работает. Кредит запрашивает для бизнеса. Занимается он купле-продажей овощей и фруктов. Привозит товар из отдаленных кишлаков и сдает оптом своим постоянным клиентам. В связи с сезоном ему приходится закупать товар с запасом на длительный срок , поэтому кредит ему просто необходим. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safar O. lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has five children. His wife is not working. He is asking for a loan for his business. He is in sales of fruits and vegetables. Safar brings his produce from remote villages and then sells it wholesale to his regular clients. Due to the season he has to buy the produce for a long term and this is why he needs the loan. He can pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase produce circulation

loans.name: Dam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đàm Thị Bát, 58 tuổi ở Thanh Hóa. Gia đình chị có 3 con và đều đã lớn, có khả năng phụ giúp thêm cho gia đình. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ nghề nông. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007 và với việc sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả anh chị đã có điều kiện cho con ăn học ra trường, có việc làm, sửa sang được nhà cửa, đời sống gia đình được nâng cao. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000/ tháng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, sửa sang chuồng trại.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dam Thi B., 58 years old, lives in Thanh Hoa province.Her family has 3 grown-up children who can support the works in the family. The main source of income of her family is farming. She joined the Fund in 2007. With the profitable use of loans, she has money to support her children to study until graduation and employment, to renovate her house, and to improve the conditions of living.

In this loan cycle she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to buy poultry and to renovate the coop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry and to renovate the coop

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander B. is married and has three children. He has received a senior high school education. His wife is a trader. 

Alexander sells electrical appliances at the chapel square in Elmina, which he has done since 2003. Alexander uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The profits from his expanded business will be invested in his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Quyền, năm nay 47 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chị  tham gia vào Qũy từ năm 2007. Gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành, trong đó có 2 con đã đi làm. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là chăn nuôi vịt đẻ v à làm ruộng. Ngo ài th ờigian gi úp vợ chăn nuôi chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt  cá sông. Hiện tại   thu nhập   bình quân của gia đình chị đạt  4.000.000 đ/ tháng . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, xây sửa chuồng trại
texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh Thi Q., 47 years of age, lives in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. She has participated in the Fund since 2007. Her family has three grown-up children, two of them are employed. The main sources of income of her family are from raising ducks and farming. Her husband, apart from helping her to raise ducks, also catches fresh-water fishes. Currently, the average income of the family is VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest in poultry and to renovate the coop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry and to renovate the coop

loans.name: Wakulima Group

texts.en:
Kidawa Issa S., age 45, is married with two children, ages 15 and 7. She has a business selling vegetables, chicken, and fabrics. She started her businesses about 15 years ago and works daily from 6am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 74.

This will be Kidawa’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase her stocks of all her inventory.

Kidawa will share this loan with subgroup A of the Wakulima group. The subgroup has 7 members who run shops, sell charcoal, clothes, vegetables, fruits, TV and radios. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Kidawa is 1st from right, in the back, covering her head in dark brown.

loans.use: To expand her business inventory

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đặng Thị Luyến, 29 tuổi ở Thanh Hóa. Gia đình chị có  1 con còn nhỏ, hi ện t ịa ch ị Luyến đi chợ  buôn bán gà còn chồng chị làm nghề cơ khí, thu nhập cũng khá ổn định. Chị tham gia Qũy từ năm 2007, với số vốn vay được anh chị đã mở rộng thêm xưởng cơ khí, đ ầu tư kinh doanh, buôn bán đời sống được nâng cao với thu nhập 3.500.000 đ/ th áng.. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn vay 9000.000 để đầu tư buôn bán ngan, gà và giúp chồng mở rộng thêm quy mô của xưởng cơ khí.
texts.en:
Mrs Dang Thi L., 29 years of age, lives in Thanh Hoa province. Her family has one young child. Currently Mrs. L. buys and sells chickens in the market. Her husband is a mechanic with a fairly stable income. She joined the Fund in 2007. With the loans, she and her husband expanded the mechanical workshop and increased the working capital for chicken trading, therefore the condition of living has improved, with an income of VND3,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest further in duck and chicken trade, and help her husband to expand the mechanical workshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in duck and chicken trade, expand mechanical workshop

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Upendo K., age 28, is married with two children, ages 6 and 1. She sells food in the marketplace. She started this business in 2008 and works daily from 6am until 10pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 89.

This will be Upendo’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first to start selling cold drinks and beers and has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to buy a blender and a good stock of fruit, so that she can make and sell more juice.

Upendo will share this loan with subgroup A of the Kichangani group. The subgroup has 6 members, who sell vegetables, cosmetics, "bites", clothes, utensils, fruit, other foods, etc. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Upendo is the 1st from the left in front (black blouse).

loans.use: To buy a blender and more fruit to sell juice

loans.name: Idayyet

texts.en:
Idayyet A. is a hard-working and dedicated businessman, 53 years old. He is married with three children. Idayyet has operated a business selling men's clothing in the central market of Sabirabad for the past 12 years. Idayyet already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has customers who always come to him.

Idayyet wishes his children to get a good education, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. As his children are growing up, their expenses are rising accordingly, so in order to expand his business, Idayyet is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within 15 months. The well-being of Idayyet’s family and his business are in your hands. Idayyet and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: purchase more clothing for his inventory to increase profit

loans.name: Anyumu B Central Group

texts.en:
Grace A. (on the right) is 40 years old. She is single but the guardian of her late sister's 4 children. She is a hard-working lady and has been selling fruit and vegetables for 2 years now. She purchases fresh and healthy supplies from village farmers daily and this has kept her customers satisfied.

She is using the loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables. Her ambition is to run a wholesale/retail shop so as to earn income that can sustain her family. The rest of her group members are involved in businesses such as retail shops, cereals, and a clothing business.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married and has two grown children and many grandchildren. This year she will be 60 years old.  She lives with her husband in a one bedroom apartment.   Nadiya sells children's clothing at the Melitopol central market. She started this business 8 years ago. Nadiya has her own kiosk and takes good care of it. When she was asked why she decided to sell children's clothing Nadiya said that she loves children and wants them to have good clothing. She does not charge high prices so that parents can afford new clothing for their children. 
Nadiya is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Iznulla

texts.en:
Iznulla M. is 49 year old and raises cows. He sells dairy products to local people and factories. He is married and has three children. He grew up in a farming family and from an early age, Iznulla has learned how to raise, breed, and sell dairy cows and other livestock.

Iznulla would like to expand his business and purchase one additional cow and fodder for 1,200 USD. The purpose of the loan is to expand his business and improve the quality of life for his family. He is working hard towards this goal and hopes that this loan will help him make his financial income more stable.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Ekhsan

texts.en:
Ekhsan M. is 31 years of age and lives with his wife and two sons. He is a livestock breeder who has calves that he cares for and grazes every morning. He has been doing this for the past ten years and considers it very profitable. He takes his livestock to the pastures every morning for nourishment. After caring for them for several months, he then takes them to be sold. This phase is complicated due to transportation issues. Because he does not own his own vehicle, he must adjust to the schedules and prices that are offered to him.

Ekhsan’s two children are his reason for continuing his efforts as a livestock breeder and farmer. Today, he wishes to invest in expanding his herd of cattle, so as to be more profitable in the markets. As this is the only financial source in his family, Ekhsan counts on your help!

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Samaya

texts.en:
Samaya M. is a very hard-working woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has five children. She works raising and feeding animals with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates feelings of satisfaction in her because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for grazing.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable grandchildren. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to buy two baby calves and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar A. rents a little store where he sells foodstuffs. He buys his goods in a city which is one hour away from his home village. He goes for goods every week. His family members help him at the store. His wife doesn’t have another job but helps her husband in his business. His products are popular in his town for being cheap and fresh. That’s why he has many regular customers.

Ilqar has a wish to build his own store but needs a lot of money for that. So he wants to borrow money and use it in his business to make more profit. He will start saving money from his profits for a store and hopes that soon he will be able to start building a store of his own.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for his little store

loans.name: Arbob

texts.en:
Arbob G. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 5 years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets.

Arbob keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife who help him with caring for the animals. Now Arbob needs a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for purchasing more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand his cattle business

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.en:
Djumagul K. is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children. Djumagul is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband.

Slowly the number of cows increased and with them, her customers started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 2200 Somoni (650 USD) for a term of 11 months. Be an important part of the growth of Djumagul’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is one of the poorer of the 15 former Soviet republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in agricultural production and the manufacturing sector. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia. While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON International has 8 branch offices throughout Tajikistan and their entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of October 2008, IMON International had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549. Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand her business

loans.name: Allakhshukur

texts.en:
Allakhshukur K. is a 48-year-old barber who runs his own barber shop in the small village of Sabirabad. He is married with two adorable children. His job is the only financial source for his family, and that’s why Allakhshukur spends most of his day in the barber shop. He comes to work at 8 and finishes at 11 at night. Most of his clientele are males from age 3 to 70.

Allakhshukur dreams of opening his own big barber shop with several master barbers in it and of being the leading master barber in the whole city. For the first step he would like to improve conditions in his shop and for this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. With this loan he will purchase new modern barber tools and will make a small repair to his barber shop.

loans.use: purchase modern barber tools and improve conditions in his barber shop

loans.name: Botirjon

texts.en:
Botirjon N. is a 38-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Botirjon has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he fattens and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them.

Every day, Botirjon gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle. Botirjon says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Botirjon would like to expand his business and purchase three cows. For this purpose, he has applied for 4000 Somoni ($ 1175 USD) and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso S. is a 42-year-old woman, married with three children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Nuriniso. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of livestock. She started this business 6 years ago with the support of her husband.

Now that Nuriniso has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity, she would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Nuriniso is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (725 US Dollars). She has agreed to repay this loan within 11 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dream become a reality.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for fattening and selling

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
Gulomjon B. is married and lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. He works as a taxi driver. He loves being self-employed and managing his own time. Gulomjon has a nice car and offers taxi services around his region. He is a workaholic and is always ready to work non-stop, even on the weekend.

Gulomjon has been in this business for 2 years. Today he is planning to replace the fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel change, as this is cheaper than petrol. And also his car needs some fixing. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD. This will generate additional profit as he finds more clients. This business is a crucial segment of his life, since it is Gulomjon's opportunity to support his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing a kapron gas-cylinder for his car's fuel supply system

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.en:
Erkinjon offers taxi services in Isfara, Tajikistan. He has been working in this sphere of business for 4 years. Erkinjon admits he has benefited a lot from the financial assistance he has received from IMON International, Tajikistan. Currently, his business has grown to the point where he takes in 15 – 20 $ per day.

Erkinjon is hoping to buy a better and trendier vehicle in the future to offer more high-class services to his clients. Now his car needs thorough repairs for which he is requesting a loan. Erkinjon thinks that this loan will help him move closer to the fulfillment of his plans, as due to repairing his car, he will increase his clientele. Some day when Erkinjon saves enough, he is hoping to buy a newer but affordable vehicle.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for a thorough repair of his car

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with one child. She rents a space at Furshet grocery store and sells dishes and cosmetics. Olga started this business 6 years ago. She likes working with people and enjoys selling high quality products. She is a hard working person and is determined to develop this business further.
Olga is requesting a loan of $600 to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive more income and to be able to fix her apartment and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Isioma

texts.en: Isioma N. is 39 years old and is married with 6 children. Isioma lives in Asaba, Delta state. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She has lots of customers and she works to meet the demands of her customers. She needs kiva's loan assistance to help expand her business. Isioma is requesting a loan of N100000 to purchase more pepper soup ingredients and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann U. sells prayer items like candles, olive oil, mustard seed, bibles, incense, etc. Ann is 50 years old and married with 4 children. Her youngest child is an under graduate at the institute of management and technology in Enugu state. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more prayer items to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more prayer items to sell

loans.name: Kanoat

texts.en:
K. Kanoat is 41 years old. She is married and has a child. Kanoat has been a running grocery store for the past 3 years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents in her store. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Kanoat is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her shop to buy groceries again. Kanoat is seeking to keep her business strong and has requested a loan of 3000 Somoni for the term of 7 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Kanoat reach all of her aspirations.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her supply and variety of food products for resale

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde A. is a hardworking woman. She has a shop where she sells drinks and provisions like noodles, sugar, toothpaste, bathing soap, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ejeme

texts.en: Ejeme B. has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, moi-moi, fufu, etc. The demands for her cooked foods are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 50 years old and married with 2 children. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and  sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells sarongs. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more sarongs to sell to her customers. Veronica is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. sells sarongs, clothes, and underwear. She sells out of her home to people in her community. Linda lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more clothes, sarongs and underwear to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity N. raises poultry and  she sells birds and eggs. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more birds to sell. Charity is 34 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more birds to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is 24 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. Rosemary sells provisions such as loaves of bread, tinned tomatoes, noodles, etc. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta C. sells yams wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for a long time. Benedicta is 41 years old and married with 5 children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married with no children. She sells women's clothing at the city market. She uses a tent to cover her goods from snow and rain. Elena brings all the inventory and the tent to the market every work day.  Besides the clothing business, Elena also sells tea and coffee at the market to increase her profits.
Elena would like to get a loan of $475. She needs more money to purchase clothing for sale and to increase her inventory. Even though this time is difficult for her, she believes that consistency and hard work are the key factors to success in business.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Theresa sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a businessman.

Theresa uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Theresa will use the loan to increase her working capital so as to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement A. is single and has no children. He has attended school through senior high. Clement melts metals and uses them to manufacture coal pots and locally made ovens. Coal pot is a of stove that burns charcoal as a fuel. He has done this work in Elmina, since 2004. Clement uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Clement will use the loan to increase his purchase of scrap metal and tools which will enable him to expand production. With the new profits from his expanded business, Clement plans to reinvest back into his business to improve his profit and enable him meet his financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To increase the purchase of scrap metal and buy tools to expand production.

loans.name: Abuah

texts.en:
Abuah H. sells groceries and fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Elmina. Abuah has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a motor mechanic.

Abuah has been selling groceries and fish since 2004. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. sells clothing and cosmetics at Ankaful near Elmina. Florence has received junior high education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband works in arts and crafts. Florence has been selling clothing and cosmetics since 2006. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more clothing and cosmetics for re-sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family. The items she has in hand are samples of the kind of goods she sells.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy goods for re-sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.fr: Gloria D., 32 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Gloria veut renforcer sa boutique en produits alimentaires (riz, boissons et divers. Elle a la charge de la scolarité de sa fille et participe aux charges familiales. Cette activité va lui permettre d’améliorer ses conditions de vie  et de faciliter l’accès à certains produits à la population de son village natal  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Gloria D., 32 years old, is married and cares for three children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Peyrissac village bank for seven and a half years. Gloria wants to stock her store with food such as rice and refreshments among other items. She is responsible for the cost of sending her daughter to school and contributes to the household expenses. This business will allow her to improve her living conditions and bring certain products to the people of her hometown. She is asking for this loan which will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products (rice, refreshments, etc) to stock her store.

loans.name: Ndèye Badji

texts.fr: Ndèye Badji Sané, 54 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Boucotte Peyrissac depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à  acheter et revendre du jus de citron et de l’huile de palme .Elle achète en Guinée pour revendre à Dakar. Ndèye veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye Badji Sané, 54 years old, is married and cares for seven children. She has been a member of the Boucotte Peyrissac village bank for seven and a half years. She buys and sells lemon juice and palm oil. She travels to Guinée to buy and sells in Dakar. Ndèye wants to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell lemons and palm oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes B. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Agnes sells "gari" which she uses cassava to produce. The raw cassava is milled and the starch extracted from it. The milled cassava is then fried to become "gari". It is popularly eaten in the country around Elmina, and she has been selling it since 1990. Her husband is a cleaner at the university of Cape Coast.

Agnes uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Agnes will use this loan to increase her working capital to buy cassava in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her family.

In the picture, the sacks contain the cassava dough which is used for making "gari".

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy cassava in larger quantities

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 38-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. Samar has been selling household items and flowers for two years and a half. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for Valentine’s Day. This is the first time that Samar has requested a loan.

Her customers are her friends, family members, and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding customers. She decided on doing this business because she knows and likes doing handicrafts, accessories, and flowers arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for Valentine’s Day

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received no formal education. Cecilia sells "gari" which she uses cassava to produce. The raw cassava is milled and the starch extracted from it. The milled cassava is then fried to become "gari". It is popularly eaten in the country.

Cecilia also makes palm oil for sale at Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a farmer. Cecilia uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Cecilia will use the loan to increase her capital to buy cassava and palm fruit in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

The containers behind her are what she keeps the oil she produces in. She wasn't producing anything at the time this picture was taken, and that is why she was asked to sit by the containers.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy cassava and palm fruit in larger quantities

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. sells clothing and fabrics at Ankaful, near Elmina. Mary has received no formal education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a security man. Mary has been selling clothing and fabrics since 2005. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric and meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business, and increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family size.

In the picture are examples of the type of clothing she trades in.

loans.use: To enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric and meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow. She had to raise her two children on her own. Nina admits she has had to struggle with many challenges before she could finally find her niche in business. She start selling footwear to provide for her family’s basic needs. Nina has been in the business for seven years.  
The business is the sole source of income for Nina’s family. A true entrepreneur, she always tries to determine client needs and preferences. In addition to her marketing skills, Nina brings the qualities of efficient and focused work to creating affordable and high quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her clients. Today Nina is requesting a loan of $1075 to purchase additional inventory. With increased profits, she plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in Ordzhonikidze. Olga sells clothing in the central market of her home town and also travels to neighboring villages to sell her inventory there. She has been in this trade for 11 years. 
Olga is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase additional merchandise for further sale. She would like to use additional financial assistance to grow her business even further. Olga loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given to provide for and sustain her family of four. We believe Olga’s natural liveliness and optimism along with responsibility and serious business approach will help her make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a market entrepreneur from Kahovka, south of Ukraine. She sells clothing in the city market. Lubov has been in this business for 15 years. She was forced to find ways to survive and earn her living which is why she launched this business. 
Lubov is seeking a loan of $600 to increase capital. She is hoping to press on with her expansion plans and ultimately save enough to open a new vending facility in the future. We believe Lubov’s enterprising spirit will help her achieve all her goals and see her dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio V.  ha tendido ya un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder cambiar el techo de madera de su vivienda ya el actual esta ya acabado y tiene algunos orificios y en temporada de lluvia se gotea la casa.
Está solicitando de su cooperación para esta mejora ya que son de edad avanzada, y como único ingreso es el que obtiene de árbitro en un campo de deportes.Con una parte de sus ingresos será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio V. has already had a loan with FVP, which he paid on time. He is requesting a loan so he can replace the wooden roof on his house now that his current roof is worn out and has some cracks. During the rainy season, the water leaks into his house. He is requesting your cooperation for this home improvement since he and his wife are advanced in years, and the only income he earns comes from working as a referee on a sports field. He will use part of his income to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace a wooden roof

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola I. is 47 years old and married with 8 children. She sells goats. She has been in this business for a long time. Bola is requesting a loan amount of N100000 to increase the number of goats that she has to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget I. is a hardworking woman. She has a shop where she sells baby items. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 35 years old and married with 2 children.
