She needs the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more baby items for resale. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items for resale

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssata Dembélé est âgée de 46 ans, mariée elle vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et  ses 6  enfants au village de Banankoro à 10 km de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas  fréquenté l’école  pour  des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après avoir assisté plusieurs années cette dernière,  riche  est son expérience en matière de commerce. Dès  son mariage, son mari lui achète un réfrigérateur pour vendre des jus et cela depuis  17 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans le village de Banankoro et environnant. Le jeudi (jour de foire de la ville e Ségou) elle est submergée par une grande clientèle composée de charretiers, vendeurs de poules et des mamans. D’après elle son nom sert à arrêter les désordres d’un enfant turbulent  en lui sommant de ne pas lui offrir les jus fabriqués de Aichata .Dans l’intention d’agrandir son activité avec renforcement de son fonds de commerce qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 30 mois. Après avoir fait 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel pour un montant de 250 000FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 2 sacs de sucres, 4 sachets de poudre de jus, 7 sachets d’emballages. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place et effectue ses ventes toujours au comptant.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui servira de payer les charges scolaires de ses enfants qui sont au lycée de Ségou (frais de carburants).
texts.en:
Aïssata Dembélé is 46, married and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and her six children in the village of Banankoro, 10 kilometres from the town of Ségou, in Mali. Because of social reasons she never attended school and started working to make money at a very young age selling condiments with her mother. After helping her mother for many years she had become a very knowledgeable businesswoman. When she married 17 years ago, her husband bought her a refrigerator to sell juice. She has a very good reputation in the village of Banankoro and nearby villages. On Thursdays, market day in Ségou, she is swamped by her many customers, mainly carters, chicken sellers and mothers. She tells us that her name has the power to stop children's misbehaviour: one has only to tell them that if they don't behave, they won't get any of Aïssata's juices. She intends to expand her business using this loan which she is requesting as working capital from the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with this MFI for 30 months. After having been a member of five group loans, all repaid, she is asking for this, her first individual loan for 250,000 FCFA with which she will buy 2 bags of sugar, 4 bags of powdered juice, 7 bundles of bags. She buys her raw materials locally and always sells for cash. She expects to make a profit of 75,0000 FCFA. She will use this profit to pay for her children's schooling as they attend high school in Ségou (fuel costs).

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, bags, and powdered juice.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan O. sells rice, palm oil and grand pepper etc. She started in 2003 and she hopes now, to expand her business. She is requesting a loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more rice and palm oil to sell. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Luis Fernando S. le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas para sus hijas  ya que son jovencitas y necesitan su propio espacio y el desea lo mejor para ellas. Pero por el momento no cuanta con el capital necesario para realizar la mejora, es por eso que solicita este préstamo y así sus niñas ya tenga su propia recamara.
Don Luis Fernando tiene un pequeño taller de herrería  desde hace más de cuatro años, el cual es el ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Fernando S.’s home is missing a room for his daughters. As they are now young ladies they need their own space and he wishes the best for his daughters. But at the moment he doesn’t have the necessary capital to make this improvement, so he is soliciting this loan so that his daughters can have their own bedroom. Luis Fernando has had a small blacksmith shop for more than four years, and this is his family’s source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom for his daughters

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara O. sells firewood wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N 40,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. Clara is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata Djiré est âgée de 50 ans, mariée elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants  dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec plusieurs autres ménages dans le quartier Somono de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ancienne élève coranique, elle commença très tôt à mener les activités commerciales notamment la fabrication du savon  indigène, qu’elle apprena auprès de son grand frère. Après avoir fait plusieurs années d’apprentissage riche d’expériences et de savoir faire, elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant  10 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation à Ségou et dans les villages environnants où elle a beaucoup de clients.
Pour faire du savon traditionnel, elle brûle 5 litres d’huiles de karité dans une marmité ou dans une barrique ensuite elle met 40 litres d’eau, ½ kgs de farine  et 3 kgs de soude caustique dans cette marmite. Puis elle procède au malaxage  à l’aide d’une grande louche jusqu’avoir la pâte servant de savon.
Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle qu’elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel pour un montant de 150 000FCFA et compte l’utiliser pour acheter 20 kgs d’huile de karité, 6 kgs de farine, 9 kgs de soude caustique. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Ségou. Madame Diarra Aminata Djiré vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes ruraux et citadins.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et de faire face à certains événements sociaux (baptême, mariage). Son ambition est de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Aminata Djiré is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and four children in a large traditional family with several other households in the neighbourhood of Somono in Ségou, Mali. She is a former student of the Qur'an. She began her commercial activities at a very young age, notably making soap which she learned from her older brother. After many years of apprenticeship she is now very experienced and knowledgeable as she has been making soap for 10 years now and enjoys great reknown in Ségou and nearby villages where she has many customers. In order to make traditionnal soap, she burns five litres of shea oil in a pot or in a barrel, to which she then adds 40 litres of water, ½ kilogram of flour and 3 kilograms of caustic soda. She then mixes everything with a large ladle until she has a paste from which to make the soap. She has a 3-year relationship with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinancial institution and is asking for a loan to increase her business so that she can satisfy her customers' demand. She has had three previous group loans, all repaid. This is her first individual loan. With the loan requested of 150,000 FCFA she will buy 20 kilograms of shea oil, 6 kilograms of flour, 9 kilograms of caustic soda. She gets her raw materials locally in Ségou. Diarra Aminata Djiré sells both for cash and on credit to clients, both men and women, rural and city-dwellers. She expects to make a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which she will use to pay for her children's tuition and a number of social events (baptism, wedding). Her goal is to build a house.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make soap.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells loaves of bread by hawking them in her community. The demand for her bread is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. J. sells fish. The demand for her fish is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is 35 years old and married with 6 children. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Dora Hilda

texts.es:
La casa que habita la señora R. es muy amplia, pero no siempre fue así, como la mayoría de las familias de este sector poco a poco han ido fabricando su vivienda; con el paso del tiempo han logrado mucho, pero aún no es suficiente,  en este instante pretenden aplicar el enjarre exterior, para cambiar la apariencia de su casa.
Doña Dora trabaja como auxiliar contable para una empresa transportista, además de atender a sus 4 hijos para que crezcan sanos y con buenos hábitos.
Su colaboración será infinitamente agradecida por esta familia.
texts.en:
The house Mrs. Ramirez lives in is large, but this was not always the case. Like the majority of the families in this area, she has built her home little by little. In time, they have accomplished a lot, but their home is not yet finished. They now intend to plaster the exterior of their home, to change its appearance. Dora works as an assistant accountant for a transportation company as well as caring for her four children so that they grow up to be healthy and have good habits. This family will be forever grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Madame  Binta  S. est âgée de 35 ans et  vit avec son mari et  ses 4  enfants en location avec plusieurs autres ménages au quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle abandonna l’école en classe de 9 ème pour se marier. Elle débuta la préparation du pâté auprès de sa belle sœur. Son apprentissage n’a pris que 4 jours .dès lors  elle est sollicitée par les services et ONG quand ces derniers organisent des ateliers et colloques. Elle bénéficie  d’une très grande clientèle, étant connue dans son milieu,  le soir son lieu de vente regorge de beaucoup de clients.
Pour faire du pâté, elle utilise les matières premières suivantes : 3kgs de farine de blé ; 1/2kgs de viande hachées, 30 oeufs, du beurre et 4 bols d’eau. Le mélange ainsi obtenu, en pâte est découpé sur une planche en des morceaux de farine de blé dans lesquels est encastré de la viande hachée. Le tout passera après dans la poêle avant d’être consommé.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un premier prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 50 kgs de farine de blé, 3 bidons d’huiles, 15 alvéoles d’œufs et de la viande journalièrement. Elle s’approvisionne en matière première sur place au grand marché de  Ségou. Madame  Binta  S. vend au comptant et à crédit,à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui lui permettra de supporter certaines charges familiales. Son ambition est d’avoir une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Binta S. is 35 and lives with her husband and their four children together with several other households in the Médine neighbourhood of the town of Ségou, in Mali. She left school during Grade 9 to get married. She started making meatpies with her sister-in-law. Her apprenticeship lasted only four days. Since then she has been in high demand from services and NGOs (Non-Governmental Agencies) when they hold workshops and colloquiums. She has many clients as she is well-known in her neighborhood. In the evenings, she has many customers where she sells. To make the meatpies, she uses the following: 3 kilograms of wheat flour; 1/2 kilogram of ground meat, 30 eggs, butter, and 4 bowls of water. Once everything is mixed to a paste, she places and cuts the wheat-flour paste in which the ground meat is embedded. Once they are cooked, the meatpies can be eaten. To satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she is turning to the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 30 months. She has three previous group loans and one previous individual loan, which have all been repaid. This will be her second individual loan. She will buy 50 kilograms of wheat flour, 3 drums of oil, 15 flats of eggs and meat on a daily basis. She buys her ingredients locally at the main market in Ségou. Binta Soutoura sells for cash and on credit, both to men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA with this loan, which will allow her to contribute to some of the family's expenses. Her goal is to have a house.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, oil, eggs, and meat.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam E. has one milling machine that she uses to mill grains such as millet, corm, etc., but she is not able to meet the demand of her numerous customers. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase an additional milling machine to enable her to meet the demand of her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 10 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase an additional milling machine

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 39 years old and she is married with 6 children. Beauty lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells drinks. She has lots of customers and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She needs a Kiva loan  to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Marta Alicia F. le esta haciendo falta el portón de enfrente, ya que  tiene tres hijas que desea que estén con la mayor seguridad, ya que están gran parte del día solas en la casa. 
El motivo es porque doña Marta Alicia tiene que ir a trabajar a una prestigiada maquiladora como operaria y su esposa el señor Juan Venegas trabaja en la construcción en la vecina ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta Alicia F.’s home lacks a front door. Since she has three daughters, she wants to have more security because they spend most of the day alone in the house. The reason for this is that Mrs. Marta Alicia has to go to work at a prestigious factory as an operator, and her husband, Mr. Juan Venegas, works in construction in a neighboring city.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a front door in her house

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Ousmane  Cissé  est âgé de 22 ans, célibataire il vit chez son père dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec sa mère et ses 5 frères dans le quartier Sébougou de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant  abandonné l’école en classe de huitième année fondamentale  pour faire le commerce auprès de son grand frère qui tenait une boutique de vente en détail. Après  2 ans  au service  de ce dernier pour connaître les rouages du commerce, il, mène depuis 3 ans une activité de vente dans une boutique au quartier Angoulême. Sa boutique située auprès du   boulevard CAN 2002 qui est le lieu des affaires  à Ségou et à côté de sa boutique se trouve une pharmacie, des dépôts de boisson et un salon de coiffure. Il réalise d’énormes chiffres d’affaires du fait  que sa boutique  est très fréquentée due à son accessibilité mais également de son sens élevé des affaires.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante il fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro  Yiriwaso. Il est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 7 mois. Après un 1er prêt individuel correctement bien remboursé, il est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 tonne de sucre, 3 cartons de pâte alimentaire, 10 cartons de petit pois. Il s’approvisionne en matières premières à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et sur place à Ségou. Monsieur  Ousmane  Cissé vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA et ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. Son ambition est de diversifier ses activités en vendant de l’essence et des céréales en marge de son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane Cissé is 22 years old and unmarried. He lives at his father's home, in a large traditional family together with his mother and his 5 brothers, in the Sébougou neighborhood in the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He dropped out of school in 8th grade to help his older brother who was running a retail shop. After two years of learning the ins and outs of this business, he's been running his own shop for 3 years, in the Angoulême neighborhood. His shop is located near CAN 2002 boulevard, the business center in Ségou. His shop is located next to a drugstore, a beverage store, and a hair salon. His revenues are very important since his shop is much frequented due to its accessibility, and also since he's got a high business sense. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, he turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven months ago. After a first individual loan that was repaid without problems, he's now seeking his second individual loan. He intends to use it to buy one ton of sugar, 3 boxes of pasta, and 10 boxes of green peas. He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) or directly in Ségou. Mr. Ousmane Cissé sells for cash and on credit to a clientele consisting of both men and women. He foresees realizing a monthly profit of XOF 250'000 (ca US$ 500), which will enable him to help his father with the family expenses. His ambition is to diversify his business by selling gas and cereals, in addition to his current business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and retail sugar, pasta and green peas

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Devotha S. from Mwanza. She is separated with 3 children, between the ages of 10 and 17 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Devotha S. has been running a beauty saloon since 2005. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees.

Devotha S. currently earns about US$ 250 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy more women's long hair, cosmetics, and weave-ons for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Devotha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more women's long hair, cosmetics, weave-ons for re-sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Mariam W. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, 7 and 11 years old. Mariam has been running a poultry ("kuku") business. Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst our borrowers. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

Mariam has been in this business since 2000 and her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mariam W. currently earns about US$ 250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to continue with her poultry business. Mariam thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy 200 chicks

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Desde hace quince años Norma dedica todo el día a su bodega. Cuando era una joven ella ayudaba a atender la tienda que su madre manejaba, pero una vez que contrajo matrimonio tuvo que independizarse y abrir su propia tienda para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.

Por las mañanas, además de lo habitual, Norma se encarga de vender alimentos para la canasta básica familiar, como verduras, frutas y carnes. Esto lo guarda en su casa por las tardes y nuevamente su minimarket se convierte en una bodega.

Según lo que cuenta, parte de las ganancias lo vuelve a invertir en la mercadería. Otra parte del dinero lo destina para los gastos de la casa. A lo largo del tiempo ella ha ayudado a su esposo con la construcción de su casa  con la educación de sus hijos.

En el futuro ella quisiera construir habitaciones en su casa para alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Norma has had a bodega for over fifteen years. When she was young she used to help at the shop that her mother run, but once she got married she opened her own business to help her husband cover the house expenses. In the morning, besides the usual, Norma sells basic food products, such as vegetables, fruit and meat. She keeps these items at home. She opens her minimarket at the evenings, too. Part of the earnings are reinvested in more products to sell. Another part of the Earning is used for her home expenses. Throughout the time, she has helped her husband building their home and paying for their children’s education. In the future, she would like to build extra rooms in her house and rent them.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Esther B. from Mwanza. She is separated from her husband and has two children, 12 and 16 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because that child's parents do not take care of her.

Esther B. has been running a cloth business since 2008. The client’s business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Esther B. currently earns about US$ 200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to purchase more cloth. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Esther thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una madre joven de dos niños, uno tiene once años y la segunda, siete. Hace un año y medio, con el objetivo de ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios, hablo con su esposo sobre cómo podría generar ingresos extras al hogar. Es así que se anima a vender al inicio solo golosinas. Luego de un tiempo empezó a vender también bebidas como gaseosa y agua.

Poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su negocio, pero ella afirma que aún le queda mucho por hacer. Actualmente ella dedica sus ganancias a la reinversión. Más adelante le gustaría construir fuera de su casa un ambiente para su tienda ya que por ahora vende a la intemperie.
texts.en:
Diana is a young mother of two children, an 11 year old boy and a 7 year old girl. A year and a half ago, in order to help her children with their school expenses, she talked to her husband about how to generate an extra income. This way, she decided to start selling candy. After some time, she also began selling beverages, such as sodas and water. Little by little, her business began to grow, but she states that there’s still a lot to do. She currently re-invests all her earnings. In the future, she would like to build facilities outsider her house for her store, as currently her store is in the open air.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for her small store

loans.name: Bertha Sofia

texts.es:
Siendo madre de tres hijos y con tan solo cuarentaitres años, Bertha ha logrado construir un negocio rentable para ella y su familia. Antes de conocer a EDAPROSPO, las ventas de su tienda eran menores a las de hoy en día.

Ella atiende durante las veinticuatro horas del día un minimarket y licorería. Ella agradece que su casa se tenga buena ubicación pues la calle donde habita es muy concurrida. Sus mismos clientes muchas veces le han dado ideas sobre qué cosas debe vender y que otras no. Atender las demandas de su público es algo que esta creciendo crecer su negocio.

Su esposo es obrero textil en una fábrica. Junto con él ha logrado terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos. Ella quisiera seguir implementando más su negocio y poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes más frecuentes.
texts.en:
Bertha is 43 years old and she has three children. She had managed to build a very profitable business for her and her family. Before coming to EDAPROSPO, her sales were lower than what they are today. She runs a minimarket and a liquor store 24-7. She is very lucky as her home has a great location, so her business is very well-attended. Some times, there are her very own customers who have given her ideas about what items to sell. Serving the needs of her customers is what’s making her business grow. Her husband is a textile worker in a factory. Together they managed to finish building their home and to provide their children with a good education. She would like to diversify her business in order to be able to fully satisfy her more frequent customer’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Diversify her business

loans.name: Josephin Epifania

texts.es: La señora Josephin es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian educación primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que le ayuda asumir los gastos del hogar, está solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de pulperia para aumentar su inventario y asi brindar mejor atención a sus cliente y obtener mayores ganancia con las cuales mejorará las condiciones del hogar.   Josephin es una mujerer emprendedora, responsable, honesta que ha demostrado buena conducta y moral crediticia, es una señora que ha constribuido al desarrollo de su comunidad, adicionalmente labora en el cafetin de la univercidad URACCAN donde obtiene otros ingresos que le permiten asumir sus compromisos crediticios.
texts.en:
Josephin is the mother of 3 young children, all in elementary school. She has the support of her husband who helps with household expenses. She's applying for a third AFODENIC loan, money that she will invest in her small grocery business. She will use the funds to increase her inventory so that she can better service her customers and increase her earnings, something that will allow her to make improvements to her house. Josephin is an enterprising woman, responsible and honest. She has shown herself to be of good character, someone who has contributed to the development of her community. Among other things, she works in the URACAAN university canteen where her income helps her to repay her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es:
Hilaria trabaja preparando comida a pedido. Es decir, ella prepara y reparte comida a obreros que trabajan en obras cercanas a su casa.

Hace tres años ella ayudaba a atender en la tienda de una prima suya, hasta que una amiga la motivo a tener un negocio propio. Hilaria se animó a invertir en el negocio de la comida porque se dio cuenta de que habían muchas fábricas por su casa. Ella vende almuerzos y le dedica toda la mañana a ello.

Por las tardes eventualmente ella continua ayudando a su prima con la atención de la tienda; sin embargo, cada vez que puede también prepara picarones (postre peruano) para venderlos fuera de su casa.

Gracias a su empeño por conseguir siempre recursos con los cuales mantener a su pequeña familia, ha logrado ser padre y madre para su hijo que hoy ya tiene diecinueve años.
texts.en:
Hilaria works making food on demand. She makes and delivers food to workers near by her home. Three years ago, she used to help at a store owned by one of her cousins, until a friend encouraged her to open her own Business. Hilaria, then, decided to do so and invested her savings on this food business as she figured it was a good idea to sell lunch packs to the workers at the factories near by. She devotes all morning to prepare these meals. In the evenings, she still helps her cousin taking care of the store. She also makes special Peruvian deserts called “picarones” for sale. Thanks to her performance, she has always managed to obtain the resources to support her small family. Hilaria is a single mother with a 19 year old son.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's undergraduate studies

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Candelaria es casada,  tiene 2 hijos menores de edad estudia educación primaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que aporta con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos crediticios, está solicitando a AFODENIC su 2do crédito  para invertirlo en compra de ternero desarrollo, trabaja en las actividades agricola y atiende la actividad del ganadera, su esposo trabaja en conjunto con doña Candelaria en la finca de 35 Mzs, Candelaria se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta, su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario ganadero y de esta forma mejorar los condiciones del nucleo familiar y brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, ademas refiere sentirse muy satisfecha por los logro y ventajas que ha obtenido su familia con los financiamientos que le brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Candelaria is married and has 2 young school-aged children. She has the support of her husband who helps her with household expenses and loan payments. She's applying for her second AFODENIC loan so that she can purchase calves and invest in her farming and livestock business. Her husband works with Candelaria on the farm. Candelaria is responsible and honest. Her greatest wish is to increase her herd of livestock and thereby improve the lives of her family and provide her children with a better future. She also says that she is satisfied with the benefits that her family has gained from the loans extended to her by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves for farming and livestock business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Durante más de veinte años Amalia ha dedicado gran parte de su tiempo en la atención y manejo de su bodega. Siempre ha estado buscando la forma de generar ingresos a su casa, por lo que la bodega no ha sido su primer trabajo. Anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la venta de frutas como ambulante, no obstante, pensó que mantener una bodega seria más seguro. 

Por las noches, además de atender su negocio prepara Salchipapa (plato conformado por papas y salchichas fritas) y vende fuera de su casa. Su hija menor la acompaña y ayuda siempre.

Ella tiene planeado seguir implementado su bodega para tenerla surtida y poder vender mucho más. Por ahora se siente contenta de haber ayudado a sus cinco hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
For more than twenty years Amalia has spent a great part of her time working and managing her grocery store. She has always looked for a way to generate income for her home, which is why her grocery store is not her first job. Previously, she worked at a moving fruit stand. However, she thinks that maintaining her store is a more secure job. In addition to attending business at her store, at nights she prepares Salchipapa (a dish comprised of potatoes and fried sausages), and sells Salchipapa from her house. Her youngest daughter accompanies her and always helps. She plans to continue improving her grocery store in order to have an diversity of goods and to be able to increase her sales. For now, she feels happy to have helped her five children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar mercadería a su bodega

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Todo el conocimiento que Yolanda tiene sobre bordados y aplicaciones para tejidos lo aprendió durante su permanencia en su antiguo trabajo de bordadora en una fabrica textil. Una vez que sintió que sería mas rentable trabajar por su cuenta se independizó y ahora ella misma elabora bordados para venderlos al por mayor en algún mercado.

Hoy en día ella ya lleva seis años vendiendo diferentes tipos de bordados. Gracias a su admirable esfuerzo ella logra mantener junto con su esposo que trabaja como albañil a sus tres hijos que aun están en edad escolar.

El préstamo que le brinda EDAPROSPO  lo invierte en materiales para los bordados. Más adelante ella quisiera poder montar una tienda en su casa para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
All of the knowledge that Yolanda has about embroidery and weaving she learned during her time at her old job as an embroiderer at a textile factory. Once she felt that it would be more profitable to work on her own, she became independent, and now she produces embroidery to sell wholesale in the market. Nowadays she has been working for six years selling different types of embroidery. Thanks to her admirable effort she and her husband, who works as a bricklayer, manage to maintain her three children who are still in school. The loan that EDAPROSPO, an affilate of Kiva, offers will be invested in materials for her embroidery. In the future, she wants to be able to start a shop in her house to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar material para realizar sus bordados

loans.name: Delcy Roxana

texts.es:
Con la inauguracion de un nuevo supermecrado ubicado allado de su antiguo trabajo, Delcy decidió dejar su negocio de venta de frutas en unmercado que ya tenia diez años. La competencia era muy grande y el costo del alquiler del local ya nole era rentable.

Por ello, hace cuatro años abrió una bodega en su casa. Hoy en dia este negocio ha crecido y recibe la visita de muchos clientes, a pesar de que la ubicación no es tan buena. Gracias a su trabajo durante todos estos años ella ha mantenido a su hogar y a sus dos hijos.

En un futuro Delcy quisiera abrir una tienda en provincia para poder estarallado de supareja quientrabaja en un centro minero alinterior del país.
texts.en:
With the opening of a new supermarket located near her old work, Delcy decided to leave her fruit sale business in a market that was already ten years old. The competition was large, and the cost to rent the space was not profitable. Because of this, four years ago she opened a grocery store in her house. Nowadays, her business has grown and receives traffic from many clients in spite of its poor location. Thanks to her work all these years, she has maintained her home and supported her two children. In the future, Delcy wants to open a store in a different province in order to be able to be near her spouse, who is working in a mining center in the center of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La inversion de su tienda

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonidad Del Carmen

texts.es: El Sr.  Leonidas es un hombre luchador que desde muy joven ha trabajado, en diferentes instituciones, lo cual ha podido ahorrar, su ultimo trabajo fue en la alcaldía donde laboro ocho años. Con sus ahorros logro comprar un camión, para trasladar granos básicos a los departamentos y de los ahorro del camión  a comprado dos taxis, a si como diez manzana de tierra las cual desea trabajarla con cultivos, tiene 47 años de edad, con dos hijos de 13 y 15 años, los niños están estudiando, y su esposa es ama de casa, y lo apoya en todos sus negocios, en este negocio don Leonidas tiene ocho años de experiencia, esta es la novena solicitud de préstamo que hace en Afodenic, que ha sido de gran beneficios en su negocio para sobresalir adelante, con esta solicitud desea reparar el camión ya que tiene una pieza mala y es su fuente primera en los ingresos. Sus planes a futuro es cambiar la unidad de taxis para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. a si como un mejor patrimonio a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonidas is a fighting man who has worked from a very young age in different institutions. With what he was able to save, his last job was in a mayor’s office, where he worked for 8 years. With his savings he was able to buy a car in order to transport grains to the Departments and with the savings from the car he bough two taxis, and from there ten, apples of land which he wants to work with farmers. He is 47 years old, with two children of 13 and 15 years of age. The children are studying, and his wife takes care of the house and helps him in all his business. In this business Leonidas has 8 years of experience and this is the ninth loan that he has done with AFODENIC, which has been of great benefit to his business to jumpstart it forward. With this loan, he wants to repair the car that has a bad piece and his is primary source of income. His plans for the future is to change the price of the taxis to bring better service to his clients, and so a better patrimony for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair Leonidad's car

loans.name: Glacida Herlinda

texts.es:
Desde hace cinco años Glacida Q. se dedica al a venta de ropa. No tiene una tienda, por lo que ella debe salir a ofrecer puerta por puerta. Felizmente, con el tiempo, se ha hecho concocida entre sus amigos y eventualmente recibe visitas de algunos cleintes en su propio domicilio.

Antes ella trabajaba como niñera, sin embargo, una vez que tugvo a sus dos hijos ya no tenia quienlos cuidara mientras ella se ausentaba, es asi quele nace la idea de vender ropa cerca de su casa. Gracias a su trabajo ella no solo mantiene a sus doshijos si no tambien a su papá, que vive con ellos.

Poco a poco ella cree ensu negocio, pero aun le faltamuchopor crecer, es por ello que ella requierede un préstamo, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Glacida Q. has worked selling clothes for five years. She doesn't have a store, so she has to go selling them door-to-door. Happily, over time she has become known among her friends and eventually has come to receive visits from some clients in her own home. Previously she worked as a nanny, but once she gave birth to her two children she didn't have anyone to take care of them while she was away. That's how the idea of selling clothing near her house came to her. Thanks to her work she is able to support not only her two children but also her father, who lives with them. Little by little her business is growing, but it still has a lot of growing to do. That's why she needs a loan, to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and open a store in her house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Hace siete años Flor vio la oportunidad de abrir un negocio en su casa, pues el paradero final de una línea de transporte público queda muy cerca de su vivienda. Es asi que que luego de conseguir un poco de dinero se animo a abrir una pequeña tienda que, actualemente, es una bodegamuy surtida y que goza de la visita de muchos clientes.

Parte de las ganancias ella lo vuelve a invertir en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo con él. Pues ella quiere implementar su tienda con más mercadería y estantes.
texts.en:
Seven years ago Flor saw the opportunity to open a business in her house, since the final stop of a public transport route is very close to her home. After obtaining a bit of money she opened a small store that is currently a well-stocked shop visited by many customers. She reinvests part of her earnings into her business so it will keep growing, and she wants to set up her store with shelves and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: America

texts.es:
America siempre ha sido unamuejr trabaajadora. Emopezo  a trabajar en su pueblo natal, Cerro de Pasco,ubicado enla sierra delPeru. En ese trabajo ella se dedicaba a vender verduras en unmercado.
No obstante, cuando tuvo que mudarse a Lima con su familia tu vo que dejarlo. Una vez ya establecidos en la capital, se animó a emprender otro negocio. Esta vez ya no queria trabajar como ambulante asi que, arriesgando un poco más, invirtió en una bodega.

Esta bodega hoy ya tiene cinco años y es gracias a ella y al trabajo de su esposo,quien labora como chofer de combi, que mantienen adiario su hogar. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, han logrado construir su casa y a seguir educando a sus hijos también. 

Por otro lado, además de manejar la bodega, a América le gustaría abrir un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de su casa cuando tenga la oportunidad.
texts.en:
America has always been a hard-working woman. She began working in her hometown, Cerro de Pasco, in the mountains of Peru, selling vegetables in a market. Nevertheless, when she had to move to Lima with her family, she had to give up that job. Once they were settled in the capital, she started another business. This time she didn't want to sell on the street so, taking a bit more of a risk, she invested in a small storefront. The store is five years old now, and thanks to her and to the efforts of her husband, who works as a bus driver, they are able to maintain their home day to day. Thanks to both their efforts, they have also managed to build a house and educate their children. On the other hand, in addition to running the store, America would like to open a grocery stall in the market near her house when she has the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Filogonio

texts.es:
El señor Filogonio H. O. ya tiene 3 años trabajando en un puesto de venta de alimentos, que es atendido por él, y que además le deja muy buenos ingresos por las ventas que tiene. 
Ahora el señor Filogonio está solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio surtiéndolo de mas mercancía debido a que tiene muchos clientes, para así  proporcionarles un mejor servicio, también planea poner un segundo puesto con el cual pueda obtener mayores ingresos que le servirán para hacer crecer todavía más su negocio y para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Filogonio H. O. has worked for three years in a kiosk that he runs, where he sells foods that bring in excellent income from the sales that he makes. Now Filogonio is asking for a loan to increase the size of his business by supplying it with more merchandise. This way he can better service his many customers. He also plans to install another kiosk with which he may obtain better income that will help him to continue to make his business grow and to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the size of his business and to install another kiosk.

loans.name: Good Friends Group

texts.en:
These people are Isha K., Mariama B., Aminata S. and Emma Koroma. They named their group Good Friend. Previous loans have had meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. The last loan they received through SMT was for Le 1,000,000.00 each. Now they are requesting a new loan for the same amount of Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Isha K. (right) is the leader of the group. Isha is forty years of age. She was born in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone. She is currently residing in Makeni, together with her husband who is a soldier. The two have five children – two of them are already on their own and three are still going to school. Isha sells cloth – cottons, “wax” and “laise” ("laise" are usually more expensive cloth than cotton and "wax"). Isha has been in the business for over twelve years.

With this loan, Isha will add to her initial working capital to buy additional bales of cloth. She will buy a bale of cotton and a bale of "laise". A bale of cotton costs Le 1,400,000 and a bale of "laise" costs Le 1,800,000. She will have to travel to neighboring Guinea to buy these bales of cloth. Prices in Guinea are more reasonable than in Sierra Leone. The cost to and from Guinea is Le 100,000.

The major challenges for Isa in her business are that of occasional slow sales and high customs duties at the border post. Apart from these, everything in her business is going fine. She likes doing her business as it is her only means of getting her survival.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying more bales of cloth

loans.name: Women In Unity Group

texts.en:
These people are Fudia K., Fatmata M., Sarian M. and Aminata S.. They have called their group Women In Unity. They have re-paid previous loans successfully. They each received Le 1,000,000 in their previous loan. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for the same amount of Le 1,000,000 each, to add to their businesses.

Fudia (second from right) is the leader of this group. Fudia was born in Masongbo village, on the outskirts of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is fifty years of age, married with six children – all of whom are now grown-ups. Her husband is a businessman, too. Fudia sells firewood as her main business but also sells underwear and clothes for children. She has been in this business for over 20 years now. With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Fudia will buy a truck load of firewood which costs Le 400,000 and the remaining Le 600,000 she will invest in her other business.

So far, Fudia faces no major challenge worth noting in her business. With this loan and the profit it will generate for her, Fudia’s life will be a happy one.

loans.use: Buy a truck load of firewood and goods for her other business

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
These women are Kadiatu K. and Aminata T.. They have named their group Together as One. They are both local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. Previous loans have created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to expand the size of their businesses. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Kadiatu K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is twenty-eight years of age. She was born in Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Her husband is an architect and the two of them have three children. The eldest is in class four, the second is in class two, and the last is just three years old. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for five years now.

Kadiatu sells market food, cigarettes, soft drinks, and sometimes bowls. She will use this new loan to expand on her business by buying one “batter” of cooking oil (five gallons make a batter), one batter of palm-oil, a bag of rice, two gross of cigarettes, mints, gum, bars of soap, and so on. A batter of cooking oil costs Le 75,000, a batter of palm-oil is Le 60,000, and a bag of rice costs Le 102,000. All of these items she will have to purchase in Makeni except for the bowls which she will have to travel to Freetown (Le 372 round-trip) to buy.

Kadiatu’s dream is to save a lot of money so that she can buy herself a plot of land (a plot of land usually costs something between US$ 500 to US$ 1000 depending on the location) and to see that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying palm-oil, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Enma Felicitas

texts.es:
Enma se dedica a la venta de menú dentro y fuera de su casa. Hace cinco años, cuando cambio de domicilio y después de que su hijo abriera una tienda en su casa, ella se animo a emprender un negocio ella también.

Gracias a que su domicilio está ubicado en una calle principal ella pensó en vender comida. Actualmente, no solo ofrece almuerzo dentro de su casa a modo de un pequeño restaurante sino también hace repartos a un determinado número de cliente. 

Ella cuenta con la ayuda de una sobrina y de vez en cuando de su esposo, quien junto a su hijo atienden y manejan una tienda de lubricantes para automóviles. Gracias a empeño, a su carisma y buena atención en el negocio de comida, Enma cuenta con muchos clientes, por lo que ella quisiera agrandar el espacio de su pequeño restaurante y convertirlo en cevichería.
texts.en:
Enma sell lunches inside and outside her home. Five years ago, when she changed homes and after her son opened a store in his house, Enma decided to undertake a business too.
Thanks to her home's location on a main street, Enma thought about selling food. These days, not only does Enma offer lunch inside her house (which she runs as a small restaurant), but also makes home deliveries to a certain number of customers.
Enma is assisted by her niece and occasionally by her husband, who alongside her son runs an automotive lubricants store. Thanks to her commitment, charisma, and attentiveness in the restaurant business, Enma has many customers, so she would like to enlarge the space of her small restaurant and make it a cevichería (a restaurant that sells ceviche).

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Siendo madre de seis hijos, Jovita siempre se vio en la necesidad de buscar un ingreso económico extra en la familia. Lo que ganaba su esposo nunca era suficiente para mantenerlos a todos. Es así que desde hace veinticinco años ella ha tenido que trabajar en diferentes cosas; vendiendo chupetes, cerveza, gaseosa, verduras, etc.

Actualmente, Jovita con sesentaisiete se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño puesto ambulante cerca a su casa. Ella cuenta que las ganancias las dedica en los gastos básicos de su hogar. Ya tiene a sus seis hijos mayores así que solo se ocupa por ahora de su salud y de mantener su casa.  

Por las noches continua vendiendo comida, pero ya dentro de su casa por la seguridad.
texts.en:
As a mother of six children, Jovita always had to seek extra income for her family. Her husband's income was never enough to provide for everybody. So, for the past 25 years, Jovita has had to work different jobs, such as selling baby bottles, beer, soda, vegetables, etc. Currently, Jovita is 67 years old, and sells food at a small stand near her home. She mentioned that her sales profits are spent on basic household items. As her six children are now grown, Jovita is only occupied by her health and maintaining her home. In the evenings she continues selling food, but inside her home for reasons of safety.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
A causa de la despedida de su esposo en su trabajo ella tuvo que salir en busca de un trabajo. Como no pudo ser contratada por ninguna empresa, ella decidió abrir un pequeño puesto ambulante en un mercado cerca a su casa. Ella dedica todo el día a su venta de frutas desde hace diez años. Siempre con el objetivo de mantener a toda su familia. 
Andrea, en un inicio todas las ganancias de su negocio las dedicaba a su hogar, sin embargo poco a poco ha aprendido que debe reinvertir en su negocio si quiere mantenerlo. Con mucho esfuerzo y responsabilidad ella ha logrado mucho y aún espera progresar más para poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Because her husband's dismissal from work, Andrea had to search for a job. As she could not receive an employment offer from any company, Andrea decided to open a small stand in a market near her home. For the past 10 years, she has her days selling fruit, always focused on providing for her entire family.
In the beginning, Andrea spent all her profits on her household, however, she gradually learned that she must reinvest in her business if she wants to keep it running. With much effort and responsibility, Andrea has achieved quite a bit, and still hopes to progress more in efforts to complete the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase/improve her fruit stand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kara Group

texts.en:
These women are Aminata K. and Fatmata K.. They have named their group Kara. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. Most recently; each of them in the group received a loan of Le 500,000. That loan was a great help to members of this group. It enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have requested a loan of Le 800,000.

Aminata (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-eight years of age. She was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and her husband is a working professional. They have four children – one is in college, and the three are in Junior Secondary School. Aminata sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and “gara lappers” (locally dyed cloth). She has been in the business for more than twenty years now.

With this new loan, Aminata will expand her business. She will invest part of the money in her "gara" business and part in the palm-oil business. She will buy at least three lengths of white cotton (about thirty yards of white cotton make a length). A length costs Le 110,000. She will also use some of the money to buy ink, powder, soda and other chemicals used in dyeing the cloth. She will also have to pay workers who design some intricate patterns on the white cotton. All of the material she needs for making the "gara" she can purchase within Makeni town; for the palm-oil, she will have to travel to a village called Masingbin to buy it at a reasonable cost. She will need to pay a fare of Le 10,000 to travel to Masingbin. There, a “barter” (five gallons) of palm-oil costs Le 60,000.

So far, Aminata faces no major challenge in her business worth noting. Business is going on fine for her. She loves doing her business and would like to see it grow as it is her only source of survival.

loans.use: invest part on gara lappers and part on palm-oil

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Lusmila se dedica a la venta de comida, ella no cuenta con un espacio dentro de su casa para poder abrir un pequeño restaurante por lo que debe de repartir cliente por cliente el almuerzo de cada uno.

Hace tres años que dejó su trabajo como servicio doméstico para emprender este nuevo negocio. Ella afirma que se cansó de la limpieza de casas y que ahora le va mucho mejor preparando almuerzos.     

Con el tiempo, a Lusmila le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes y atender en su casa a más clientes. Por ahora, con las ganancias de su trabajo ella logra criar junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil eventualmente, a sus siete hijos y además correr con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Lusmila sells food from a space within her house, where she runs a small restaurant in which she must distribute food to her clients one by one, according to each of their requests. It has been three years since she left her job in domestic services to start this new business. She says that she got tired of cleaning houses, and that no she is much better off preparing lunches. With time, Lusmila would like to have a store of groceries and to attend to more clients in her house. For now, with the earnings from her job, Lusmila’s goal is to raise her seven children and continue maintaining the expenses of the home, with the help of her husband who is a construction worker.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for the roof of her house/business location.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Jacinta se ha dedicado a crecer en su negocio progresivamente. Empezó vendiendo solo golosinas en una pequeña caja  y como ambulante en un mercado. Luego, además de las golosinas también vendía gaseosas y cervezas, invirtiendo siempre lo poco que ganaba en la compra de mas mercadería

A lo largo de veinticinco años Jacinta no ha hecho nada mas que progresar gracias a su admirable empeño. Ella es sin duda una mujer proactiva y emprendedora. Hoy maneja una gran tienda de abarrotes, en donde por las mañanas también vende carnes y verduras para las compras diarias de sus clientes.

Ella cuenta que nunca ha dejado de trabajar, pues ha sido madre y padre para sus tres hijos mayores. Gracias a su trabajo ella no sólo ha logrado educar a sus hijos, sino también ha construido una casa de tres pisos. 

Su sueño es ver a todos sus hijos profesionales e irse a vivir en un futuro con su esposo quien trabaja en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Jacinta has dedicated herself to helping her business grow. She started selling only candies from a small box, travelling around the market. After, beyond candies she also sold sodas and beers, always investing whatever she earned to buy more merchandise. For the greater part of 25 years, Jacinta hasn’t done anything but progress thanks to her admirable determination. She is, without a doubt, a proactive and entrepreneurial woman. Today she manages a large grocery store, in which, during the morning, she also sells meats and vegetables for the daily purchases of her clients. She says that she has never stopped working, because she has also served as both a mother and a father to her three older children. Thanks to her job she has not only achieved an education for her children, but has also built a three floor house. Her dream is to see all of her children as professionals, and to leave the country in the future to live with her husband, who works abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Empezó vendiendo chupetes y gelatinas en la puerta de su casa. Luego, con la compra de dos motos se dedicó al alquiler de los mismos a negocios de comida que repartían delivery.  Con el tiempo y con el firme objetivo de progresar, cambió esas dos motos por un automóvil, el cual también lo alquilaba para ofrecer el servicio de taxi.

Más adelante, cambió este auto por una combi, la que es usada como transporte público. Y es con el alquiler de esta combi con el que mantiene actualmente a su casa.

Por otro lado, ella también se dedica a la crianza de pollos y gallinas en una pequeña granja ubicada dentro de su casa. El ingreso de este negocio siempre le ha servido de apoyo para la educación de sus hijos y el mantenimiento de su casa.
texts.en:
She started selling lollipops and Jell-O’s from the door of her house. Later on, by buying two scooters, she was able to rent them to food service businesses that needed them for delivery distribution. With time and with the firm objective of progress, she exchanged these two scooters for an automobile, which she also rented, as a taxi service. Later on, she exchanged this car for a van, which is used as public transportation. It is with the renting of this van that she maintains her house. On the other hand, she also raises hens and chickens in a small farm located inside her house. The income from this business has always served her as support for the education of her children and the maintenance of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mantenance for her van and food for her farm.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Mariam M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of thirteen and twenty-seven. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Mariam has been running a tailoring business, She purchases vitambaa (fabric), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides) and has been making them into clothing, mainly for women, since 2007. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Mariam currently earns about US$ 200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy material for making clothes. In the future, she plans to buy more fabrics for making clothes. Mariam thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy material for making clothes

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 41-years-old Fedelina U. from Mwanza. She is married with six children, between the ages of eleven and nineteen. Fedelina has been running a small "duka" or neighborhood shop in the city where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 1990. She sells soaps, wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by her husband.

Fedelina currently earns about US$162 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy larger quantities to re-sell at higher prices. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory. Fedelina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities and re-sell at higher prices

loans.name: Mariaq

texts.es:
María es una persona muy emprendedora. Los negocios que la mantienen siempre activa Durante las mañanas ella prepara yogur natural para venderlo ya sea en su casa o por reparto a domicilio según los clientes que lo requieran. Por otro lado, en las tardes se encarga de atender desde hace veinte años su salón de belleza. 

Eventualmente, según la demanda de sus clientes, también elabora tejidos con macramé. Con ello vende productos para lámparas, bolsos, sandalias, etc. Asimismo, vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace dos años.

Para María todo empezó con sus estudios en cosmetología. Al inicio trabajaba para clientes particulares. Pero cuando se enfermo una temporada empezó a recibir clientes en su propia casa. Es así, que se anima a abrir un salón de belleza. Ahora está contenta con los diversos negocios que maneja, aun así mas adelántele gustaría poner un puesto de juguería en el mercado para poder vender el yogur que produce.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking person. Her businesses always keep her busy. During the morning she prepares natural yogurt to sell either in her home or delivering to her customer’s homes who have ordered it. And then, in the afternoons she works in a beauty salon, which she has done for 20 years. Then, according to customer demand, she also does macramé weavings. She sells weavings for lamps, purses, sandals, etc. In addition for the past two years she has sold cosmetics by catalog. Everything began with cosmetology for Maria. In the beginning she worked with private customers. But when she became ill she began to service clients in her own home. It was then she decided to open a beauty salon. Now she is content with the various businesses that she manages, and in the future she would like to open a juice stand in the market to be able to sell the yogurt that she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make natural yogurt

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Antes de que su hija le diera la idea de emprender un negocio sobre el decorado de fiestas con globos. Juana se dedicaba a la venta de anticuchos (plato peruano) en la puerta de su casa y a la limpieza de un  gimnasio cerca a su casa.

Hoy en día, ella se dedica a tres labores. La limpieza diaria de un gimnasio por las mañanas, por las tardes a la elaboración de diversos decorados para eventos y los fines de semana a la limpieza de casas.

Gracias al taller que su hija tomo hace un año, ahora ofrecen diversos decorados a amigos y clientes que necesiten ambientar sus eventos, ya sean cumpleaños, matrimonios o baby showers. También se dedican a la producción de accesorios para el cabello.
texts.en:
Before her daughter gave her the idea to start a business selling party decorations, Juana made a living selling anticuchos (a traditional Peruvian dish) from her front doorstep and cleaning a gym near her house. Now she works at three jobs. She cleans the gym during the morning, makes party decorations in the afternoon and cleans houses at the weekend. Thanks to the workshop that her daughter took a year ago, she now has a place to make the decorations that she sells to friends and customers who want to create a suitable atmosphere for events such as birthdays, weddings and baby showers. On top of everything else, she earns extra money making hair accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for party decorations business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 43 year old Leocadia M. from Mwanza. She is married with five children, between the ages of fourteen and twenty. Leocadia has been running a Furniture business since1990. Her business is selling beds, tables, and chairs. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees. Leocadia currently earns about 300usd a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 1200usd in order to buy a wood working machine. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory of furniture stock. Leocadia thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a wood working machine

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Pantoja Group

texts.en:
“Las Hermanas de Pantoja”, or the Sisters of Pantoja, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International.  This group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a third loan for further business expansion.  Oneyra is the coordinator for this group in the town of Los Alcarrizos.  

Onerya, mother of two, owns a variety store in the front room of her house.  In her variety store she sells hygiene products, undergarments, accessories, and food products.  Oneyra desires to see growth in her business so that she will be able to fix up her home and continue to provide for the needs of her family.  

Other members of Onerya’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including fried food sales to local vendors and a recycled plastics operation.   

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Expansion of variety store

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha vende productos de una marca de cosméticos. Hace tres años una amiga la animo a dedicar se a este negocio, poco tiempo después ella se dio cuenta de que era mas rentable que su actual trabajo ene se entonces y dedicó inscribirse para la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Anteriormente ella vendía comida, se dedicaba a hacer repartos según los pedidos que recibía; sin embargo, muchos de sus clientes no eran puntuales con el pago y tenían muchas deudas. Este motivo la convenció de cambiarse de negocio.

Por las tardes, ella dedica su tiempo en la atención del restaurante de una amiga suya. Por ahora las ganancias las ahorra para poder en un futuro terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha sells products for a well-known cosmetics brand. Three years ago, a friend encouraged her to try her hand at the business and she soon realized that it was more profitable than the work she was doing at the time. It was then that she committed herself to buying beauty products from catalogs and reselling them to her customers. Before that, she sold and delivered prepared meals. Many of her customers failed to pay her promptly, though, and had large debts. That's why she decided to switch to selling beauty products. During afternoons, Bertha works in a friend's restaurant. Now she is saving her earnings so that she can one day finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ruth se dedica la venta de cosméticos de diversas marcas y también de productos naturales. No hace mucho ha abierto una oficina fuera de su casa para brindar capacitación sobre emprender negocios y charlas de salud, esto con el objetivo de inscribir más clientes en su negocio de venta de productos naturales, ya que esta se sostiene en una red comercial.

Actualmente, ya lleva diez años vendiendo productos naturales junto con su esposo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a manejar un centro educativo en su casa.

Gracias a su constante empeño y esfuerzo no solo ha crecido en su negocio sino también ha podido terminar de construir su casa. Le gustaría en un futuro brindar talleres de diseño en su casa y poder enseñar todo lo que ella aprendió en sus estudios de diseño de modas.
texts.en:
Ruth sells natural products and cosmetics of different makes. She recently opened an office outside her house in order to offer training to others starting their own businesses and advice about health matters. Her objective is to attract more customers for her natural products business because that's the best way to maintain a commercial network. She's been selling natural products, together with her husband, for ten years. Before that, she made a living operating an education center in her house. Thanks to her dedication and effort, her business has not only grown but she's been able to finish building her house. In the future, she would like to offer design classes so that she can teach everything that she's learned about fashion design.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Las casas de hoy en día que realizan las inmobiliarias para ofrecerlas a los trabajadores que cuentan con prestaciones del gobierno a través de sus empleos, son demasiado pequeñas y los ocupantes no satisfacen sus necesidades, este es el caso del Sr. M., a pesar de que tiene solo dos hijos, su vivienda fue realizada con una sola habitación; el objetivo es ampliar la casa, para que sus hijos tengan una recamara propia.
Él trabaja para una empresa que se dedica a reparar los automóviles y su salario no es suficiente para contemplar la mejora. 
Ansía lo antes posible realizar el proyecto; por supuesto, con la ayuda de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The houses that are being offered for sale to workers these days, subsidized by government loans, are too small. They don't meet the needs of their owners. Sr. Martinez is one example. Despite having two children, his house was built with only one bedroom. He wants to expand the house so that his children have their own room. He works for an auto-repair business and his income won't cover the costs of the addition. He hopes to finish the project as soon as possible with, of course, your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build addition to house.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Vendiendo salchipapas y parrillas por las noches Rosario ha sabido generar recursos para ayudar en el mantenimiento de su casa y educación de sus dos hijos. Desde hace dos años se animó a vender productos de belleza por catalogo, pues tenía mucho clientes a quien ofrecérselos.

Además de vende frituras por las noches, hace poco también ha implementado una vitrina con algunas golosinas para venderlas mientras trabaja en la puerta de su casa. Rosario siempre está en busca de negocios que la ayuden a progresar. Por ahora se siente orgullosa de haber construido junto con su esposo su casa.

Más adelante le gustaría abrir una bodega en su casa, donde pueda vender también el café que su esposo provee a tiendas.
texts.en:
Selling salchipapas and other grilled foods every evening has taught Rosario a thing or two about earning money for househould expenses and schooling for her two children. Two years ago, she hit on the idea of selling beauty products since she had a lot of customers to whom she could offer them. As well as the prepared food that she sells evenings, she sells snacks from a display case that she recently set up at the door of her house. Rosario is always on the lookout for work that will help her get ahead. For now, she's proud of having built, with her husband, the house where they live. In the future, she would like to open a shop where she can sell the coffee that her husband distributes to stores in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for snack business.

loans.name: Raida

texts.es: Raida tiene 33 años, tiene 14 años viviendo con su pareja, es madre de dos hijos y propietaria de una casa y un auto.
