Desde el momento en que comenzó a vivir con su esposo, se inició en la compra y venta de frutas mientras que su esposo se dedica a su chacra y en otras oportunidades como chofer y cuando él tenía tiempo preparan juntos la fruta para enviar a Lima. A consecuencia de este esfuerzo pudieron comprar una camioneta;  ahora ha dejado el negocio de las frutas y se dedica a administrar su camioneta, que trabaja transportando carga desde las chacras más lejanas a la ciudad, y su esposo    trabaja ahora fuera de casa como chofer de un bus interprovincial. Raida busca dar un precio módico a sus clientes, nos dice que en estos tiempos ha bajado la demanda del transporte, y solo realiza dos viajes al día, pero hay meses donde está muy bien y llega a sacar hasta 4 cargas diarias. Raida está contenta porque pudo adquirir su carro y construir su casa en su pueblo, pero aun tiene anhelos de tener su casa en la ciudad, para que su esposo les pueda visitar con mayor frecuencia, porque donde viven ahora no hay mucha accesibilidad. Anteriormente trabajó en su banco comunal con el cargo de secretaria, y lo hizo con gran responsabilidad, y no descuido sus cuotas fijadas, como tampoco lo hará con este crédito. El dinero que ha solicitado se invertirá en la compra de repuestos para su vehículo, para que de ese modo siga trabajando y genere ingresos económicos para su hogar y para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Raida is 33 years old, has lived with her husband for 14 years, and is a mother of two children and owner of a home and car. From the moment that she began to live with her husband, she began buying and selling fruit while her husband tended to the farm and other work as a taxi driver, and shen he had time they would together prepare fruit to send to Lima. Because of the effort they were able to buy a small truck. They no longer have the fruit business, instead they continue with the truck, working to transport cargo from the most distant farms to the city, and her husband works away from the home as a interstate bus driver. Raida tries to charge a modest price to her customers, she tells us in these times the demand for transportation has diminished, and she only makes two trips a day but there are months where things are going well and she makes up to 4 trips a day. Raida is happy because she was able to rent her car and build a home in her town, but she still has dreams of having her home in the city so that her husband can visit them with greater frequency, because where they live now there isn’t much accessibility. Previously she worked in the communal bank as its secretary and she did so with great responsibility, did she not neglect her payments and will not neglect them with this loan. The money she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of parts for her vehicle, so that she may continue working and generate the income for her home and for the well-being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es: Apolinario tiene 30 años de edad, con una convivencia de 9 años con su pareja, de los cuales tienen 3 hijos y una casa propia en su pueblo, cerca de su chacra. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al labrado de la tierra, con sumo cuidado cultivó sus plantas prestándole los cuidados necesarios para que fructifiquen sus cítricos, ahora se ha propuesto sembrar café en dos cuadras y media. Cuando no hay trabajo que realizar en sus tierras, trabaja en chacras ajenas, por las que le pagan diario 15 soles, dinero que le sirve para la subsistencia de su hogar. Apolinario es un hombre muy activo, no le gusta estar sin trabajo, tiene muchas ganas de progresar y ahora está muy contento porque ya le toca cosechar plátanos de isla, tiene que preparar de 80 a 100 arrobas, que es igual a 12 kilos en el mercado. Pero para que pueda cosechar buenos frutos de este producto requiere mucha inversión de dinero y tiempo, por ello tiene que fumigar cada 20 días a los plantones de plátano, y otro tanto, tiene que ir abonando para que la tierra empobrecida pueda brotar con buenos frutos y bien sazonados como lo cotiza el mercado. Apolinario es uno de los socios que no falla a las reuniones programadas por el analista de crédito, todo este tiempo ha pagado en la fecha indicada su crédito, y esta es la segunda vez que MFP le viene facilitando un préstamo, por lo cual está muy agradecido. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de abonos para su chacra de plátanos, asimismo, adquirirá insecticidas, y considera que quizás le falte algo de dinero para comprar todo lo necesario para su chacra.
texts.en:
Apolinario, 30, lives with his partner of 9 years and their 3 children in a house near his farm. He's worked on farms since he was a young boy, carefully tending his fields so that they would provide a bounty of the citrus fruits that he cultivates. He now wants to grow coffee on two and a half "cuadras". When there's not enough work to keep him busy on his own farm, he does farm work for others at 15 soles--about US$5--a day, money that is needed to pay the family's basic expenses. Apolinario is an active man and he doesn't like to be without work. He very much wants to get ahead and he's happy because he'll next harvest 80 to 100 "arrobas"--a local unit of measure--or roughly 12 kilograms of platanos for sale in the market. Growing platanos, though, requires a large investment of both time and money. The plants have to be sprayed every 20 days and the fields have to be fertilized so that the poor soil might produce the kind of fruit required by the market. Apolinario is among those who never fails to miss a meeting with his credit analyst. This is his second MFP loan and he always paid on the dates required by his past loan. He's very grateful for the loans. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his platanos fields. He will also buy insecticides and other things that he needs for the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide for farming business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia lleva conviviendo con su pareja hace 10 años, es madre de tres hijos, y actualmente está viviendo es su casa propia, donde abrió su bodega. Años atrás tenia un restaurante, donde ella misma guisaba y servía la comidas y bebida a sus clientes, este negocio le era muy rentable, pero a la vez muy trabajoso, por ello se vio obligada ha dejarlo porque había dado a luz gemelos, entonces era imposible seguir con este negocio. Entonces cambió el giro a su actividad económica, abrió una bodega donde ahora tiene más tiempo de atender y dedicarse a sus gemelitos. Sonia atiende su bodega desde 6.00am hasta 8.00pm, pero cuando tiene que ir al mercado necesita apoyo de su esposo o algún otro familiar, para cargar la mercadería y transitar con sus dos hijos sin dificultad, de lo contrario deja encargados a sus hijos a su madre, de ese modo hacer sus compras y vuelve a su tienda antes de la 10.00am. Sonia trata de regresar antes de que sus clientes empiecen a cocinar porque es cuando recurren a su tienda, y en horas de la tarde se ocupa de lavar la ropa de sus pequeños. En su negocio le va bien, sobre todo le es rentable, dice que el éxito de una bodega es la buena atención, tenerla bien surtida y con precios cómodos. Sonia es una clienta muy activa, participa en toda las reuniones programadas por la asesora de crédito, asimismo ha pagado todas sus cuotas en las fechas programadas, y en este crédito tiene la misma predisposición de pago. El dinero solicitado es para incrementar y surtir la mercadería de su bodega, sobre todo en los productos de primera necesidad, cree que estos 2000 soles le servirán para acumular capital, y brindar a sus clientes productos de varios precios.
texts.en:
Sonia, the mother of three children, has been partnered for 10 years. She now owns her own house where she operates her grocery business. She had a restaurant years ago where she single-handedly cooked and served food and drinks to her customers. The business was profitable but the work was very hard and she saw that she would have to give it up when she had twins. She then switched gears, opening a shop selling groceries where she would have more time to take care of the young twins. She tends the grocery from 6:00 in the morning to 8:00 at night. When she has to go to the market, she needs her husband's help or help from a relative because carrying products home with two kids in tow is hard. She can also leave the twins with her mother so that she can do her shopping and return to mind the store before 10:00 in the morning. Sonia tries to return before her customers begin cooking because that's when they're most likely to come to her store. She stays busy afternoons washing clothes for her children. The business is going well; most importantly, it's profitable. She says that the business is successful because it's well-tended, well-stocked and the prices she charges are reasonable. Sonia is an active client. She attends all the meetings scheduled by the credit advisor. She's paid all of her installments and is considered likely to do the same with this loan. The loan will be used to stock the store and especially to stock the store with basic products. She thinks that the 2000 soles will be enough to provide her customers with the products that they want.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad, hace 12 años viene conviviendo con el padre de sus tres hijos, en la casa que han construido con la finalidad de hacer negocio. Hace seis años viene trabajando en su restaurante, donde ella es la cocinera, asimismo en horas de la tarde se dedica a preparar y seleccionar frutas para encajonarlas y una vez listas envía su carga a un mercado de la capital, donde le cotizan a un buen precio sus producto. Para ello realiza una inversión de 300 a 400 soles, sus ganancias siempre son más del 50%, ya sean de 200 o 300 soles por cada viaje. En estas temporadas María y su esposo trabajan con su carro haciendo transporte de las chacras a la ciudad, cobran por cada viaje entre 60 u 80 soles, y aprovechan en sacar su carga; de ese modo vienen trabajando cerca de 4 años, tiempo lo suficiente para conocer los lugares más lejanos donde cotizan un precio mayor, inclusive llegando a ganar el 100% de su inversión. Mientras tanto su restaurante lo deja a cargo de su hija para que no pierdan clientela y cuando es tiempo de espera de la cosecha, vuelve a dedicarse de lleno a la cocina y atención de sus comensales. María es una clienta responsable, aunque no dispone de mucho tiempo para estar presente en las reuniones programadas, está al día en todos sus pagos. El dinero solicitado, en su totalidad lo va derivará a la compra de plantas de cítricos; como naranjas, tanyelos, y demás frutas que encuentren a un buen precio, y que le permitan ganar, mientras el mercado le favorece.
texts.en:
Maria, 41, has lived with her partner, the father of her three children, for 12 years. They live in the house they built with the idea that they would eventually operate a business there. Six years ago, Maria began operating a restaurant where she is the cook. During afternoons, she works selecting and preparing fruit that she boxes up and gets ready to send to the capital where it will fetch a good price. She spends between 300 and 400 soles for each delivery and she always earns a profit of at least 50% or around 200 or 300 soles per trip. This time of year, Maria and her partner work carting fruit from farms to the city, collecting between 60 and 80 soles for each trip and getting the most they can for their labor. They've been working this way for 4 years, enough time to learn where they can get the best prices, even earning a profit equal to 100% of their investment. They leave the restaurant in the hands of their daughter so that they don't lose customers and return to their kitchen and their food as soon as the harvest is over. Maria is a resposible client even though she doesn't have a lot of time to attend scheduled meetings. She is current with her loan payments. This loan will be used to buy citrus plants, oranges, tangelos and other fruits that will fetch a good price and a good return in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of fruits for fruit business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder
Graciela tiene 34 años es conviviente, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 3 años, ellos  estudian en colegio particular San Juan Bautista. 

Desde que termino el colegio  Graciela empezó a vender Productos de belleza por catálogos de diferentes empresas por muchos años, después empezó con la venta de salchi-papas por mas de un año, le iba bien  pero tuvo que dejarlo por que salió embarazada y era mucho trajín para ella, paso el tiempo su hija creció y empezó a trabajar de nuevo, esta vez en la venta de ropa por pedidos, paso la voz a sus amigas y familiares, así se fue haciendo de pedidos, sus amigas la recomendaban a otras personas, fue ganando mas clientas; ella compra la ropa en Gamarra La Victoria; En tiempo de colegio vende útiles escolares y zapatos ella deja el  pedido y cada quincena pasa cobrando.

Desde que comenzó en Finca tiene mucha ayuda, le dan charlas de cómo mejorar su negocio, saber a quien vender sus productos, y como formar su empresa, ha recibido un premio de $ 20 por buena pagadora y por ser puntual a las reuniones del Bancomunal, también ha logrado comprar  un Custer que su esposo lo maneja; lo compraron a plazos  les falta cinco letras para terminar de pagarlo. 
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para la  comprar mercadería de ropa que le han pedido sus clientas y poder repartir  a tiempo.

Uno de los sueños de  Graciela es tener su propio negocio en su casa, quiere poner una librería – Bazar, pero le falta techar su casa, ella sabe que poco  apoco lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Graciela, 34, is a member of the Fuerza y Poder ("Strength & Power") community bank. She is 34 years old, partnered and the mother of two children, 15 and 3 years old, respectively. The children are students at the private San Juan Bautista school.

After finishing high school, Graciela sold beauty products for many years. She then sold salchipapas (a traditional Peruvian dish) for more than a year, a business that was going very well but that she had to leave when she became pregnant and her days became too hectic. When her daughter became older, she went back to work, this time selling clothes to friends and family. Her friends recommended her to others and her business has consequently grown. She buys clothes in the Gamarra La Victoria. During the school year, she sells school uniforms and shoes.

Since starting with Finca, she's had a lot of help. They give her advice about improving her business, information about who sells her products and how to form a business. She received a premium of $20 for a good payment record and for being on time to the meetings of the community bank. She also managed to buy a Custer (moto-taxi) that her husband operates. They only have five more payments to make to pay it off.

Graciela needs an 800-soles loan to buy clothes already ordered by her customers but not yet paid for. One of her dreams is to have her own home-based business. She wants to set up a bookstore but she needs a roof on her house. She knows that little by little, she'll succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía es socio del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.

Sofía es de Huancayo, conviviente, tiene 33 años y tres hijos  de 9, 4, y 3 años  sus hijos están en la escuela, Sofía vende hace tres años ropa, empezó ofreciendo algunas prendas poco a poco, el tiempo ha pasado y ella tiene mas caseritas y  la mercadería la compra en gamarra al por mayor, le sale mas a cuenta  ella deja la ropa a su clientes  y cada quince días pasa a cobrar esto le da tiempo para seguir  trabajando en la limpieza de casas por horas, y no descuidar a sus hijos  que están pequeños.

Desde que esta en Finca ella ha aprendido ha manejar mejor su dinero, ha saber llevar su negocio y ser puntuales en sus pagos  en el Bancomunal. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para invertirlos en la compra de ropa  para poder entregar los pedidos a sus clientas. 

El sueño de Sofía es ahorrar lo suficiente para buscar un puesto en el mercado pesquero  para vender ropa.
texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the Fuerza y Poder ("Strength & Power") community bank. She's 33-years old, a native of Huancayo and partnered with three children who are 9, 4 and 3 years old, respectively. Sofia has sold clothes for three years, starting with a few things and slowly growing the business. She buys wholesale supplies of clothes in Gamarra. She sells on credit and collects payments from her customers every 15 days. She cleans houses part time which still leaves her time to care for her children who are still quite small.

Since starting with Finca, Sofia has learned to better manage her money, operate a business and repay her loans to the community bank on time. She needs a 1000-soles loan that she will use to buy clothes so that she can deliver her customers' orders.

Sofia's dream is to save enough money to get a stall in the Pesquero market where she can sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y poder. 
Carolina es de Apurimac, conviviente tiene 30 años,  cinco hijos de 14, 12, 10, 7,  estudian en el colegio de San Juan y el de 3 años va al nido.

Empezó en el negocio de comida vendiendo papa rellena por ocho años seguidos  en la Ciudad, con la ayuda de su esposo llegaron a tener tres carretas, cada día se levantaba muy temprano para preparar las papa rellena, no dándole  tiempo para atender a sus hijos,  pero el vender papa rellena cada vez se le fue haciendo mas pesado y muy trabajoso, ella seguía teniendo mas hijos por que no se cuidaba, se le hacia mas difícil trabajar y atender a sus hijos, su esposo consiguió trabajo en una construcción, ella  decidió cambiar  a la venta de salchi-papas, actualmente  sale a vender  de lunes a viernes  de 5pm hasta las 9:30 pm,  los sábado trabaja limpiando casas, y por las tardes atiende a sus hijos.

Con Finca su negocio cambio he aprendido ahorrar, ha comprar al por mayor para ganar mas, no le gusta que le descuenten cuando otros no pagan pero ella sabe que esas son las reglas del Bancomunal.
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles  para la compra de aceite,  comprar saco de papas e ingredientes  para la preparación de salchi-papas.
Carolina sueña con terminar de construir su casa y poner una tienda de abarrotes, ella se ha puesto una meta que dentro de dos años va ha lograrlo, tiene que trabajar duro pero lo hará con la ayuda de su familia.
texts.en:
Carolina is a member of the "Force and Power" Village Bank. Carolina is from Apurimac, cohabitant, 30 years old and has five children with ages of 14, 12, 10, and 7 that study at San Juan School and a 3 year old that attends nursery school. Carolina started her business selling "papa rellana" (stuffed potatoes) eight years ago in the city and with the help of her spouse now has three street carts. Each day she rises very early to prepare the stuffed potatoes, which leaves her little time to attend to her children as the preparation is more work over time. Since she kept having more children and it become difficult to care for them and work, her husband found a job in construction and she decided to change and sell "salchi-papas" (a fried sausage and potatoe snack) which she sells from Monday to Friday from 5pm until 9:30pm and Saturdays she works cleaning houses, while attending to her children in the afternoon. With FINCA Carolina's business has changed and she has learned to save. She buys ingredients wholesale so that she can earn more. She does not like to pay if other members lack resources, but she knows the rules of the village bank. She needs an 800 soles loan to buy oil and potatoes as ingredients for the preparation of the salchi-papas. Carolina dreams of finishing the construction of her home and putting in a small grocery store. She has made a goal to achieve this in two years and with the help of her family and hard work, hopes to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil and potatoes as indgredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Victoria es D. Apurimac estudio la secundaria completa, es casada tiene 52 años  cuatro hijos D. 25, 22, 20 y 7 años sus hijos son profesionales, solo él ultima esta en el colegio. 

Ella tiene su casa propia siempre le gustaron los niños y D. joven trabajo D. niñera en casas con todo ese conocimiento aprovecha para poner un huawawasi, en la zona donD. vive, por que  hay muchos niños y la gente sale a trabajar y no tienen con quien dejarlos, ella vio la oportunidad y acondiciono su casa, recibiendo  a los niños  durante diez años,  con  la ayuda D. su suegra,  lo tuvieron que cerrar por que había muchos niños  y ya no se daban abasto.
 Después D. eso ella empezó a vender fruta en la puerta D. su casa, aprovecho la oportunidad que por su casa pusieron un paradero  final D. combis y hay mucha concurrencia, así estuvo por seis años, ahora ella quiere abrir una bodega en su casa. 
Necesita el préstamo D. 1400 soles para abrir una  tienda que funcionara en su casa, necesita compra arroz, azúcar, aceite, pintar la tienda  para poderla abrir.

DesD. que esta en Finca ha recibido ayuda  y ha podido salir adelante con las charlas, aprendió como vender y como mejorar su negocio frente a la competencia, le gusta las reuniones D. su banquito por que ve compañerismo y amistad. 
Desea tener una bodega granD. y bien surtida y que su ultima hija llega a ser una profesional como sus demás hermanos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder, a Finca-sponsored business support group. She is from Apurimac and finished high school. Victoria is married, 52 year old, and has four children age 7, 20, 22 and 25. All her children are working professionals, with the exception of the youngest who is still in school. She has her own home, and has always liked children. When she was young she worked as a nanny, and what she learnt proved useful in opening a wawa wasi, a government-sponsored daycare center, in the neighborhood where she lives. There are many children, and the parents go off to work and have no one with whom to leave them. Victoria recognized the opportunity and remodeled her home. With the help of her mother-in-law they took in children for ten years; however, they had to close because there were too many children and they were unable to cope. For the past six years, Victoria has sold fruit from her doorstep, taking advantage of the fact that the house is situated near the last stop on the minibus route, generating a lot of foot traffic. Now she wants to open a small grocery store in her home. Victoria needs a loan of $450 (approximately 1400 Peruvian soles) to open a shop that would operate out of her home. She needs to buy rice, sugar, and oil, as well as to paint the store prior to the opening. She has received help from Finca and has been able to move ahead with the talks, has learnt how to sell and how to position her business to fair well with the competition. She likes her small business support group meetings due to the companionship and friendship. She wants to have a large, well-stocked store and to assist her youngest daughter in becoming a professional like her other siblings.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, and paint to open a shop in her home

loans.name: Ulices

texts.es:
Ulices es socio del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder. 
Ulices es conviviente  tiene 42 años, tres hijos de 22, 15 y 9 su hijo mayor estudian en la universidad y  los menores en el colegio. Ulices comenzó vendiendo  pollo, por varios años, pero vio mucha competencia y decidió retirarse de ese negocio con el capital que había juntado se compro una couster se asocio con varios amigos y fundaron una empresa de trasporte “Unidad de Villa”  pusieron varias rutas, pero él trabaja en la ruta W, actualmente es chofer de su propia custer, le gusta su trabajo y piensa seguir hasta que las fuerzas le den. 
Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para comprar los repuestos de su trasporte y hacerle mantenimiento a su custer. 
En Finca se siente respaldado, ante cualquier imprevisto con los ahorros que se hace en el Bancomunal y con los prestamos que dan, le gustan las reuniones a pesar que la mayoría son mujeres, aprende de las charlas que dan sobre como llevar una empresa y darle mejor atención al cliente.
El sueño de Ulices es comprar carros más moderno para la empresa, que sean a gas por que es más económico.
texts.en:
Ulices is a member of the Community Bank "Strength and Power". Ulices lives with his partner and is 42 years old. He has three children aged 22, 15 and 9: his eldest son is studying at University and the younger two are at school. Ulices began by selling chicken, for several years, but he saw that there was a lot of competition and so decided to retire from this business and with the capital he had managed to save he bought a minibus, joined with several friends and founded a transport company "Town Unity" running various routes, but he works on route W. He is now driver of his own minibus, he likes his work and wants to carry on as long as he has strength to do so. With Finca he feels protected from any unforeseen circumstance because of the savings which he puts in the Community Bank and with the loans which they give. He likes the meetings despite the fact that the majority of attendees are women, and he has learnt from the talks that they give how to improve a business and how to give better service to his customers. Ulices' dream is to buy more modern vehicles for the business, that run on cheaper gas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He needs a loan of 800 soles in order to carry out repairs and maintence on his minibus

loans.name: Jhudy

texts.es: Jhudy, de 25 años está conviviendo cerca de 10 años con su pareja,  es madre de dos hijos que son la adoración de ella y de su esposo, viven en su propia casa que hace poco lograron construir. Cuando empezó a convivir con su pareja decidieron en cultivar las tierras de sus padres, y empezaron sembrando plantones de frutos cítricos y plátanos, todo este tiempo abonaron y fumigaron sus plantas para cosechar buenos frutos, y así pasaron los cuatro primeros años necesarios para que las plantas den buenos frutos, aquella vez fue su primera cosecha, y les fue muy bien, tanto que le alcanzó para comprar su terreno y con las ganancias de las siguientes cosechas construyeron su casa. Desde entonces pusieron un negocio de venta de abarrotes en su casa, donde ahora ella se dedica a la atención desde las 6.00am hasta 10.00pm, y cuando tiene que realizar las compras se va a la ciudad a 5.00am para alcanzar comprar su larga lista de los requerimientos para su bodega, y luego tiene que regresar de prisa para atender a sus clientes. Con esta actividad Jhudy está muy contenta y sobre todo porque le agrada conversar y dar un buen trato a sus clientes, ya que son ellos quienes producen sus ganancias. Mientras tanto su esposo sigue dedicándose a la agricultura, en tiempo de cosecha, en horas de la tarde ella también le apoya en preparar la carga, de ese modo trabajan en armonía con anhelos de progresar, mientras haya juventud, dice Jhudy. Durante su primer préstamo ocupó el cargo de secretaria en su banco comunal, ahora, en este, su segundo crédito se compromete nuevamente a pagar con la misma responsabilidad con que lo hacía anteriormente. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega con bebidas, para que de este modo tenga acumulado su capital en estos productos que son los más demandados.
texts.en:
Jhudy, aged 25, has been living with her partner for around 10 years. She is the mother of two children who are the apple of her and her husband's eye. They live in their own home which they recently managed to finish building. When she began to live with her partner, they decided to cultivate their parents' lands, and they began to sow citrus fruit plants and bananas. They fertilised and fumigated the plants all the time in order to harvest good fruits and the four years necessary for the plants to mature and bear fruit passed in this way. Their harvest went very well, so much so that they managed to buy a plot of land and with the profits from following harvests they built their house. Since then they have set-up a grocery-store business in their house, where she now works from 6am to 10pm, and when she has to buy stock she heads to the town at 5am in order to buy the long list of merchandise she needs for her store, and then she has to hurry back in order to wait on her customers. Judy is very content with this activity, above all because she likes to talk and provide her customers with good service, as its they who provide her profits. While her husband still works in agriculture,during the harvesy she also helps to prepare the loads during the afternoon, and in this way they work in harmony with a desire to keep progressing while they are still young, says Jhudy. During the time of her first loan she acted as secretary of the Community Bank and now, with this second loan she promises again to repay it with the same responsibility as last time. The money she is asking for will be to increase the stock in her store with drinks, because in this way she will have put her capital into the products most in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her grocery-store's stock

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia cuenta con 42 años de edad, hace 20 años vive con su esposo, aun no han formalizado su situación conyugal, pero de esta relación tiene 3 hijos, los 2 mayores viven fuera, por estudios actualmente están viviendo en un terreno que les dio su suegra mientras que adquiera el suyo propio. Hace 4 años atrás ella y su esposo decidieron ingresar al negocio de la compra y venta de frutas, y en todo este tiempo han notado que le es muy rentable; mientras que su esposo sigue con el labrado de sus cítricos, (antes solo se dedicaban a cultivar la fruta) ella selecciona las frutas y preparar la carga de su producto, que lleva tres veces por semana a un mercado de Lima. Lilia quiere aprovechar al máximo su negocio, con la mira de comprar y construir su propia casa en una ciudad más grande. En los días que sale a vender sus productos gana entre 150 a 200 soles, de ello paga el flete, el alquiler de su puesto y la alimentación del hogar. Mientras tanto su esposo prepara las naranjas de su chacra que habían sembrado hace 5 años atrás; y que hoy cosechan los frutos de esta planta que les sirven para la educación superior de sus hijos. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, donde las devoluciones las ha realizado sin problemas de mora. La cantidad que solicita la invertirá en la compra de frutas en grandes cantidades para que luego las pueda vender encajonadas, así gana más de lo habitual.
texts.en:
Lilia is 42 years old, and has lived with her husband for 20 years, although they still haven't formalised their relationship. But they have three children, the eldest two live elsewhere in order to study - they're currently living on land that her mother-in-law gave them while they acquired their own. Four years ago Lilia and her husband decided to set-up a business buying and selling fruits and in all this time they have realised that it is very profitable. While her husband continues to work with the citrus fruits (previously they only worked growing fruit), she selects the fruits and prepares the packing of the product, that she takes three times a week to a market in Lima. Lilia wants to make the most of her business, with the aim of buying and building their own house in a bigger town. On the days when she goes to sell their products she earns between 150 and 200 soles, from which she pays the rent, the hire of her stall and buys food for her home. During all this her husband prepares oranges from their land which had been planted 5 years ago and today they harvest the fruits of these plants in order to pay for the further education of her children. This is her 5th loan con MFP, of which she has been able to make repayments without any delay. The money which she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of fruits in big quantities so that later they can sell them boxed-up, as this way they'll earn more than normal.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit wholesale for her business

loans.name: Francisca Eufemia

texts.es:
En el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, la señora Francisca S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de carne ofreciéndola en su establecimiento el cual es muy visitado frecuentemente por los clientes que a diario compran la carne. El negocio fue iniciado desde 18 años y por medio de este ella ha mantenido a su familia y le ha brindado el apoyo para mejorar.

Es importante destacar que por ser ella de escasos recursos hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de la carne y de este modo comercializarla en el mercado. Con el crédito logrará surtir su negocio de este producto y saldrá adelante en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
In the municipal market of Chichigalpa, Francisca S. is dedicated to selling meat, offering it from her establishment which is visted frequently buy customers who buy meat on a daily basis. The business was started 18 years ago and, with it, she has supported her family and provided support for their betterment. It is important to stress that, being of scarce resources, she has today turned to Ceprodel with the purpose of requesting a loan in order to purchase meat and resell it in the market.With this loan, she will successfully stock her business with this product and move her financial development ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Trabaja diariamente  en su casa, dedicada a la crianza de sus gallinas y cuyes, por las mañanas sale para recoger pasto de sus propias tierras de cultivo, luego ponerlas en un almacén para que se sequen y de esa manera evitar molestias estomacales a sus animales. Cada semana los vende en las feria más cercanas a su localidad o en todo caso, conocen de su granja y van a comprarle ahí directamente, de esta manera  Claudia garantiza los ingresos para su familia, con este negocio ha podido juntar un capital considerable para comprar artículos diversos de arreglo personal que recientemente está vendiendo, por lo que está muy animada y alentada para seguir adelante. Su meta es tener más animales en su granja y mejorar la infraestructura de sus corrales, así como establecerse en su nuevo negocio adquiriendo más clientes. Es la tercera vez que tiene una experiencia en el trabajo con bancos comunales y su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que seguirá esforzando decididamente a lograr un buen trabajo en equipo. El dinero que solicita es para la mercadería de su nuevo negocio donde usará 200 soles y con 2800 comprará una vaca de buena raza, ya que también quiere obtener mayores ingresos con la vente de leche.
texts.en:
Claudia is 52 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She works daily in her house and is dedicated to raising chickens and guinea pigs. In the mornings, she leaves to gather grass from her own fields which she then puts it in a store so that it can dry out and, in this manner, avoid stomach problems for her animals. Each week, she sells them in the markets closest to her area or, in other cases, people know her farm and come to buy from her directly. In this way, Claudia guarantees income for her family. WIth this business, she has been able to gather a considerable amount of capital in order to buy miscellaneous grooming items that she recently has been selling and is excited and encouraged to move forward with. Her goal is to have more animals on her farm and to improve the construction of her pens, as well as establish herself in her new business by acquiring more customers. This is the third time that she has had a working experience with community banks and her third loan with MFP. She will continue to work hard to achieve good teamwork. The money that she is requesting is for the merchandise of her new business for which she will use 200 soles. With 2800, she will buy a well-bred cow since she also wants to obtain income through the sale of milk.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow and invest in a new business.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Karla D. actualmente se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras en su propio establecimiento ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Ella se dedica muy arduamente a esta actividad desde hace 12 años y ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio logrando su objetivo como es obtener la satisfacción del cliente.  

Su meta es convertirse en una excelente comerciante y es por esta razón que hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada por medio de un crédito que le de lugar a la compra de las verduras para continuar comercializándolas muy atentamente en su localidad en el mercado de Chichigalpa.
texts.en:
Currently, Karla D. is dedicated to her business selling vegetables in her own shop located in the municipal market of Chichigalpa. She has been strongly dedicated to this work for 12 years and has been successful with her business by achieving her objective to obtain the satisfaction of her customers. Her goal is to become an excellent trader and, for this reason, she is now seeking support from Ceprodel so that she can benefit from a loan. This will allow her to purchase vegetables so she may continue to sell them very attentively from her store in the Chichigalpa market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: María Salome

texts.es:
En el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, la señora María Salomé N. se dedica a atender su pulpería muy alegremente vendiendo todo tipo de productos como lo son comestibles, granos básicos, escobas, productos de limpieza, entre otros. 

Sus inicios fueros duros debido a que desde hace 8 años que decidió establecer el negocio, comenzó vendiendo pocas cantidades sin embargo a medida que el tiempo vino transcurriendo mejoró sus condiciones y adquirió mayores cantidades de productos para venderlos. Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para continuar en su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
In the municipal market of Chichigalpa, María Salomé N. is very happily dedicated to attending her grocery store selling all types of products such as snacks, basic grains, brooms, and cleaning products, among other things. In the beginning, it was difficult because eight years ago she decided to start the business and began selling only small quantities. Nevertheless, over time she improved her conditions and acquired greater quantities of products to sell. Today, the reason why she has sought out Ceprodel is to receive a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise and continue her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: EDITH ES SOLTERA, TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN ANTICRETICO EN LA CIUDAD, EL NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO SOBRE LA AV. PRINCIPAL DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS ATRÁS, TIENE COMPETENCIA EN EL RUBRO PERO POR SER POPULAR EL NEGOCIO EN LA ZONA TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL CREDITO FUE FINANCIADO PARA AMPLIACION DE NEGOCIO DE LICORES EN GRAL. NO TIENE DEUDAS CON OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS, SOLO CON AGROCAPITAL DEMUESTRA UN EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO.

loans.use: AMPLIACION DE NEGOCIO

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es casada, tiene 48 años,  solo vive con su esposo en su propia casa que adquirieron recientemente. Desde hace 2 años, junto a su esposo trabaja en su pequeño aserradero, donde elaboran todo tipo de mangos para instrumentos y herramientas; como picos, palas, martillos, etc. Su trabajo consiste en buscar la madera, que principalmente es el eucalipto, y los fines de semana van a repartir su producción a las principales tiendas de herramientas. También llevan grandes cantidades a la ciudad de Lima cada 15 días, para obtener mayores ganancias. Elena se encarga de la administración del taller, y es quien consigue a los clientes, que son los dueños de las tiendas. Es la segunda vez que Elena tiene un préstamo con MFP, para ella es una gran ayuda formar parte de su banco comunal, porque le permite socializar con los integrantes de su grupo y también crecer económicamente. El dinero que solicita es para comprar una máquina cortadora de madera llamada torno y está valorizada en  1800 a 2000, de sobrar una cantidad comprará madera para abastecerse.
texts.en:
Elena is married, is 48 years old, and lives alone with her husband in their own house that they acquired recently. For two years, alongside her husband, she has worked in their small sawmill where they make all types of handles for instruments and tools such as picks, shovels, hammers, etc. Her work consists of looking for wood, principally eucalyptus, and on the weekends going to sell their work to the main tool stores. They also bring great quantities to the city of Lima every 15 days in order to obtain greater earnings. Elena is in charge of managing the shop and finding the customers who are owners of the shops. This is the second time that Elena is receiving a loan from MFP. For her, it is a great help to be part of her community bank because it allows her to socialize with the members of her group and also grow financially. The money that she is requesting is to purchase a wood cutting machine named a lathe and is valued at 1800 to 2000. Any money leftover will buy wood supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Enrriqueta

texts.es: Enrriqueta tiene 56 años, vive sola con sus 3 hijos mayores en su propia casa. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de alfalfa en un establecimiento que ella misma ha provisto para que sea su centro comercial y abastecedora de alfalfa de su comunidad, ella siempre esta pendiente de las ventas y también del cortado de la alfalfa. Su trabajo consiste en arrendar tierras de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa y luego deja su follaje hasta que llega ser el tiempo apropiado para cortarlo y venderlo, para ello  Enrriqueta  controla adecuadamente los tiempos, de ahí la importancia de sembrar en distintas épocas del año para tener siempre a sus disposición su mercadería de venta, es así que prefiere alquilar tierras de cultivo que tienen a su disposición canales de riego para que sus plantaciones no corran el riesgo de marchitarse y secarse, toda esa experiencia de trabajo Enrriqueta las ha ido adquiriendo con el paso de los años y ahora está en búsqueda de expandir sus horizontes de venta. Es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, además disfruta de trabajar en equipo con su banco comunal y está agradecida porque aprendió a invertir adecuadamente su dinero. La cantidad que solicita es para alquilar más  terrenos de cultivo para que siga sembrando alfalfa y tener reservas, el terreno que alquila está valorizado entre 600 a 800 soles el cuarto de hectárea, Enrriqueta alquilara 5 cuartos de hectárea de terreno.
texts.en:
Enrriqueta is 56 years old and lives alone with her three eldest children in her own home. For three years, she has been dedicated to selling alfalfa from a shop that she herself has provided so that she is the main trader and provider of alfalfa in her community. She is always selling or cutting the alfalfa. Her work consists of leasing farm land where she plants alfalfa and then leaving her crop until the appropriate time arrives to cut and sell it. For this, Enrriqueta adequately controls the time. The importance of planting in different seasons of the year in order to always have merchandise to sell at her disposal is why she prefers to rent farm land that has irrigation canals so that her crops don't run the risk of wilting and drying. Enrriqueta has been acquiring all of this work experience over the years and now she is looking to expand her selling horizons. This is the fifth time that she has received a loan from MFP. In addition to enjoying working in a team with her community bank, she is thankful because she has learned to invest her money adequately. The quantity that she is requesting is to lease more farm land so that she can continue to plant alfalfa and have reserves. The land that she rents is valued at 600-800 soles per quarter hectare. Enrriqueta will rent 5 quarter hectares of land.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent land to plant alfalfa.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: EDITH ES SOLTERA, TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN ANTICRETICO EN LA CIUDAD, EL NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO SOBRE LA AV. PRINCIPAL DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS ATRÁS, TIENE COMPETENCIA EN EL RUBRO PERO POR SER POPULAR EL NEGOCIO EN LA ZONA TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL CREDITO FUE FINANCIADO PARA AMPLIACION DE NEGOCIO DE LICORES EN GRAL. NO TIENE DEUDAS CON OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS, SOLO CON AGROCAPITAL DEMUESTRA UN EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO.
texts.en:
Edith is single. She has one 8 year old son. Currently, they live in Anticretico, in the city. The business has been located above the Principal Avenue for many years. She is competent in this area, but to be popular the business is in a area with much demand. The loan was financed by increasing the business in liquor. She has no debts with other financial entities, only with AGROCAPITAL. She exhibits excellent credit behaviour.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow the business

loans.name: Abad

texts.es: Abad es casado, tiene 32 años, vive en la casa de su suegro con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años, pronto se mudarán a su propia casa. Él es un hombre que no se dejó abatir por los problemas laborales, ya que en un momento no pudo conseguir empleo seguro y decidió crear su propia fuente de ingreso, abriendo una  tienda de abarrotes, a la que le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, por la cual siente gran satisfacción de generarse sus propias ganancias. Abad atiende todos los días, incluidos los domingos, y junto a su esposa forman un equipo en la planificación y atención de su tienda,  cuyos planes  están siendo ejecutados; uno de ellos fue el de ampliar el espacio de su bodega y así lo hicieron, ahora su meta es abastecer de productos al por mayor. Es la quinta vez que Abad tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de seguir adelante, además es de su agrado trabajar por esta modalidad de bancos comunales. El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de mercadería; como leche, arroz y azúcar, por sacos, de esa manera no se verá afectado por el alza de precios de los alimentos. Los sacos están valorizados en 150 soles, cada uno de 50 kilos.
texts.en:
Abad is married, 32 years old, and lives with his wife and four-year-old son in his father-in-law’s house. They will soon move to their own house. Abad is a man who did not let problems with work beat him down. At one point in time he could not get steady work, so decided to create his own source of income by opening a grocery store. He devotes most of his time to this endeavor, and draws great satisfaction in generating his own profits. Abad is there every day, including Sundays. Together, he and his wife partner in planning and caring for the store, plans that are coming to fruition. One of those plans was to expand his stockroom space and they have done so. Now Abad’s goal is to stock up on products wholesale. This is the fifth time Abad has taken out a loan with MFP, and he is eager to move forward. He likes working with the banco comunal, a sort of business support group. The money that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandize, such as milk, and rice and sugar by the sack. Doing so provides a hedge against rising food costs. Each 50-kilogram sack costs 150 Peruvian soles.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in shop merchandise

loans.name: Roxmeri

texts.es: ROXMERI TIENE 3 HIJOS A LOS CUALES MANTIENE, TIENE CASA PROPIA DONDE VIVE CON SUS HIJOS. ELLA SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE ROPA USADA, EL CLIENTE YA LLEVA 6 AÑOS EN ESTA MISMA ACTIVIDAD, ROXMERI VENDE ROPA LOS DOMINGOS EN YAPACANI Y LOS OTROS DIAS EN LAS DISTINTAS FERIAS DE OTROS PUEBLOS. TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE LA VENTA DE ESTA ROPA GENERA MUY BUENOS INGRESOS, PERO TAMBIEN HAY QUE TENER MUCHO CONOCIMIENTO DE ESTA ACTIVIDAD. EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA COMO CAPITAL DE OPERACION PARA EL COMERCIO DE ROPA. LOS PRECIOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS SON VARIADOS YA QUE COMPRA DIFERENTES TIPOS DE CALIDAD DE ESTE PRODUCTO. ES SU CUARTA OPERACION Y TIENE MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO ES SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS, APARTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION TIENE CREDITOS EN UNA COOPERATIVA.
texts.en:
Roxmeri has three children whom she supports. She has her own home, where she lives with her children. She works selling used clothing and has done this activity for 6 years. Roxmeri sells clothing on Sundays in Yapacani and the other days in the various markets in other towns. She is very competent and her clothing sales already generate very good income, but also she has a lot of knowledge of this activity. This loan would be destined as operating capital in clothing sales. The prices of the products are various as she buys different types of quality in this product. It is her fourth operation, and she has very good behaviour in her previous loans. Other than this institution, she has loans from a cooperative.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
La familia F. tiene su casa en un reciente fraccionamiento al sur de la ciudad, ellos desean iniciar con las mejoras a la vivienda, y como primer punto será el piso exterior pues actualmente es terracería, la elaboración del piso de concreto es primordial pues en tiempos de lluvia no es posible transitar por allí.
El Sr. F. trabaja para una línea transportista y por lo regular está fuera de la ciudad por tal motivo no aparece en la fotografía, sólo se contacto a su esposa y a una de sus hijas. 
Son una excelente familia y esperan su colaboración para lograr lo descrito.
texts.en:
The F. family has a house in a recently built neighborhood on the south side of the city. They would like to begin making some improvements to their house, starting with the outer room, which currently just has a dirt floor. It is impossible to walk through the room when it rains, so putting in a concrete floor is essential. Mr. F. works for a transportation company and is usually out of the city, which is why he does not appear in the photo; only his wife and one of his daughters are shown. They are a fine family and await your contribution so they can achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction on outer room of their house.

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Vida Luz R. M. tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones el mayor tiene 13 años y cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo menor tiene 1 año de edad y no estudia, ha pasado por momentos muy duros y en medio de estos su propósito es ampliar su negocio para ayudar a sus hijos, mantener el hogar y prepararlos para la vida proveyéndoles estudio, vivienda y alimentación el deseo de Doña Vida es ganar mas dinero a través de este negocio con el objetivo de ampliar sus horizontes sus sueños es establecer un restaurante dividido en secciones donde hayan video juegos, una pista de baile y pueda ofrecer su deliciosa comida a sus clientes entre otras cosas, también le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa, bolsos, perfumes, joyas y zapatos pues todos estos han sido sueños que desde joven no ha podido realizar debido a su pobreza.

Actualmente Doña Vida Luz se dedica al negocio de video juegos, es decir que jóvenes, niños y algunos adultos llegan a jugar nintendo a su casa y por este servicio ellos le pagan. Su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, ubicado en el Reparto Modesto Palma, detrás del Instituto Nacional Autónomo Víctor Manuel Soto en la primera calle. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 1 año, además Doña Vida trabaja en la elaboración de sopas y venta de comidas sólidas los fines de semana como: Sopas de res con punche, sopa de queso, sopa de mariscos, gallo pinto, carne a la plancha, carne asada, bistec encebollado y muchas otras comidas que son muy típicas aquí en Nicaragua. Este trabajo le permite estar al tanto de su hogar y poder tomar el control sobre sus niños. Es por esto que Doña Vida ha solicitado un financiamiento que le permita invertir y aumentar su capital de trabajo, de esta manera la señora podrá seguir en este negocio y sobrevivir junto a su familia, quienes siempre se esfuerzan por llevar una mejor vida económica.
texts.en:
Vida Luz R. M. is 31 years old, single, and has two sons: her older son is 13 and in his second year of high school and her younger son is 1 and does not go to school. She has gone through some hard times and in the midst of these has decided to expand her business to help her children, to maintain her house and to prepare her sons for life by giving them an education, a home, and food. Vida's wants to make more money with her business so she can expand her horizons. She dreams of starting a restaurant, divided in sections where there would be video games, a dance floor and she would serve delicious food to her customers. She would also like to open a clothing store, selling purses, jewelry and shoes. She has held onto these dreams since she was young but because of her poverty she has not been able to make her dreams a reality. Vida Luz's current business is video games: young people, children and some adults come to her home to play Nintendo, which they pay her for. Her business is in her home, in the Modesto Palma division. She has had this business for one year. Vida also prepares soups and sells food on weekends, such as beef soup with crabs, cheese soup, seafood soup, rice with beans (gallo pinto), fried beef with mixed peppers (carne a la plancha), roast beef, steak with onions and many other typical Nicaraguan foods. This business allows her to be at home to supervise her children. This is why Vida has asked for a loan to invest and increase her working capital so that she can continue with her business and survive with her family who are always making efforts to improve their financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
Esta Empresaria de Nombre Claudia Mercedes Q. V. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es soltera, Claudia tiene 1 hijo de 12 años y cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria, los propósitos son seguir manteniendo la fuente de ingresos para su hogar y mantener su clientela  ya que ella es madre soltera y es la única que aporta para su familia ya que ha tenido que trabajar fuerte para sacar adelante a su hijo por lo que la situación no le permite trabajar en un lugar donde obtenga mas ingresos los deseos son expandir su negocio para dejar de vender de forma ambulante y establecer una tienda en su propia casa de habitación sus sueños son de formar integralmente a su hijo y que logre coronar una  profesión con la cual se pueda valer y que el día de mañana responda ante las necesidades que se le presenten también quiere dejar de ser subordinada para dedicarse en tiempo completo a su negocio.


La actividad económica a la que Claudia se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como: cosméticos, bolsos, zapatos, perfumes, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 7 años, ella inicia este negocio al encontrarse sola, abandonada y sin contar con alguna ayuda por lo que el dinero no le abastecía para su hijo y para los gastos del hogar así que ella tuvo que buscar la manera de subsistir, desde entonces a sobresalido ante ciertos obstáculos de la vida y espera seguirlo haciendo a través del financiamiento pues este será un respaldo para su inversión por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por que debe comprar un sin numero de productos como son: reloj, pulseras, pendientes, ropa entre otros ya que tiene que viajar hasta Managua, Chinandega y León en busca de estos para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is called Claudia Mercedes Q. V.. She is 39, single, and has a 12-year-old son in his second year of high school. She aims to keep making money and maintain her customer base as she is a single mother and the only person working in her family. She has had to work hard to raise her son as her situation does not allow her to work where she would make a higher income. She wants to expand her business, to stop working as a street vendor and to open a store in her own home. She dreams of educating her son, that he will have a career to fall back on so that he will be able to take care of himself. She also wants to stop working for others; she wants to dedicate herself full-time to her business. Claudia sells a variety of goods such as cosmetics, purses, shoes, perfumes in the street. She has been a street vendor for seven years. She started this business when she found herself alone, abandoned and unable to count on anyone else's help. There was not enough money to care for her son and her household expenses: she had to find a way to survive. Since then, she has overcome a number of obstacles and she hopes to make progress with the help of this loan, which will be working capital to buy a number of products such as watches, bracelets, earrings, clothing among others for which she will have to travel to Managua, Chinandega and León to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
Don José quiere tener a su familia bien protegida, desde que le dieron la casa no ha podido realizarle grandes mejoras, en esta ocasión se acercó con nosotros para poder elaborar la barda perimetral.
Es operador de un tracto camión y por lo regular siempre sale fuera de la ciudad, el tener resguardada su casa le dará mayor tranquilidad y confianza.
En nombre de su familia él agradece su contribución para realizar el proyecto.
texts.en:
José would like to provide security for his family. Since being given his house, he has not been able to make any home improvements. He is coming to us now so he can build a wall around the perimeter. He drives a tractor-trailer and is usually out of town, so he would feel more confident and at-peace with his house protected. On behalf of his family, José expresses his appreciation for your contribution so he can complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Maria Graciela V. M. tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es de casada, Doña Maria tiene 2 hijas de las siguientes edades su hija mayor de 22 años que trabaja por cuenta propia y su otra hija de 20 años cursa el 3 año de su carrera, su compañero de vida labora como pintor, sus propósitos son mantener una estabilidad económica para su familia debido a la situación financiera que atraviesa el país ya que el salario de Doña Maria y su esposo son la fuente de mayor ingresos que esta familia tiene para Doña Maria sus sueños son que su hija alcance una formación profesional  y que de esta manera su hija pueda valerse a si misma para hacerle frente a cualquier obstáculo que se le presente sus deseos son que sus hijas puedan tener una vivienda propia para ellas y que Dios le de salud, paz  por formar hijos de bien para la sociedad.

La actividad económica es la venta de recargas telefónicas como son: tarjetas claro y movistar, la ubicación del negocio es en su casa de habitación del tennis ½ cuadra al este, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, Doña Maria inicio este negocio con la necesidad de tener una alternativa económica adicional a su salario, dio comienzo con este negocio comprando cantidades menores a 100 dólares, con el paso del tiempo la afluencia de clientes fue aumentando, por lo que gracias  Dios, ha podido mantener estable el negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado a ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This woman named Maria Graciela V. M. is 52 years old and is married. Maria has two daughters: her older daughter is 22 and self-employed, her younger daughter is 20 and has been working for three years. Maria's husband works as a painter. She wants to ensure her family's financial stability due to the current national economic situation as Maria and her husband are the major breadwinners in this family. Maria dreams that her daughter complete her vocational training and thus become self-sufficient so that she can handle any obstacles which may come her way. She wishes that her daughters will be able to own their own home and that God will give them good health, peace to have children who will be good citizens. She sells telephone accessories such as Claro and Movistar-brand phone cards. She has had her home-based business for two years. Maria started her business because she needed an additional source of income other than her salary. She began with buying quantities under 100 dollars. With time, she has gained more customers, and thanks to God, has been able to maintain a steady business. The loan will be used as working capital in order to offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Perla Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Perla Carolina Hernández Rodríguez tiene 27 años de edad, su estado civil es acompañada, de esta union tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales el menor tiene 1 año  y el mayor 5. El niño de un año aun no asiste a clases, sin embargo el mayor asiste al 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora como contratista, Doña Perla tiene propósitos para este año, entre estos mantener su negocio y alcanzar mas recursos monetarios que le permitan la manutención de su familia por la que siempre, ha sido ella quien se ha hecho cargo su deseo es surtir su inventario para enfrentar la situación durante el incremento en el  precio de los productos que tiene para ofrecer a su diversa clientela los sueños de Doña Perla son mejorar su vivienda para dejarle a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan vivir con las comodidades necesarias además proporcionarle a sus hijos una excelente educación.

Su actividad económica es la venta productos higiénicos, belleza y pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en la casa de su Mama y la pulpería en la casa de su hermana que es la fiadora, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Perla inicia este negocio con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia es importante resaltar que es un negocio informal que poco a poco se ha ido expandiendo al visitar diferentes instituciones donde hay clientes que le compran sus productos ya sea al crédito o al contado, en esta posición Doña Perla tiene cuentas por cobrar bastante altas es por esto que desea trabajar con un mayor monto para diversificar su producto en calidad, marcas y cantidad y lograr así sus propósitos deseos y sueños, el motivo de su financiamiento es para incrementar su capital de trabajo y alcanzar sus metas establecidas para este año por lo que agradece a fundación león 2000 y otras organizaciones amigas que ayudan a contribuir a esta causa.
texts.en:
Perla Carolina Hernández Rodríguez is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children, a 1 year old and a 5 year old. The youngest is not going to school yet, but the oldest is attending Preschool. Her life partner works as a contractor. Perla has several goals for this year. One of them is to maintain her business afloat and to make enough money to support her family as she always has. She would like to stock her inventory now before the prices start to rise up, in order to continue offering a large variety of products to her clients. Perla also wants to make home improvements so her children can have a better place to live in the future. She also wants to provide her children with a better education. Perla sells grocery products and hygiene and beauty products. She owns two shops, one is located at her mother’s house and the other one at her sister’s house who rents her the place. She’s been in the business for 4 years. Perla started her business to support her family expenses. It is important to mention that this is an informal business that has been growing with time, since she started visiting different places offering her products. Now, she has regular customers, who purchase her products in cash or with credit. Perla would like to be able to buy larger amounts of products in order to diversify her stock in quality, makes and quantity. This way, she will be able to fulfill her dreams. With this loan, she would like to increase her work capital to reach her goals for this year. She is very thankful for the support received from “Fundación León 2000” and to other partner organizations that have helped her with her cause.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 32 años, vive solo con sus tres pequeños hijos; Bladimir de 9, Yanira de 7 y Mery de 6 años, se divorció de su pareja hace algunos años, viviendo actualmente en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, sale desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para adquirir el pescado que necesita para vender y así mantener a su familia, realiza esta labor desde hace ya 14 años, tiempo en el cual se ha hecho una experta en el negocio, gustándole, ya que es un trabajo digno y tranquilo que le ofrece la oportunidad de brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. El negocio va bien y es muy rentable, pero muchas veces le resulta muy cansado, y el olor de pescado es difícil de quitar, pero Beatriz es muy persistente y espera crecer más en su negocio para salir adelante y poder forjar un futuro mejor para ella y sus hijos. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy responsable y puntual en lo pagos, ya que no quiere defraudar a las personas que confiaron en ella. Beatriz espera mejorar en su negocio y con el préstamo obtenido quiere comprar pescado en mayores cantidades y así aumentar sus ingresos, invirtiendo todo su préstamo en ello.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 32 years old and lives alone with her three small children: Bladimir, age 9; Yanira, age 7 and Mery, age 6. She divorced her husband a few years ago and currently lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She is a very hard-working woman who goes out early in the morning to get the fish she needs to sell and in this way supports her family. She has done this work for 14 years during which time she has become an expert in the business. She enjoys it because it is honorable and quiet work, although sometimes is it tiring and the smell of fish is hard to get rid of. But Beatriz is persistent and hopes to grow the business so that she can get ahead and provide a better future for herself and her children. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she has been responsible and on time with her payments since she does not want to disappoint the people who have put their trust in her. Beatriz hopes to improve her business and with this loan wants to buy fish in greater quantities so that she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of fish she buys for resale.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela tiene 54 años, es natural D. la península D. Capachica, vive sola en su casa propia, ya que es viuda y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica desD. hace 28 años a la venta D. papa en el mercado Cerro Colorado, uno D. los más concurridos D. la ciudad D. Juliaca. La venta D. papa ha significado para Marcela su motivo D. vivir, ya que al no tener hijos se dedica netamente a su negocio para alejar la soledad y mantenerse firme. Durante estos largos año ha venido trabajando muy duro y a pesar D. su soledad ella sabe que hay un futuro por delante, es por eso que sigue constante, logrando que arroje buenos frutos y sea muy rentable. Marcela se encuentra en su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy responsable y  puntual en lo pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más arrobas (12kg) D. papa, para aumentar sus ventas y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcela is 54 years old, a native of the Capachica peninsula, and lives alone in her own home. She is a widow and has no children. For the past 28 years she has sold potatoes in the Cerro Colorado market, one of the busiest in the city of Juliaca. Selling potatoes has been the focus of Marcela´s life and because she had no children she has devoted herself completely to her business in order to relieve her loneliness and stay strong. During these long years she has worked hard and, in spite of her loneliness, she knows she has a future ahead of her which is why she keeps moving along, achieving results and profits. Marcela is in her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and has been very responsible and on time with her payments. With the money she requests she will buy more sacks of potatoes so she can increase her sales and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of potatoes she has for sale

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es:
Claudia Yesenia V. Álvarez no se ha cambiado a su casa poco a poco fue realizando  arreglos como ponerle protecciones pero la dejo sola por un tiempo y le robaron hasta las ventanas. Ahora ella recurre a nosotros para pedir un préstamo para comprar todo lo que se necesita para proteger su casa y que no le vuelva a suceder. Ella solicita un préstamo de $3,000 pesos
Ella se dedica a ejecutiva de ventas el cual tiene un ingreso muy bien pagado el cual para bien la cantidad otorgada.
texts.en:
Claudia Yesenia V. Álvarez had not moved into her home and little by little was making repairs, such as installing security bars, but she left the house alone for awhile and was robbed and even the windows were stolen. She is turning to us to ask for a loan so she can buy what it needed to protect the house so that this does not happen again. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 pesos. She is a salesperson and has a good income sufficient for the loan granted.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy security bars for her home.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando Ramírez M.  es una persona que piensa en su hija el cual esta preocupado por su estado de salud el la ha llevado con un ortopedista. El cual  ha pedido que le compre unos zapatos de acuerdo  a su problema el cual no cuenta con dinero para pagar al contado. La cantidad que solicita es de $3,000
Su esposa trabaja en una constructora donde se dedica a  vender casas y Fernando trabaja para una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Fernando Ramírez M. is a person who thinks about his daughter and, concerned about her health, took her to an orthopedist. The orthopedist asked that he buy some shoes to take care of her problem, but he does not have the money to pay for them. He is requesting 3,000 pesos. His wife works for a builder who sells houses and Fernando works in a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy orthopedic shoes.

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es:
Héctor Eduardo A. B. va hacer padre pos segunda vez, su esposa en el embarazo ha tenido algunas complicaciones le han pedido reposo. El quiere llevarla aun doctor particular el cual le daría mejor atención y mayor información de su estado y también se ve en la necesidad de preparase para el parto. El solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos
El es el único sostén de la casa y trabaja como promotor de  ventas de sistema de cable.
texts.en:
Héctor Eduardo A. B. is going to be a father for the second time. His wife has had some complications with her pregnancy and has been ordered to bed rest. He wants to take his wife to a private doctor so that she can receive better care and information on her condition and he also needs to prepare for the birth. He is requesting 7,000 pesos. He is the only support for his household and works as a sales promotor for a cable television company.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio C. Z. necesita un préstamo para pagar la luz llego el recibo con una cantidad muy alta a la que normal paga y con esta crisis de Enero no completa para pagar su servicio de Luz ya que para el es muy dispensable. Con lo poco que le sobre utilizara para arregla un cerca que tiene en su casa. 
El trabaja como tablajero en una carnicería muy conocida en la ciudad y con estos ingresos pagara la cantidad prestada.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio C. Z. needs a loan to pay his electricity. The electrical bill was much higher than usual and because of the crisis of January he was unable to pay the electricity, which he is able to do without. For what little electricity he will need, he will make arrangements with a neighbour. He works as a cashier in a well-known butcher shop in town and he will repay the loan from his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the electrical bill

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem S. is 20 years old and sells dried oysters in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She finds oysters in the river, dries them to sell, and earns around US$ 1 per day. She is married to Nget, 23, who is a bee hunter and sells the honey he finds. The young couple has one child and they work hard every day to support their family. Bee hunting is one business of Cambodians that can generate revenue to help support a family. Normally they explore for bees in the forest near their village.

To alleviate her husband's business difficulty and increase family income, Yoem S. needs a loan to purchase a second motorcycle to use as transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle to use as transportation

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
Mrs. P., 54, is a widowed rice farmer who lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice since 1988 because rice farming is the main source income for her family's living expenses. She cares for four children, all of whom are single and are living in the family home. One of her sons carves wood from the forest and sells to regular customers.

With a view to growing her son's business, P. would like to request a loan to purchase two buffaloes to use as transportation and with any remainder she would buy piglets to raise for extra income.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes to use as transportation and piglets to raise

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mr. R. is 65 years old and sells Cambodian traditional baskets; he lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He works making baskets to sell with his wife from their house and earns around US$ 3 per day. The baskets are made of bamboo and used for store rice, also popular for Cambodian farmers. He is skilled in making baskets and has been working at the business since 1995. He sells to his regular customers who give him orders. He has four children, two of whom are married and live separately. The other two are single- one is studying at university; one daughter works in a garment factory.

To increase production, R. would like to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials to make baskets. R.'s wife is shown in the photo because he was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make baskets

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is a 40-year-old rice farmer, while her husband, Mr. Mut is motorcycle taxi driver. The couple lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom are teenagers. Currently, her husband's business is going down because his motorcycle is often broken. Hence, S. would like to ask for a loan to change her husband's motorcycle to attract customers.

loans.use: to change her husband's motorcycle

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
S., 36, makes baskets to sell from her house. She is married to Phdeak and has five children. They live in Siem Reap Province. Her husband is a construction worker who earns around US$ 2.50 per day. S. and her husband work hard every day to generate revenue to support the family's living expenses. And her two daughters help to earn income by working as construction workers.

To reduce costs for transportation, S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use in their family for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: This is a small group with four members, and S. is the leader. S. is 25 years old and sells groceries out of her house in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She's married to Bo, 33, who is a motorcycle taxi driver in the town. Her business is going well because the location is in a crowded area. She has two children, both of whom are small. To expand her business, S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 46 years old, widowed, and grows vegetables to sell in Veal Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are single (one daughter and one son). Her daughter is employed as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City and her son works providing battery recharge service in the village. To improve her vegetable crop and increase income, she needs a loan to purchase a pump machine to use.

loans.use: To purchase a pump machine to use

loans.name: Tao's Group

texts.en: This is a group loan of five members, and Y. is the leader. Y. is 40 years old and grows vegetable crops to sell. She works at growing crops with her husband and cares for one child. Her business is going well, earning around US$ 3 per day, for all her hard work. For another source of income, Y. needs a loan to purchase piglets to raise. She expects the loan help to increase her family's income. These people all live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Baing

texts.en:
