Her family relies on their rice farm for their income, and she always tries to improve the business. To improve their future life, V. is requesting a loan to purchase a cow to breed. In the future, the cow and its calf will help with the physical labor on the farm.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to breed

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S., 64, raises cows. She learned how to raise cows from her parents. Now, she is a widow who must manage the  business by herself. She started raising cows 15 years ago. The income from this business has been a big help in paying for the education of her children. Her children help her raise the cows. Teresita also owns a rice field. But because her family is huge, sometimes, the harvest is not enough for the entire family.

Teresita has requested a loan from CEVI to purchase cow feed for her cows and fertilizer for her farm. Through this loan, she hopes to have a quality harvest in her farm and healthy cows for sale. 

CEVI is proud of how Teresita raises her family and sustains her business. Today, Teresita enjoys the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage  that CEVI provides to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy cow feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
“I am the provider and breadwinner in the family,” says Federico P., a 57-year-old father from South Cotabato City. “I have to meet all my family's needs and I work hard to help my children achieve their dreams,” he said. “It's my prayer to really uplift our lives. I will do whatever I need to do to have my children graduate from college and let them pursue fruitful lives,” he added. 

Federico is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase all kinds of feeds and rice for retail. Through this, he believes that he could really support his family, especially his children's educational needs. He runs his business by himself, and his wife is very supportive of him in this endeavor. He started his business in 1997 with only Php 25,000 capital (less than $500 USD). Now, he wants to make it grow by purchasing additional merchandise so he can earn a bigger profit.

CEVI has been supporting Federico for a couple of years already. Being part of the program has let Federico enjoy the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase feed and rice for sale

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov S., age 35, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community for profit. He is currently earning an average of $4 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is married and the father of three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Mout Saveun, is a local rice farmer. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals for family. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.

Mr. S. works hard every day to earn an income to buy food for his family and especially make sure his children receive the highest education. Recently, he can't attract his customers as before because his motorcycle is always broken. Because of this obstacle, S. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace his old one.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to replace an old one for his taxi motorcycle service

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion T. is a rice grower. During harvest, she sells her rice to traders in their hometown. She is a 51-year-old mother of one child. Her husband and son are working their 1-hectare rice field. They never complain about working under the heat of the sun while they plow the field. Farming is their main source of livelihood. This is where they get enough money to pay for all their needs. 

Salvacion is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer. Through this loan, she believes that they can double their yield. In this way, they will be able to send their son to college and meet the needs of their family. Salvacion also  wants to try another line of business to augment their income. This loan will help her to sustain their farm and to start a new business.

Salvacion is one of the many clients served by CEVI. CEVI offers credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services to the poor.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira A. is a 50-year-old mother of five children. She is a rice grower. She uses her rice for the family consumption, and then she sells the excess to rice traders to earn something for the family. While they are waiting for the next harvest, Elvira grows corn and vegetables in their yard. In this way, they have an alternative source of income to enjoy. She a hardworking mother who handles their family budget efficiently. She wants a good life for her children, and she doesn’t mind working all day to fulfill that dream.

Elvira needs a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. Considering that she also has a corn and vegetable garden in their yards, she really needs fertilizer to ensure good yields. Through this loan, she believes she could double their harvest and could sell more rice, corn, and vegetables to traders in their hometown.

She is happy about being part of the CEVI microfinancing program. Through CEVI, she has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. C., 31, is a rice farmer in Sala Village in Siem Reap Province.  She has been farming since 1993 and currently makes around KHR4000 (US$1) per day. She works growing rice with her husband and this is the main source of income for the family's needs. She cares for three children who are young teenagers attending school. To gain another source of income, C. needs a loan to build a pigpen and to purchase four piglets to raise and sell.

loans.use: to build a pigpen and to purchase four piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda P. is a vegetable grower. Everyday she waters and cultivates the soil that surrounds her plants to make them grow healthy so she will be able to sell them all at quality cost. She is 48 years old and has three lovely children. Her husband is a rice grower. Together, they spend their lives growing crops to have enough food for the family. Farming is their life, and all the money that they earn comes from the proceeds they get after selling their crops. Aside from sending all of their children to college, they dream of having a stall where they can display all their produce. In this way, they will earn a bit bigger profit from their business.

Ma. Linda requested a loan from CEVI to purchase the needed fertilizer for their farm. Through this loan, she believes she will meet their plans of having a good harvest. She is also looking into some other possible income areas to contribute to the family income.

CEVI is happy about how Ma. Linda manages her business. Ma. Linda has made use of the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Koeng

texts.en:
Koeng T., 42, lives in Kandal Province where he owns and runs a pigpen next to his home. The pigs he raises can be sold to the slaughterhouse within three months after he begins to raise them. He can make several sales each year.

His wife, Mom Chantha, 35, works in the garment industry and currently earns between 80 and 90 US$ per month.  They have three children, all single.  One daughter works with her father, raising the pigs.  Another daughter contributes to the family's food needs by also working in the garment industry. 

Mr. Tong recently sold all of his pigs and hopes to acquire others to raise and sell.  He will add the loan money to his savings to buy more piglets and to buy materials to distill wine to sell, as an extra source of income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is a hard-working business lady. She is 43 years old and she is married with 4 children. Gladys is a tailor in Kampala town. She is popular because she is good at making Ugandan traditional outfits ("gomes").

Her courtesy coupled with her 10 years' experience have earned her the loyalty of her customers. The loan is enabling Gladys to purchase more fabric to meet the demand of her customers. She dreams of opening up a fashion and designing school and also of building a modern home for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more fabrics

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret K. is 38 years old. She is a hard-working business lady. Margret is married with 2 children, both of them in school. She has a retail shop in Tula center. With a need to boost her business, Margret is using the loan proceeds to purchase rice, sugar, bar soap, salt, flour, and cooking oil so as to meet the demands of her ever increasing number of customers. Her dream is to open up a supermarket, hoping that the income from the business will enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, bar soap, salt, flour, and cooking oil .

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael N. M. is a hard-working businessman. He is 48 years of age, a loving husband and father to 5 children who are all in school. He has 5 years' experience in selling fuel (petrol and diesel).

Due to scarcity and skyrocketing fuel prices, Michael is using the loan proceeds to increase his stock of petrol and diesel so as to meet customer demand. His ambition is to open up a fuel station with large fuel reserves. It is the income from the business that enables him to provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase petrol and diesel fuel for re-sale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is a hard-working business lady. She is 38 years of age and a married mother of 4 school-going children. Annet has 3 years' experience in selling cosmetics. She rents a shop in Gayaza where quality products and good customer care have earned her an awesome number of customers.

To meet the customers’ increased demands, she is using the loan to purchase lotions, deodorants, perfumes, and creams. Her dream is to open up a beauty parlor in the heart of Kampala city. The income from the business enables her to help her husband in caring for the family.

loans.use: Purchase lotions, deodorants, perfumes and creams for re-sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter W. is 39 years old. He has 12 years' experience in metal fabrication. He is skilled at making doors, windows, gates, metal fence poles, and metal beds among others. Peter is using loan funds to boost his business by purchasing more metal bars and sheets of metal.

He is a loving father of 5 children, of whom 4 are in school. Peter has great ambitions! If he gets access to enough capital, he dreams of setting up a steel-rolling company. He uses the income from the business to take care of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing more metal bars and sheets of metal

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five people who live in Bek Chan Commune, Kandal Province. The group leader is Mrs. Pen T. who is 48 years old. She is a local cultivator who specializes in vegetable crops, including cabbages and cucumbers, and sells them to a seller at the market three months after planting. She is married to Doul Eoeun, 50, who is a local construction supervisor. He has employees to provide his building service and started his operation in 1990. He currentL. earns an average of US$3 per day. The couple has six children; one of them is employed as a garment worker. Pen T. is applying for a loan to purchase construction materials for her husband to use for his business activities.

The other four borrowers are as follows. Khan P., 48, is a farmer and she requests a loan as capital for her husband to enlarge his house-building service. Ros S., age 48, sells groceries and she needs a loan to buy a range of grocery items to sell. Nhol N. is 44 years old and is a garment worker and needs a loan to purchase a motorcycle to ride to work. Sun Ky, 20, is a grocery seller and she is applying for a loan to buy additional groceries to store and re-sell.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija N. is a hard-working business lady. She is 48 years old, married with 4 grown-up children. Hadija has 2 years' experience in selling fabrics such as silk, cotton and linen.

She is using the loan proceeds to replenish her stock of fabrics especially silk and cotton. Her dream is to become a fabric wholesaler in Kampala city. The income from the business enables Hadija to give her husband a hand in providing for the family.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics especially silk and cotton

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil K. is a hard-working businessman. He is 45 years old and married. He is a loving and caring father to 3 school-going children. Jamil has 5 years' experience in the retail business and he is based in Kawempe.

He is using the loan proceeds to replenish his stock of sugar, flour, rice and soap. His business has enabled him to care for his family. Jamil’s dream is to open up a wholesale shop in Kawempe.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, rice and soap for his little store

loans.name: Nazaket

texts.en:
Nazaket S. is 42 years old and the loving mother of three children. Her eldest son is already a student and her younger two daughters are going to school. Nazaket and her husband dream that their children will finish higher education. 

Nazaket sells foods, such as candies, sugar, tea, and cheese. She has been in this business for eight years. Nazaket is a very polite and a cheerful woman by nature. That is why she has her bulk buyers, which allow her to have a stable income for her family. 

Today she is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more food products. She promises to repay the loan in 15 months. Nazaket sincerely expresses her gratitude to all her lenders! Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength and hopes to achieve a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for her store

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido P. runs his own poultry business. He is 60 years old and has six children. His wife is managing a small store to contribute to the family income. All of his children are already married.

Poultry farming is a dirty but a noble work. Everyday he takes good care of his chickens. He requested a loan from CEVI to purchase feed for his farm animals. Through this loan, he believes he will have a better income and be able to employ additional workers to help support his married children. In this way he can provide jobs to other people so they can also earn a living.

“Our life is just too short, we need to invest it well,” he said. “I’m happy now because I see my grandsons. I want to give my grandchildren a good future by helping my children established their own families,” he added.

CEVI is an organization that helps people realize their dreams. Through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides, people like Bienvenido start to build the future for their love ones.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan Q. is 42 years old and is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many others in his grocery store, which he built five years ago. 

Currently, Ramazan has about $1000 USD of goods in inventory. His monthly net profit is about $150. Ramazan is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, sacrifice, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Phok

texts.en: S. is 21 years old, married and has a one year old child. She supports her family by farming rice.  Her husband, 26, sells carving wood that he takes from the forest and transports to customers' homes.  The business is going well, but she currently uses her parents' oxen.  She has applied for a loan to purchase two oxen, and this will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen

loans.name: Khamayil

texts.en:
Khamayil F. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of three adorable children. 

Khamayil has a grocery store that she manages herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home. She opened her small business five years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income. 

Since its inception, the business has been gradually growing. In order to grow her business, she is requesting a loan of $1200 USD. Khamayil is planning to spend the loan to purchase more goods, thus increasing the range of her goods. She promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everyone who has decided to support her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and to improve shop conditions

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu V. is a very hardworking woman who knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has eight children! 

She works by raising and feeding sheep with the goal of later selling them. This activity makes her feel satisfied, because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her youngsters. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce mutton in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. 

For this reason, she’s requesting a loan of $1200 USD for 15 months to buy 10 sheep and fodder. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim U., 53, lives in Siem Reap Province where he has owned a plot of land since 1979. He grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons.  He is married and has three children.  One child is single and two are married.  One of his children is working in Thailand as a construction worker.

His wife, Nhem Sar, 54, works with him in the farming business and this is their main source of income.  Because the dry season is coming, Sim U. needs a loan of US$500 to pay to have his farmland plowed.  The loan will help to increase the farm's income and sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay to have his farmland plowed

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina H. is 47 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two wonderful children. Her husband is a farmer and does not earn enough to support the family. So she has been running a grocery store for the past 13 years. The food inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and variety. Sakina is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Sakina is seeking to keep her business strong and has requested a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sakina reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: increase inventory by purchasing more goods

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif S. is a hardworking man that strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and four children.  He manages a grocery store where he sells many staples, such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods.  Having started this business ten years ago with less than $100, Akif has attracted a strong base of customers that are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase valuable items.  In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Sakina is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD.

loans.use: Purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran K. is 48 years old. He is married with children. He started his own business 12 years ago because his salary as a driver was not enough to meet their family's expenses. Kamran sells candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income he generates allows Kamran to support his large family, including his parents, who live with his family. Kamran dreams about providing all of his children with higher education. Today he is requesting 1200 USD for 15 months. He is going to spend the loan to expand the range of goods in his confectionery store. He is planning to spend the income to build a private store, as well as for educating her children. Kamran thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase more food in order to increase his profit

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en: Rakhila N. is 48 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Rakhila breeds calves and cows. She buys the calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and resells them at the same market for a more profitable amount. Her husband also helps with this business. Rakhila works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family. Now, Rakhila is planning to purchase three baby calves to raise and then sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. Rakhila would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

loans.use: Purchase three calves

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona M. is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of one son. Sona has a grocery store that she attends to herself, in addition to caring for her family and her home. She began her small business more than 10 years ago with financial support from her husband and parents. She started her business to increase her large family’s income, and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to expand her business and improve her store, she requests a loan of 1200 USD. Sona plans to spend the loan on buying more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her goods. She promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everybody who has decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchase and diversify food products

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: Elnara K. is a very hardworking woman who knows each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of selling them later. She enjoys the feeling of owning her own business and contributing a significant amount to the family income. She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable little son. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce more meat in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to buy two cattle. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: Purchase two cattle

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: Anver K. is a 39 year-old married man who lives with his daughter and owns a small farm. Anver has a business raising and selling cattle, with more than 15 years of experience in this field. Because cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Anver has become a very successful businessman in a very short period of time. He works very hard and spends all his time with the cattle; cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Anver wants to expand his business and buy more calves, so he has applied for a loan of 1200 USD. He promises to repay the loan within 15 months and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Anver can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase more calves

loans.name: Prosy

texts.en:
Prosy N. is 28 years old and a responsible mother to 4 children, all in school. She has 2 years' experience in the retail business. She mainly sells fast-moving consumer products.

The loan is helping Prossy to replenish her stock of maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and paraffin. Her dream is to open up a supermarket and educate her children up through university.

loans.use: Purchase maize flour, rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, and paraffin for re-sale

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza A. is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got the idea to start raising cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available on their land for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband. Slowly, the number of cows increased and her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan. Be an important part of the growth of Aziza’s business.

loans.use: Purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret S. is 29 years old and her husband, Khoun Ne, is 34. They make a living as cultivators, as well as raising pigs at their home. Since 2007, they both have been earning an income of approximately $5 per day. The couple are the responsible parents of one lovely young child who is a minor. 

Recently, S. and her husband sold all their pigs to the slaughterer. They now hope to buy additional piglets to raise, and have therefore decided to ask for a loan of US$200 to purchase more piglets and pig food.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise for sale, and pig food

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila A. is 50 year old woman who has bred sheep for the last ten years. Naila and her husband are very responsible parents of their four dear children, and they work very hard breeding sheep so they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. Naila has been working in agriculture since getting married. She and her husband buy and sell sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, Naila now finds herself with more expenses than income, and she would like a loan in order to increase production. Naila and her family are counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep and fodder

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en: Yadigar A. lives with his wife and three daughters. Yadigar has been breeding livestock for more than 15 years. Thanks to this activity, he can cover his living expenses. He goes out every morning to graze his animals. He enjoys caring for his animals, and he is grateful that this work puts food on the table for his children. Yadigar’s family is his greatest love, and they are the biggest motivators in his life. He will use the loan to purchase young cattle, which will revitalize his herd and help him become the best breeder in his area. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Khafiz

texts.en: Khafiz M. is a hard-working man. Over the last 13 years, he has been focused on strengthening the family business – sheep sales – so he can provide for his children. Khafiz has a wife and three daughters who always try to help each other and to help him with the business. Now Khafiz has decided to expand his business raising animals in order to increase his profit. He will care for the animals for a short period of time and then sell them at his city's large stock shows. Therefore, he has requested 1,200 USD for the term of 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Karam

texts.en: Karam K. is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. He is 51 years old and married with four children. Karam raises livestock, and he uses his income to support his family’s expenses. He has a great appreciation for animals and Karam wishes to increase his sheep count, and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan. You could become an important part of his family's life. Karam deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Aytekin

texts.en: Aytekin S. is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her four children. Aytekin works diligently caring for cows at a facility in her home, which she then sells at various fairs in the area. She shows the same dedication to the small creatures that she shows to her small children, and, in a short amount of time, they have provided her with excellent earnings. She is eager to increase the capacity of her animal care facilities to accommodate a greater number of animals. With your strong support, she will be able to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en: Takhmina K. is 33 years old and is married with three children. Since she has lived with her husband, she has bought and sold cattle. She has engaged in this business for the last five years. Now Takhmina wants to expand her business and as her children are growing up she thinks that she will be able to sell more cattle with their help. She is requesting 1200 USD for the term of 15 months in order to purchase two more calves. Takhmina expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng năm nay 25 tuổiChị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị  là chăn nuôi và lương thợ xây của chồng với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Để mở rộng chăn nuôi thời gian tới chị Hồng mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ về đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 25 years old. She has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2001. Currently her main family's source of income comes from raising animals and her husband's wage from construction work, totalling 4,000,000 VND per month (about 233 USD per month). In order to expand her farm, Mrs. H. wants to borrow 15,000,000 VND (or 875 USD) to fix the farm and buy more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim C. is 59 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She owns a plot of land where she grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is married and has five children: four are single and another one is married and lives away from the family home. To help meet some of the family's needs, four of her children are employed. Two are construction workers and the other two are rice harvesters. Her husband works with her in the farming business.

In the past, C. has always hired a cow from a farmer in order to plow her farmland. Now, she hopes to buy her own cow, and therefore needs a loan to purchase the cow, to plow her field and to raise its offspring.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that has four people and Mrs. S. is the leader. They live in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  S. is 39 years old and runs a small business as local money lender in her village. She normally borrows money from HKL at a low interest rate and then lends a little money to her neighbors in whom she has confidence, and charges higher interest. Her business has gone well. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and can earn around US$3.20 per day. She has two young teenage children. 

To expand her business and increase her income, S. needs a loan to use as capital for her local lending business.

loans.use: to use as more capital for her local money lending business

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Seap T., 26, lives Siem Reap Province, Cambodia and runs a little grocery store at her home. She sells items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has many years experience in this business. She is married to Mr. Heam Thach, 33, who is a taxi driver and uses his car to transport passengers and merchandise. He earns an average of US$5 a day from his business. The young couple has one child who is a lovely baby.

Recently, Mr. Thach has had difficulty attracting many clients because he has had frequent problems with his old car. Therefore, after discussions with his wife, they decided to ask for a loan to repair the car. Any remaining money would be used to buy gasoline.

loans.use: to repair their car - used as a taxi

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is a 50-year-old pig grower from Banga, South Cotabato City. She has three children and a big dream to succeed in her business. She wants her children to finish a college degree. Through this, she believes, her children will get a stable, high paying job in the future. 

She started her business with one sow. She tried her best to make it big. CEVI helped her to get started with her business. She is happy with that, because finally, she is able to contribute well to the family income. Her husband has just retired from his work. They now work together, and they work very hard to address the needs of their family.

Julieta is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase feed for the pigs. She will also use the loan to add more piglets. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her business. This loan will help her to expand her business and earn a much bigger profit for her family.

CEVI helps Julieta sustains her business. CEVI has provided Julieta with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S. is 39 years old and is a rice farmer in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She grows her crop twice per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She has been farming for a long time. She is married and the mother of three teenage children, all of whom are students. Her husband, Lim Sokha, is aged 47. He earns a living by driving a motorcycle taxi and is also a bee hunter who sells the honey he finds. Normally he explores for bees in the forest. His motorcycle is Sokha's main way to earn money. Unfortunately it has broken, so he and his wife are applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the existing one and thus fulfill his customers' requirements.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.en:
Homidjon B., 24, is married and has a business baking “lepeshka”- the national bread. The family's main income earner, Homidjon operates a profitable business that is not subject to seasonal fluctuations.  Purchasing the necessary ingredients of flour, salt, and yeast at the local market, he arises early each day to bake the lepeshka so that people can enjoy it fresh on their tables for breakfast. 

Due to high customer demand, Homidjon wants to increase production volume and so is requesting $600 for a term of 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase the flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka.”  

Homidjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Sadly, however, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. 

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Mrs. P. is 33 years old and sells grocery such as vegetable, meat, and food ingredients in her village of Srokthom in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been selling since 1999 and can earn around US$3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Bros, earns around US$5 per day working as a construction worker. Currently, her business is going well because she has good communication in the village. She cares for three children, all of whom are small young teenagers. In order to expand her business, P. needs a loan to purchase groceries to sell and remaining buy piece of land to fulfill in dirty place to be good place for attractive customers.

loans.use: to purchase grocery to sell and remaining buy piece of land to fulfill in dirty place for business

loans.name: Abdoulaye's Group

texts.fr: cette association regroupe de jeunes chauffeurs de taxi urbain de mbour qui pour ameliorer leur condition de vie et de travail font des cotisations journalieres de 100f cfa .les sommes  ainsi collectées sont déposées dans un compte d' épargne.Elles leur permettent de s 'entre-aider .Chaque fois qu 'un membre de l 'association a une cérémonie familiale (mariage decée bapteme ou meme probleme social),l'association lui donne une somme pour l 'aider.l 'association veut renforcer ses revenus en diversifiant ses activités par la création de nouvelles activités génératrices de revenus  comme la location de bache pour les fêtes.les revenus tirés de l'activité iront dans le financement des actions sociales de l associaton
texts.en:
This association pools together young urban taxi drivers of Mbour who, in order to improve their living and work conditions, each pay a daily membership fee of 100 francs CFA. The money collected is put into a savings account and enables the members to render mutual assistance to one another. Whenever an association member has a family event (marriage, death, baptism, or even a social problem), the association gives him an amount of money to help him. The association wants to boost its revenues by diversifying its income-generating activities, such as tarp rentals for holiday events or celebrations. The income derived will go towards financing the assciation's purpose.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en:
Nazirjon D. is 26 years old. He is married with two kids. Nazirjon is a market vendor. He sells men’s jackets, jeans, and casual-look garments in the local market “Somon-bozor” of Kairakkum city. Over a year of working at the market, Nazirjon already has got enough experience to do his work successfully and has customers who always come to him.

Nazirjon is trying to satisfy the needs of all his customers with various tastes and income levels. Nazirjon’s kids are small now but already today he is working hard in order to give them a good education and to make them happy. Today Nazirjon is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting US$ 800 for a term of 11 months. Nazirjon promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him. Your generosity can change their lives. Be an important part of the growth of Nazirjon’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchasing  new goods to sell

loans.name: Abdurafik

texts.en:
Abdurafik is married with two kids. He’s a market vendor from Khujand where he sells men’s suits, trousers, shirts, and ties at the famous Kairakkum market “Somon-bozor”. Abdurafik is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor, and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business.

Abdurafik has been running his business for many years. He was only 12 when he started to help his mother with her market business, then afterward when he became an adult, he started his own business. In general he has 12 years of experience selling clothing. Currently, Abdurafik is requesting a loan of 800 USD to increase his inventory. He promises to repay the loan within 11 months. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to sell

loans.name: Kok

texts.en: Mrs. C., 34, is a grocery seller in Takhmao town market and generates revenues of around $10 per day. She works selling with her husband and has been since 2005. Her business is going well because of its good location. She has one child who is young and in school. Because her motorcycle is getting old she needs to change it. She is asking for a loan to add to the money she has saved to purchase an new one.

loans.use: to add to the money she has saved to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Leam

texts.en: Leam S., 37, sells groceries in a small store next to her house and she can earn an income of US$2 per day to support her daily expenses. She currently lives in Banteay Meanchey Province with two children, both single.  Her husband, Touch Yana, age 38, is a motorcycle seller. He buys motorcycles to fix and sells them for an income. To earn extra money and to improve the business, S. has requested a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.  The remainder of the loan will help her husband expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of four members, all residents in Chong Kneas Commune, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. In S. has been selected as group leader by the members. She is 54 years old and since 1990 has earned a living by catcH. fish with her 55 year old husband Klok Doeun. In and around Tunle Sap Lake they use nets and traps to catch fish to sell at the market.  They currently earn an income of around US$3 per day. The couple has four children.  Two are single and the other two are married and live away from the family home.  One of their single children assists them in the fisH. business.  Their current living conditions are not good; the house is damaged and too small for them.  They are asking for a loan to buy wood to repair their old house.  

The group has three other members.
Rin H., age 36, sells fishes in the market and requests a loan to enlarge her business.
Roeurn S. is 33 years old and is also a fish catcher. She is applying for a loan to buy more building materials to finish her house.
Dorm S. has been catcH. fish for sale. She is 29 years old and is applying for a loan to purchase additional fisH. tools for her business. (S.'s husband is pictured, because she was not available to have her photo taken.)

loans.use: to buy wood to repair their old house

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar E. is 54 years old. She is married with three children. Sanobar sells fruit. She purchases fruit in the central market of Khujand city at wholesale prices and sells it in Isfara town, which is located near this city. Being 10 years in the business, Sanobar has found good suppliers as well as customers. The business is successful, generating a considerable income, allowing the family to improve their living conditions.

Currently Sanobar is requesting 1000 Somoni (300 US Dollars) for a term of 8 months. Sanobar is planning to purchase various fruits in order to enlarge the range of goods she sells. She promises to be accurate and precise in the loan management and repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing fruit in order to enlarge the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith Alajid raises goats to support her family. Aside from paying the school fees, she was able to pay for the needs of her children as well as their other bills like electricity and water. Her husband  works as a casual employee in the government, but his earnings are not enough to support the family. 

Goats are easy to sell today, so this motivates Judith to do well in her business. That is why she requested a loan from CEVI to purchase additional goats. With this loan, Judith believes she will be able to make a bigger profit and and be better able to support her family.

CEVI helps hardworking people like Judith through their micro-financing program. CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, which helps the clients to improve and grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase three goats

loans.name: Zarinakhon

texts.en:
Zarinakhon E. is 23 years old. She is married and has one child. Zarinakhon has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing traditional women's dresses. Her workmanship is very good and being young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business.

Zarinakhon has had this business for 3 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, Zarinakhon will buy more material for sewing dresses. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for sewing women's dresses

loans.name: Gal Dasta Group

texts.en:
Gal Dasta is the group leader of Gal Dasta group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for her own business.

Shajan and Gal Dasta want to take a loan for their businesses and the other member would like to take a loan for her tailoring business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and earn more money to support their families better.

They say that these loans con be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: further their individual businesses

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
Muslima F. is 47 years old. She is married and has three children to whom she wishes to give the best. Muslima is very dynamic and cares for her family. She is a market vendor. She sells different kinds of hair accessories for girls and women in her little store.

Muslima tries to give her family as much money as possible to be able to cover the expenses of schooling and university for her children, as she is dreaming of allowing all of them to be well-educated. Today Muslima wants to expand her business and to increase the working capital to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 2500 Somoni (725 USD) for a term of 11 months. Having been loaned sums by IMON six times and having demonstrated herself to be an accurate client, Muslima promises to manage this loan with accuracy. Let’s support this dedicated mother so she can make her dreams become reality!

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase the range of her inventory

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat H. is 34 years old. She is a divorced mother with two children. When her husband left her, she was left without steady income. Supporting her family on her own was very difficult. With the purpose of improving living conditions, she decided to start her own business of processing dried clingstone apricots and selling them at the local market. The business went very successfully after starting and now Farogat needs a loan in order to meet her customers' demand. She is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) for the term of 11 months for purchasing still more apricots. Farogat feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her children can stay in school and have a bright future.

loans.use: Purchasing apricots for processing and sale

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en:
Munavvar N. is 45 years old. She is married and has a child. Munavvar has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her business 4 years ago with financial support from her husband. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since.

In order to grow her business still further, Munawar is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (725 US Dollars). Munavvar is planning to spend the loan on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of goods of her grocery. She promises to repay her loan within 6 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing goods to expand her inventory

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita O. is already 31 years old, married to Argie who is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). They were blessed with two children: Trisha Mae – 8 years old, grade III student, and Angeline – 2 years old. Though apart from her husband, Marcelita does not consider the distance as a factor affecting her emotional aspect; instead, she considers it as a challenge to pursue what they have started in their family and keeps on holding her trust to her husband towards the progress of their lives.

While her husband works abroad, Marcelita has also established a little business in their village where she is able to earn at least PHP 580 in weekly income. The business started up three years ago and it’s been good enough to cover some of the needs of the family. As of the moment, Marcelita wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 in order to sustain the business for the future of her children. She believes that her husband's working abroad is not for a lifetime, thus she prefers to invest in her business. She is now managing and developing her business for sustainability and hoping to support their current and future needs. Also, according to Marcelita, she only needs to be patient to succeed.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en: Bakir A. is 42 years old and married with two sons.  His family consists of five people, including his parents, two sons and wife.  To earn a living, Bakir sells food products and has been in this business for eight years.  In addition, he raises cattle; currently, he owns a cow to provide milk for his family.  These two businesses generate most of the income for Bakir 's family.  Already popular in the neighborhood for selling fresh eggs, Bakir, nevertheless, would like to increase the range goods he can offer.  Therefore, Bakir is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD for a term of 15 months in order to be able to purchase more food products for sale, as well as improve the life conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase more food products to increase profit

loans.name: Rakhib

texts.en: Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Azerbaijan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables.  Rakhib M. has been selling fruits and vegetables in a small village of Sabirabad city for the past ten years.  He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings, as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur.  Rakhib began selling in the newly built shop on central street with very little stock to offer his clients.  Slowly, he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall.  Rakhib is a father of two adorable daughters that are in school.  Like any father, he is doing all he can in order to ensure his children the best future and make them well-educated.  Now, he needs a loan of $1,200 USD in order to increase his stock of goods.  He promises to repay the loan within 15 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for sale

loans.name: Mavlidakhon

texts.en:
Mavlidakhon T. is 48 years old. She and her husband have raised three children. For 20 years already, Mavlidakhon has been working in the largest local market in the city. She sells green lentils and peas. These legumes are very popular in Tajikistan. Thery can be cooked in soups or used to make porridge; both are very nourishing, healthy, and tasty. So that the business is very stable and generates a stable income for the family, today Mavlidakhon is requesting 1500 Somoni (450 US Dollars) for a term of 8 months. The loan willl be spent for purchasing green lentils and peas to re-sell. Mavlidakhon thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
