loans.use: Purchasing green lentils and peas for re-sale

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en:
Khasan S. is 51 years old and married with four children.  Khasan is a market vendor.  He has been selling fruit and vegetables for the past 13 years.  During these years, Khasan acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.  For instance, he knows how to store fruit to maintain their marketable conditions and preserve the taste and other useful properties.  He sells fruit and vegetables such as: apples, pears, pomegranates, carrots, tomatoes and potatoes in the central street of his village.  Khasan begins his workday early morning at 5:00 AM, buying vegetables and fruit from local farmers.  

People across the building always come to Khasan to buy fresh fruit or vegetables; he is well-known because of his attractive prices and friendly customer service.  All this allows Khasan’s business to generate a stable and considerable income stream for his family.  Due to the current season, Khasan’s goods are in high demand.  For this reason, he is planning to purchase new, fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.  Today, he is requesting a loan for $1,200 USD that will allow him to expand his business. With your help, this expansion will be possible.  He promises to repay the loan within 15 months and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz R. is 38 years old. He is married and has two adorable kids. His wife keeps the house and takes care of the kids. 
In order to support his family, Avaz sells clothes for men and children. He has been in this business for nine years. Avaz has a wealth of experience and he is able to choose goods that meet the needs of his clients whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Avaz to improve the living of his family. 
Today, Avaz requests 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. With the loan, he is planning to purchase new suits to sell and thus increase his range of goods.

loans.use: purchase more clothes inventories

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor Y. is married and has three children whom he is very proud of since they are fighting to get ahead. With the faith that his children should go to college to get ahead, he started a business processing and selling dried apricots to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. This is why he started this business 14 years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business and that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Mukhtor is requesting 1500 Somoni (450 USD) for a term of 8 months. He is going to spend the loan on purchasing dried apricots for processing and sale. With your help, Mukhtor will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and are honorable people.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricots for processing and sale

loans.name: Mammad

texts.en: Mammad M. has been an agricultural producer for his whole life. He is the father of two sons and he is focused on their education. His wife is a very hardworking woman who supports Mammad in his production activities in order to improve their lives. Mammad raise vegetables such as tomatoes and cucumbers all year; on the photo you can see a hot house where he raises vegetables during the cold season. Mammad applied for a loan of 1200 USD to improve the hot house and purchase mineral fertilizer to raise more vegetables for sale. This loan will allow him to go on with his business and support his family.

loans.use: improve hot house and purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Judy Lee

texts.en:
Judy Lee P. grows pigs for a living. Now that she is 38 year old, she is thinking of some other possibilities to stretch their limited budget. She has two children who are less than five years old. She is dreaming that someday her children will be able to graduate with a college degree. In this way, life will be easier for them when they grow up. Her husband is a farmer. She and her husband both work very hard to sustain their family and to provide for the needs of their children. 

Judy started with only one piglet in their backyard. After that one, she tried raising more pigs and selling them directly to a buyer from Davao. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase more piglets. In this way, she believes she will earn a bigger profit and she will be able to send both her children to school. Specifically, she will use the loan to expand her business.

CEVI is an organization that helps people achieve their dreams in life. With the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage CEVI gives its clients, more and more people are able to grow and sustain their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en:
Mirza K. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and four children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 20 years, and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, above all getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets. 
Mirza keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, along with his wife who help him with caring for the animals. Now Mirza needs a loan of 1200 USD for purchasing more cattle to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan K. is 31 years old. He is married with two children. His wife looks after the house and the kids. Rovshan supports his family by breeding cattle which he sells for meat. He has been in this business for the past 8 years.

Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income needed to allow Rovshan to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now Rovshan is planning to buy two baby calves and fodder to speed up the raising process. Rovshan is requesting a loan of 1200 USD over a term of 15 months.

loans.use: purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Sayad Jan Aaqa Group

texts.en:
Sauad Jan S. N. is the group leader of Sayadjan group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a small loan for his/her business.

Zakara and Sauad Jan S. want to take a loan for purchasing tailoring materials for their businesses. Nadara wants to take a loan for her fruit cart business. And Marzya wants to take a loan for electric equipment for her husband’s shop. They all want to expand their businesses so they can progress, and they are really happy with these loans that can support one to expand her/her business.

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor people in this country.

loans.use: to expand and enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en:
For 13 years, Shamil M. has been raising cattle, as well as growing potatoes and carrots. His wife and oldest son help him with looking after the calves. Shamil is planning to spend the income he generates from cattle activities to pay the fees for the education of his children, as he has three of them.

Shamil also has an old car which he uses to take people from his village to the local bazaars or nearby villages. But their main source of income is calf-breeding. Shamil is planning to purchase two cows for breeding. He also wants to improve the winter conditions for his cattle, because this year it is unusually cold in Azerbaijan. For this purpose, Shamil is requesting US$ 1200 for the term of 15 months. Shamil is counting on your help.

loans.use: purchase two calves to raise

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar A. is 51 years old. He and his wife have three children and they live in a small village near Sabirabad city. In order to support his family, Bakhtiyar purchases cattle for breeding and then he sells them for meat. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. His eldest son is grown up enough to help his father in his business, which is the main source of income for the family. Bakhtiyar is requesting a loan of 1200 USD in order to purchase two more calves and the necessary fodder. The loan will be paid back over the next 15 months.

loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Mirzakhan

texts.en:
Mirzakhan P. is a 59-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Mirzakhan has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases cattle in the local market and then he fattens and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them.

Every day, Mirzakhan gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Mirzakhan says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Mirzakhan would like to expand his business and purchase two baby calves and fodder. For this purpose, he has applied for 1200 USD and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

loans.use: purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Khoshavar

texts.en:
Khoshavar H. is a 43-year-old woman, married with three children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been an ongoing and difficult task for Khoshavar. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of livestock. She started this business 10 years ago with the support of her husband.

Now that Khoshavar has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge in this business, she would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Khoshavar is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. She has agreed to repay this loan within 15 months. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dream become a reality.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa K. is 53 years old. She is married with 2 children. Latifa is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Fourteen years ago, she got the idea to start breeding sheep to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband.

Slowly the number of sheep increased and her customers started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of sheep she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Be an important part of the growth of Latifa’s business!

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Muazam

texts.ru:
Саидова Муазам 1956 года рождения, вдова, имеет 4 иждивенцев. Начала свой бизнес 1994 году. Она занимается торговлей детскими одеждами. В бизнес ей помогает дочка. Муаззам  закупают товар на оптовом рынке «Корвон», реализует на рынке "Шохмансур" города Душанбе. Ассортимент ее товара состоит из зимних брючек, футболок, курточек и шапочек. Время от времени она сама привозит товар из Бишкека. 
Муззам хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, чтоб закупить детских пуловер и брюк.
texts.en:
Muazam S., born in 1956, is a widow with four dependents. She began her business in 1994, and trades in children's clothing. Her daughter assists her with the business. Muazam buys goods at the Korvon wholesale market and sells them at the Shohmansur market in the city of Dushanbe. Her goods range from winter pants to shirts, jackets and caps. From time to time she herself brings goods from Bishkek. In order to buy children's pullovers and pants, Muazam hopes to receive assistance from Kiva in the form of a 6-month loan of 3500 somoni

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's pullovers and pants

loans.name: Zebijon

texts.en:
Zebijon is a hard-working woman and since 2005 has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Kanibadam. She characterizes herself as happy and humble. She started her business with savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. She is the mother of 2 children whom she would like to offer an education as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood working at hard labor. To realize this dream, Zebijon is now requesting 1000 Somoni (300 USD) for the term of 6 months. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buying more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Loreta R. is a pig grower. She engages in this business because she enjoys doing the work and she finds it profitable enough to support the needs of her  family. She has four children who are all in school. She wants to send all of them to college because she believes that when they graduate, they will be able to find better jobs. Her husband is a rice grower. They use part of the harvest for the family consumption and they sell the rest to  traders. Loreta thinks that growing pigs is a better way for her to contribute to the family income. She is happy about how her business is going.

In 2000, Loreta started her pig business with only one sow. She wants to grow her business, so that is why she is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase feed for her pigs and to to increase the size of her pig pen. In this way, she hopes to earn enough money to pay for their food, clothing, and other needs.
 
CEVI supports hard working entrepreneur like Loreta. Because of the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides to its clients, many people are able to build their own businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Bibihawa Group

texts.en:
Bibihawa is the group leader of the Bibihawa group. There are three members in this group. They would each like to receive money for their businesses.

M. Hamid and Bibihawa want to take a loan for their general stores. Anesa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. They all want to see progress in their businesses and they all want to receive a loan for their business progress and they want to make their business larger.

They want to say that loans can help them progress in their businesses and make their businesses larger. They all thank Kiva for aiding the process of small loans in Afghanistan that supports poor people in this country.

loans.use: to make their businesses larger

loans.name: Zaib-Un-Nisa Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
My name is Zaib-un-Nisa. I am 40 years old and married. I have resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Borewala is famous for its warm and kind hearted people. 

I completed my education until 10th standard, and then married a kind man named A. G.. My husband is a security guard in a company. He supported my wish to study further, but I didn’t get to study because my presence at home became essential. 

We have three children, two sons and one daughter. My eldest son completed his education until 10th standard and then started his own business. He runs a grocery shop in the community, where people buy groceries. My youngest son reads in 9th standard and my daughter reads in kindergarten. I belong to an embroidery business. I do this work to pay off the school fees of my younger children. 

I’m happy to share the financial burden of our family with my husband and son. I am applying for a loan to buy groceries to increase the profits for my son. 

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for her loading business. Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Hamidan Khan Muhammad Group

texts.en:
My name is Hamidan and I’m a 48 year old widow. I have resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. I own a two room brick house in the city.

My husband’s sudden death was a great shock to me. He was the only source of income in the family. For a time, I completely lost my senses, but when I looked at my children, I knew I had to live for them. I started knitting clothes and selling them in the market. I did this work for 10 years. With the revenue from this business, I started a cloth selling business for my son. His business is now going well by the grace of God. My younger son and my daughter are getting education from a local school which is located near the house.

I am applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand my son’s cloth selling business.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Ghafooran baji and Khalida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy seeds of different plants to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.en:
Ayubjon S. is 42 years old. He is married with two children. Ayubjon is an energetic man who loves agriculture, which he has done passionately for 10 years. He lives in Isfara, a semi-urban area about 110 kilometers away from the center of Sugd region – Khujand city. With this, his first loan from KIVA, he hopes to grow more crops and have a better overall yield. In so doing, he will contribute to the betterment of his family's living conditions. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. married very early. This hindered her from finishing her college education as BS-Secretariat. However, she never regrets her decision to marry. She is happy today raising her three children who are already in high school. Her husband is a rice grower, Everyday he tills the land and plows the field to prepare the soil for the planting season. Her husband  works diligently in their 1-hectare farm, which she inherited from her parents. She considers herself lucky because he married a man who is willing to provide for all their needs.
 
Arlene is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and chemicals for their farm. Through this loan, she will be able to help her husband triple his harvest. She will use the loan to sustain their farm business. In this way, she believes that she will have enough food for her family and extra harvest to sell in the market. She is also considering some other possible income areas to augment their income.

CEVI believes that the poor are bankable. Through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services that they provide to all their clients, they make a lasting impact and improve people's lives.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Azra Ibrar Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Azra. I am 49 years old and married. I live in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. I own a two room brick house in the city where I have lived for the past 25 years. My husband's name is I. H.. He is a driver by profession. He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has 15 years of experience. I am a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. My eldest son is an electrician. My middle son works in an office. My youngest son reads in 2nd standard. My eldest daughter reads in 3rd standard. My middle daughter reads in 2nd standard. My youngest daughter reads in kindergarten.

It’s my wish to give my children a good education, because I truly believe that education is the key to success. If a person takes advantage of education they can achieve their goals. To achieve my wish, I earn money with the skill of sewing clothes. I get orders from my relatives and my neighbors. I have used the income to pay the school expenses for my children.

I am applying for a loan to buy repair tools for my eldest son, so that he is able to repair electrical items easily.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Nasreen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Zaitoon baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repair tools to repair electrical items

loans.name: Nasreen Akbar Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen. I am 42 years old and married. I live in a city of kind hearted people named Borewala, Pakistan. I have lived here for the past eight years. My husband's name is A. A.. He runs a juice corner in the food market.

I am a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of my kids are getting education from a school which is located near my house. I am involved in an embroidery business. I make embroidered dresses to order and charge $3 per dress. I do this work to pay off the school fees for my children.

I am applying for a loan to buy another juice machine and seasonal fruits, so that my husband can earn a good income and attracts more customers.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another juice machine and seasonal fruits for juice corner

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo P. is a rice farmer. Her life is in the land. Everyday she and her husband till and plow the field. They never mind working all day, touching the dirt, feeling the heat of the sun just to have enough food to eat for their family. When she was young, her parents taught her everything they knew about farming. Today, she uses all that knowledge to produce a better yield to support themselves and their seven children.  

Consejo is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In this way she will be able to improve their yield. In addition, she will use part of the loan to help her get started in another line of business. Through this, they will have an alternative livelihood.

Like other CEVI clients, Consejo now enjoys the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage services CEVI provides.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anwar Sultana M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
My name is Anwar sultana. I am 55 years old and married. I live in a city of kind hearted people named Borewala, Pakistan. I have lived here for the past 20 years. My husband's name is M. A.. He is a fruit seller by profession, and has sold fruit for the past 10 years. I help my husband to pack fruit in cartons. I have one son who is a contractor by profession. He takes building construction jobs on contract.

I am applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruit to expand my husband’s fruit selling business.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Khurram hussain baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy jewelry to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit for selling

loans.name: Nusrat Begum Ghulam Hussain Group

texts.en:
Nusrat begum baji is 46 years old and married. She resides in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived here for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is G. H. and he is a driver by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Nusrat is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is a mason. The other boys are getting education from a school near the house. Nusrat begum baji is employed in an embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses and sells them in clothing markets. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.

Nusrat has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan again to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband, so that he is able to keep all of the money that he earns.

Nusrat is a group leader of some women in her locality. Allah rakhi baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sakina baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 19-year-old, engaged man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Hassan has been working as a barber for five years. He has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a chair for his salon. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

The loan has influenced his life in a good way by increasing his income. Hassan is special in his work because his salon is well positioned. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Hassan decided on his business because he has good experience in it and moreover, he does good work. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a chair for his salon

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Mohamad has been working as a tiler for five years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a generator for his business. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

The loan has influenced his life in a good way by increasing his income. Mohamad is special because he is particularly good in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. In the future, Mohamad plans to purchase a tile machine.

loans.use: to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora de Nombre Johana Patricia G. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Johana tiene 2 hijas su edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 17 años cursa el 1 año de estudios generales y su otra hija de 12 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria, sus propósitos con este nuevo crédito es de satisfacer su demanda ya que con ello depende su ganancia por consiguiente tiene que proporcionar el aporte económico al hogar   sus sueños son de adquirir una vivienda propia por que en la que habita actualmente es de su Mama su deseos es sacar a su hijas adelante por lo que su importancia es que sus hijas logren tener una buena educación para que proporcionen progreso para nuestra sociedad y al país.


La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 9 años, Doña Johana inicia este negocio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos ya que tenia a su familia a cargo y tenia que cumplir con la responsabilidad de proporcionarle a sus hijas lo necesario por lo que decide ofrecer ropa y cosméticos por lo que sus clientes eran trabajadores de oficina y  empresas locales por lo que decide incursionar en este negocio pero decide empezar con pocos productos como lo es camisas, pantalones y perfumes y es así como obtiene este medio de trabajo por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar compras en los diferentes departamentos por lo que no quiere perder a sus clientes por no ofrecer lo que estos le piden ya que su mayor interés es obtener mas mercadería para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Ms. Johana Patricia G. is 36 years old and single. She has two daughters, one of whom is 17 years old and has one year of general studies, while her other daughter is 12 years old and has six years of primary education. The purpose of this credit is to meet the demand that already exists since she depends on the profits of her business to support her home economically. Her dream is to acquire her own home because she currently lives in the home of her mother and would like her children to gain a better life. Getting a good education is an important part of her children's progress and for society and the country. Ms. Johana's economic activity is the roaming sale of cosmetics and clothes. She has worked in this business for nine years. Ms. Johana started this business because of the necessity of having an income stream to care for her family and to meet the responsibility of giving her children basic necessities. She decided to offer clothes and cosmetics because her clients are office workers at local businesses. She started with just a few products such as shirts, pants and perfumes and in this manner was able to obtain work. She now needs working capital to purchase products from different departments in the country, since she doesn't want to lose clients if she cannot offer them the products they request and her main goal is to obtain a greater variety of merchandise to offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kosar M. Zubair Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is 38 years old and married. She resides in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived there all her life. Her husband's name is M. Z.. He is a watchman in a school.

Kosar baji is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a daily wage laborer, but he knows how to drive an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), and has three years experience driving one. The other children are getting an education from a school located near their house.

Kosar baji stays at home and sews clothes, taking orders from her neighbors and relatives. She charges $2 per dress. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband as his salary is insufficient to fulfill the needs of the family.

Kosar baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son.

Kosar baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy ladies shoes for her shoe selling business. Yasmeen baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a television and a refrigerator on installments for her electronic items shop. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Rehana Kosar Shafqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Rehana kosar baji is 39 years old and married. She resides in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house where she has been living with her family for the past four years. Her husband's name is S. A.. He is a blacksmith by profession, and makes iron boxes. People come to him to buy iron boxes. An iron box is used for collecting various heavy items (e.g. rich heavy quilts, heavy blankets, and heavy utensils).

Rehana kosar baji is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are getting an education from a local school near the house. Rehana kosar baji helps her husband in cutting iron rods into shape. They both do this work to give their children a better education and future.

Rehana kosar baji is applying for a loan to buy iron to increase her husband’s business.

Rehana kosar baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies to resell. Azizan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rafia baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron boxes

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives in Baurci Moldoveni and has been dealing with agriculture for many years, cultivating cereals, vegetables, and grapes. Currently, she has 2.3 hectares of agricultural land and 0.8 hectares of vineyard of the Moldova type. Production is carried out on the local market as well as in the town.

She works together with her husband and children to care for the land and raise the crops. The S. family has been doing farming for many years. They do not have any other loans from Microinvest. They want to buy a plot of land located near the town center, near a water source. This client is thinking ahead; she realizes that the land purchased will endow her children. She has two boys. Theirs is a profitable business, in compliance with technology; in general the business covers some 60% of family needs.

In the future they want to increase the area planted with vegetables and vineyards, whose culture is more profitable.

loans.use: increase the area planted with vegetables and vineyards

loans.name: Gulnar Samina Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Gulnar samina baji is 23 years old and is married. She resides in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house where she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. She completed her education until 8th standard, but couldn’t study further because of her father’s low income. Her husband name is A. G.. He is a mason.

Gulnar samina baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. None of her children go to school. Gulnar samina baji and her husband couldn’t afford to send their children to school because of their low financial resources. Her husband has decided to start a new grocery shop business. He chose this business because he has two years of experience in this work.

Gulnar samina baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for starting a grocery shop in the community to improve their living standards.

Gulnar samina baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy electronic items (refrigerator and television) on installments for her electronic items shop. Mahmoodan baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Syeda baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Yasmeen M. Wakeel Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is 30 years old and married. She has lived in the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Her husband's name is M. W.. He is a loader by profession, and loads various items (e.g. cement and sand) on his donkey cart. He has been doing this work for the past four years.

Yasmeen baji is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son reads in 3rd standard and her youngest son reads in 2nd standard. Yasmeen baji is a hard working lady. She gets up early in the morning to help her boys get ready for school. She prepares them breakfast and takes them to school. Fortunately, Yasmeen baji runs a canteen in the same school. She does this work to pay for the school expenses of her sons and to share the financial burden with her husband.

Yasmeen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a new loan to buy material (chips and biscuits) for her canteen.

Yasmeen baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Amna baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy material (sugar and tea) for her tea stall. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy switch boards and wires for her electrical shop. Shazia latif baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and creams for her parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chips and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Anwar Sultana M. Suleman Group

texts.en:
Anwar sultana baji is 48 years old and married. She owns a two room brick house in the city of Vehari, Pakistan where she has lived with her family for the past 35 years. She got married after completing her education until 10th standard. Her husband's name is M. S.. He is a tailor by profession and has been running a tailoring center in the market for the past three years.

Anwar sultana baji is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her daughters are getting an education from a school near their house.

Anwar baji is a seamstress and sews clothes, taking orders from neighbors. She charges $2 per dress. She invests her income in a committee, and is planning to buy an electric sewing machine from the committee funds.

She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her son, so that he is able to keep all the money he earns.

Anwar sultana baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Suraiya baji, Khalida saleem baji, Sakina baji, and Razia baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Khalida Parveen Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen baji is a 46-year-old married lady. She has resided in a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 35 years. She is an uneducated lady. She mentions the reason: she belongs to a very poor family, who could hardly buy food from their income, so how they could they pay her education expenses? She is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he has a scrap business. He collects scrap (plastic bottles, waste papers, and rough wooden furniture) and then sells it.

Khalida Parveen baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school which is located near their house. She promised herself that she would give her children a good education so that they could get respect from people. And to achieve that promise she does embroidery on dresses on order; she gets the orders from her neighbors. She successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy electric tube lights to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Zahida Parveen Mukhtar Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Zahida Parveen baji is a 32-year-old married lady. She is a citizen of a city called Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband's name is M. A. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. She is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. Her elder daughter is in 3rd standard and her younger daughter is in 2nd standard. Her son is in kindergarten.

Zahida baji is a very devoted and hard-working lady. She does her duty as a wife and as a mother effectively. She does stitching of dresses for her neighbors and charges a fee of US$ 2 per dress. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her children. Her family is very happy with her devoted attitude and warm feelings. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Firdous baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable-selling business. Kaniz Fatima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Courage Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K., Abdul K., Fatmata K., Koloneh S., and Mohamed S.. They named their group Courage. These entrepreneurs have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. The previous loans have had meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu K. (left) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is 30 years of age. She was born in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a local court chairman. The 2 of them have 2 children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II) and the other is in class VI. She has been in business for 6 years now. Kadiatu sells firewood, plastics, water, and gara lappers (locally dyed clothes).

With this loan of Le 1,000,000.00, Kadiatu will use it to buy one truck load of firewood and 3 “pieces” (a piece is about 30 yards of white cotton used in making the gara lappers). A truck load of firewood costs Le 500,000 in a village called Madit, about 5 miles from Makeni. A piece of “brillian” (the white cotton is called brillian) costs Le 80,000. She will use some of the remaining sum to buy inks, powder, and soda and pay workers who designed the clothes with different styles.

So far, Kadiatu faces no major challenges in her business. Business is going fine for her, and she enjoys doing it.

With the profit she makes, Kadiatu uses part of it to repay her loan, pay her children’s school fees, and do things that make her life happy.

loans.use: To buy a truck load of firewood and 3 pieces of "brillians"

loans.name: Ramzana M. Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Ramzana Baji is a 39-year-old married lady. She owns a 2-room home in the city of Vehari, Pakistan, and has lived in it with her family for the past 8 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a mason by profession. Ramzana has 2 sons. Both of her sons are getting education from a school that is located near the house. Her husband has no fixed income. He can only earn income when he gets a contract to construct a building. So she helps him by doing stitching and embroidery. In Pakistan it’s a big trend to wear embroidered clothes. And by the grace of God she knows how to make embroidery on dresses. Her art gives her a good income which helps her husband with the other financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, which would allow her to make more dresses and earn income.

She is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Kosar Baji and Rehana Baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local 3-wheeled motor vehicle). Manzooran Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Begum Amna Baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels for selling. Rubina Baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for making embroidered dresses

loans.name: Shamim Haider Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Shamim, and I have resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. I am an uneducated lady because my parents couldn’t bear my educational expenses. I married a man whose name is H. A. and who runs a tea stall in the community. He has a good reputation with the people. People come to him for tea. He charges Pak rupees 5 for 1 tea cup. I have one son whose name is Imran A.. Imran is a very intelligent boy. He always stands first in his class and teachers admire him for his efficiency. He reads in 6th standard. I have my own grocery shop, and I started this shop 3 years ago. I used my front yard for the grocery shop. I enjoyed myself in doing this. We both work independently but our vision is the same. Our son wants to be a doctor in the future. I am applying for a loan to buy groceries, e.g. sugar, rice, and cooking oil and spices to diversify my grocery shop into a grocery store.

I am a group leader of some more women in my locality. Safia Baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth selling business. Nasiban Baji wants a loan to repair her vehicle named “Shahzore” for loading. Naziran Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Hamidan Baji wants a loan to buy goats for her goat-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Korneliya

texts.en:
Korneliya is married with 2 kids. Her family is an average Ukrainian family of 4 with many basic needs of 2 growing kids. Korneliya and her family live in Mukachevo next to Green market. She sells souvenirs, crystal, and dishware items from a small retail store in a favorable busy location of her home city. Korneliya has been in business for 6 years. Her turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnas.

Korneliya is an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. She seeks to expand her business and help her children find their place in life, as she believes this is her responsibility as a mother. Korneliya is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnas to increase her stock and her sales as a result.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan S. is married. His family lives in Korolyovo. Ivan sells household chemicals in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Small ventures like Ivan’s become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Ukraine. Ivan’s business has helped him survive when financial recession hit Ukraine again in 2000. Ivan has been in the trade for 5 years. Currently, his inventory amounts to 40,000 Grivnas; his income is about 5,000 Grivnas a month.

Ivan’s business is characterized by stability and positive performance. Inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and other household chemicals. Ivan wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnas to increase his turnover capital. He is hoping to boost further development of his business with this additional assistance.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Begum M. Yaseen Group

texts.en:
'My name is Begum and I am a 43-year-old married lady. I have resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 50 years. I am married to a man whose name is M. Y. and he is involved in a clothes-selling business, having experience of 15 years.  I have one daughter who is settled in her own house. I help my husband in his clothes-selling business. He sells clothes in clothing markets and I sell clothes in my community. Mostly people in my community give me orders for clothes to buy.  I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more clothes to expand our business. 

I am a group leader of some more women of my locality.  Salma Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business. Fatima Baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Sharifan Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for her loading business. Yasmeen Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.'

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 21 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive en casa de sus parientes, ya que aun es soltero. Se dedica a la repartición de gas (para las cocinas) a domicilio, en motocicleta recorre las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca  en busca de un mejor porvenir, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años para poder mantenerse, ya que al terminar sus estudios secundarios y no tuvo muchas oportunidades de seguir con los superiores, es por eso que se dedica tanto a su trabajo, pues sabe que gracias a él sale adelante, también está buscando prosperar estudiando una carrera técnica, para lo cual no dispone de mucho tiempo. Lo más difícil de su trabajo y un poco peligroso es tener que correr con su moto por las calles de Juliaca para llegar a tiempo a las casas de sus clientes cuando se lo solicitan. Él se encuentra en su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, sabiendo de la importancia de su responsabilidad, es muy puntual en los pagos. Para bienestar de Fredy el negocio va bien y las ganancias son buenas, pero espera mejorar, por ello, con la cantidad que solicita comprará más balones de gas y así distribuirlos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 21 years old and is from the city of Juliaca. Since he is still single, he lives with relatives. He earns a living by delivering gas (for kitchens) to people’s homes. He crosses the city of Juliaca on his motorcycle, looking for better opportunities. He has done this for the past 3 years in order to support himself. When he finished high school he didn’t have very many opportunities to continue with higher education so he is very dedicated to his work because he knows that thanks to his job, he is getting ahead. He is also looking to study a technical field that won’t take too much time. The most difficult and dangerous part of his job is speeding through the streets of Juliaca on his motorcycle in order to arrive on time at his clients’ houses. This is his 4th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Realizing that this is an important responsibility, he is always on time with his payments. Luckily for Fredy , business is good and his earnings are good, but he hopes for something even better. To improve his business, Fredy will use this loan to buy more gas tanks to distribute.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas tanks

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive solo en un cuarto que alquiló cuando llego a la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que es de un distrito llamado Cabana que queda a una hora de la ciudad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, como mantas y frazadas, debido a que no tuvo posibilidades de lograr estudios superiores por las carencias económicas de su familia, se viene dedicando a esta labor desde hace 5 años, en los cuales ha ido progresando poco a poco para lograr ingresos económicos. A William le gusta mucho lo que hace, gracias a eso tiene esperanzas de un futuro mejor, él suele trabajar desde muy temprano y guarda su mercadería mucho más tarde para lograr mayores ventas, teniendo que soportar las inclemencias del frió por las noches y el fuerte calor por las mañanas, pero William siempre se esmera más y más, ya que sabe que todo sacrificio obtiene una recompensa. Él es un nuevo socio en su banco comunal, es así que se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos, ya que agradece la oportunidad brindada y no piensa defraudar a las personas que están confiando en él. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de frazadas para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y progresar en su negocio.
texts.en:
William is 20 years old, single, and lives alone in a room he rented when he arrived in the city of Juliaca. He is from an area called Cabana, about an hour away from the city. He earns a living by selling clothing, blankets and covers. Due to his family’s economic situation, he was unable to continue studying. For the past 5 years he has worked and progressed little by little to earn a salary. William really likes what he does, thanks to this job he has hopes for a better future. Normally he starts work very early and packs up his merchandise very late in order to increase his sales. He has to endure the cold at night and the strong heat during the day, but William always does his best because he knows that every sacrifice has a reward. He is a new member of his community bank and is applying for his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He will be very punctual with his payments because he is very grateful for this opportunity and will not disappoint the people who trust him. With this money he will increase the number of blankets to sell in order to increase his earnings and help his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Edu

texts.es: Edu tiene 19 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en el pueblito de Cabana, a pocas horas de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive solo en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Se viene dedicando al negocio de la venta de casacas desde hace 5 años, ayudaba a su familia en el negocio familiar, y es así que con todo lo aprendido decidió poner su propio negocio con el cual espera salir adelante, y progresar. Le gusta su trabajo porque es muy tranquilo y tiene independencia para realizarlo, a pesar de su juventud Edu es muy responsable en su trabajo y quiere hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro tener una familia a la cual brindarle solo lo mejor. Edu trabaja sin descanso durante todo el día, y como le pone mucho entusiasmo, termina agotado, pero se siente feliz porque sabe que es joven y aun puede dar mucho de sí. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y se ha comprometido a ser muy puntual en los pagos, con la responsabilidad que lo caracteriza. Con el dinero solicitado comprará casacas al por mayor para lograr mejores sus ingresos para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Edu is 19 years old and is a very hardworking young man. He lives in the small town of Cabana, a few hours away from the city of Juliaca. He lives alone in the home his parents left him. For the past 5 years he has earned a living by selling coats. He helped with his family business and with everything he learned, he decided to start his own business, which he hopes to grow in order to get ahead. He likes his work because it is calm and he has the freedom to complete his work. Even though he is young, Edu is very responsible with his work and wants to increase his business. Someday he will have a family and he wants to be able to give them the best. Edu works without breaks during they day, and since he gives it a lot of effort, he ends up exhausted. But he feels happy because he knows that he is young and still has a lot to give. This is his first loan with Microfinanaza Prisma and he promises to be on time with his payments since this is a known responsibility. With this loan he will buy coats at a wholesale price in order to increase his earnings and his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es madre soltera, vive con sus 4 hijos; Joseph de 16, Mabel de 13, Flor de 11 y Bryan de 8, en su propia casa. Esta luchadora mujer saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos trabajando muy duro en la venta de autos, los cuales compra en ciudades aledañas, refaccionándolos y vendiéndolos a mayores precios. A Esperanza le gusta su trabajo, ya que gracias a él puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor, siendo además muy rentable, además que también puede dar empleo a terceras personas, la dificultad reside en tener que viajar constantemente para adquirir los autos, y refaccionarlos toma tiempo. Esperanza se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo una mujer muy responsable en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado dará mantenimiento a un auto que compró para venderlo, es por eso que invertirá para dejarlo como nuevo y obtener un buen precio.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a single mom who lives in her own home with her 4 children: Joseph, 16, Mabel, 13, Flor, 11 and Bryan, 8. She fights for her children to get ahead and works very hard selling cars. She buys them in nearby cities, fixes them up and sells them at a higher price. Esperanza likes her job because she is able to help her children and give them a better future. It is also profitable for her and she has 3 employees. The difficult part of her job is that she has to constantly travel to purchase the cars and it takes time to repair them. This is Esperanza’s first loan with Microfinanazas Prisma and she will be very responsible with her payments. With this loan money she will fix up a car that she bought to sell. The car will end up like new and she will get a good price for it.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair cars for resale
